review_content:
Hey you...
Yeah you, the Person reading this.
Do you like Invictus, Invictus Aqua, Invictus Intense?
Or Armaf Aura, Armaf Rixos, Armaf Oros?
What about King of Seduction or King of Seduction Absolute By Antonio Banderas?
Ahhh Zeus by Kelsey Berwin?
Hmmm...how about Azzaro Wanted or Freeride?
And Rasasi Hawas?

Did you say yes to any of those...Then you'll love this sexy bitch.
A must have.
This is a lovely scent.
I have all of those scents, I mentioned from before.
It smells amazing, I don't know why I love this sweet aquatic mixture In a fragrance.

Sweet, aquatic, spicy, woody, muah...loevly.
Perfect for the hot times during the year.
And wearable during the cold time.
This scent is bad ass and about half the price of Invictus.

I used six sprays...both wrist, back & front of my neck, chest, and front of my shirt.

Will I buy this again?...Yes.

Does this fragrance enter BEAST MODE, good, just okay or weak sauce at best? Good.

What's the strength of this? EDT.

Am I willing to trade this fragrance? No.

Should You Skipped It, Sample It First or Blind Buy It? Blind buy worthy.

Can you use it as a unisex scent? No.

Is it the old, new formulation? Old.

What's its availability; in production, limited edition or discontinued? In production.

Until next time, I'll catch you on the flipside.

Montblanc Legend Spirit is a good casual scent for the spring or summer. I think it is a very versatile fragrance and it would probably make a good work scent. Ideal for casual occasions but no reason why this could not be worn for more formal event also. Legend Spirit has a well blended opening and is has some sweetness but is also clean, fresh and invigorating It has the potential to collect complements. I get slightly above average projection / silage for the first 1 to 2 hour after that its starts getting closer to the skin. Longevity 6- 7 hours.

The white and chrome colour scheme of the bottle is a solid enough design but the downside is the bottle its totally opaque. it would have been nice to a have a small section to see the amount of visible juice remaining.

Overall scent 7.5/10

Invictus clone, it smells good in the initial spray then i feel i'm gonna throw up, not my thing at all!! very synthetic and in a not good way, so i'm gonna stick to Mont Blanc Legend Intense which smells amazing and very well blended.

So this is a huge PASS for me.

So i'm more of an amature when it comes to fragrances I didn't try a lot but any way I'll try to give a helpfull review .

01/Scent: the scent is fresh a bit spicy it smells more like a cheap parfume nothing unic about it.

Rating: 03/ 5

review_title: A true legend...and the love of my life
review_content:
This legendary, timeless fragrance is the one that introduced me to the world of perfumes when I was younger.
I love light summer fragrances, but I don’t like winter fragrances that have a strong and pungent smell that surrounds you with an aura of oud, leather and tobacco, and I think they harm the wearer.

This fragrance is the most eloquent example of summer fragrances. It is a light, aquatic, refreshing masculine fragrance that contains citrus and musk. It has a very distinctive scent.

This fragrance is suitable for men over 35 years and older, The fragrance bottle is luxurious and pure white, made of polished glass, covered with shiny metal on top, and the bottle cap is also made of shiny metal, and of course there is the Montblanc logo on the bottle.

I usually don’t re-purchase fragrances twice, no matter how much I love them...but this is one of the rare fragrances that I have re-purchased.

Conclusion: An excellent summer fragrance that gives you self-confidence and a constant feeling of freshness.

This is a Nice scent, Fresh, Clean and Bright. The bottle explains everything. I bought it blind-buy after reading the positive comments with reasonable price. It opens up with slightly sweet fresh spicy , citrusy , Lavender and spices notes in the background then dry down is musky woody. The Combination of the Lavender and Cardamom notes is fantastic in the middle notes and...

Ya know, this is a really nice fragrance. Nothing terrible unique, but it's fresh, soapy, sweet yet still masculine. On paper, this is something that I would love. It is definitely a younger scent - I'm talking like teenager - but even if I was still in my teens, I'm not sure it would have been my style.

It's fun and outgoing, but not very deep, and me personally I try to express a sense of depth and awareness balanced with being outgoing. This fragrance only expresses half of that.

review_title: Dangerously Close to Toilet Cleaner Territory
review_content:
This one is very citrusy. Like, aggressively citrusy. First sniff had me thinking of Abercrombie & Fitch Fierce vibes because of that citrus blast, but then it started leaning into Nautica Voyage territory. It’s kind of like if those two did a fusion dance and became one lemony aquatic scent.

For around $25, it’s not a bad cheapie at all. Smells clean, fresh, and like you put in at least some effort. I know Legend Spirit and Nautica Voyage are often compared when it comes to budget summer scents, but personally? I’d go with Voyage. It’s like ten bucks cheaper on Jomashop, a bit softer on the nose, and doesn’t hit you with a toilet cleaner vibe.

And to be fair, Legend Spirit doesn’t totally cross into harsh-cleaner territory, but it’s close. Not in a bad way, just... you’ll know what I mean when you smell it. It’s fresh, but also kind of sharp. Definitely better than smelling like B.O., but not something I’d full bottle. Maybe a good gym bag frag or something you throw on for those really humid days.

Solid aquatic, a bit too heavy on the citrus for me, but not a bad grab if you want something cheap, loud, and clean.

It's the best value for money summer fragrance I'ved tried. It's very masculine and fresh, not a lot of spice but I don't mind in this instance because the rest is very well-blended. A very pleasent bergamot and grapefruit, I don't really get the musk on the drydown but the woods make up for it beatifully. Downside is that it doesn't last as long as I would like, but for 30€ you really can't go wrong for a very cheap freshie.
Scent: 8.3/10
Longevity: 6.1/10
Sillage: 6.8/10 (3-5 works for me)
Bottle: 5.4 (nothing fancy, plain and simple)
Value for money: 9.5/10

A lovely, addictive scent. I like this way, way more than the OG Legend. Nothing wrong with being so close to A&F's Fierce, but I wore that during highschool and college so it's hard to wear Legend without feeling like a kid again (sometimes a good thing, sometimes not).

Legend Spirit is better from the start simply by being more unique and more versatile. There is a overwhelming sense of freshness that comes across and lingers through the whole profile. This must be the "water notes" listed. I personally don't smell the citrus, but I do get something here that is sweet, a tiny bit fruity, but not overwhelmingly so. Maybe the lavender? Maybe the cardamom? Whatever it is, it helps this fresh, aquatic smell become something almost mouthwatering. And then it gets even better as it dries down and the musk starts to come out. This is one of those summer scents that can be sprayed in the early afternoon and be absolutely perfect, and stays perfect as the day transitions into evening and the scent matures on your skin.

I personally don't get the performance issues others are complaining about. It's not a beast-mode fragrance, no, but I'm of the opinion that sometimes subtlety is the best strategy. With it being a EDT in mind, I spray 7-8 times (3-4 times on chest/back of neck, 2 times on each inner elbow) and I can easily pick it up as I move around 10 hours later. There have even been times where, a solid 12 hours later, I couldn't quite pick it up myself but my wife would comment about how good I smell when I walk by.

For how much a 100ml bottle costs (at discounters, cough cough), this is an absolutely killer deal. A dumb grab n spray everyday warm weather fragrance that actually has some depth and interest and smells amazing? Yeah sign me up, I wish I found this gem years and years ago.

Legend Spirit is a classic fragrance for the summer or the warmer spring days. It opens with a burst of sparkling citrus notes, including bergamot and pink pepper. As the scent develops, a blend of fresh aquatic, lavender and cardamom emerges, adding a touch of aromatic warmth to the composition. The heart of Legend Spirit is a clean and fresh accord that is both timeless...

So this was a random pick for me because of its price and a shop recommendation. Wow. I never ever get so much compliments on any fragrance like this one. Not on Sauvage or Luna Rossa Carbon, not on Aqua di Gio, Not on Bvlgari Aqva, not on YSL La Nuit or YSL L'homme, and not on Lalique White or Boss reversed. And here is this not-so-hyped brand with this not hyped fragrance....

This perfume is a hit, I love its fragrance and the best thing is that it lasts all day. Its Top notes are Grapefruit, Bergamot and Pink Pepper; middle notes are Water Notes, Lavender and Cardamom; base notes are White Musk, White Woods, Cashmere Wood and Oakmoss. I love this perfume. Men of the world; wear this perfume. Is perfect. Me, and my family have had a time to say that it smells so GOOOOD!!!! Last Longing to make it even way better. Recommend for young men and teenagers but any man can wear it. You have to try it.

review_title: Decent 'harmless impression' scent that leaves a lot to be desired
review_content:
Legend Spirit is an odd fragrance. This is an EDT, and altough you definitely get that sort of vibe, its not what most fresh EDT's are. My main complain with many EDT's is that there usually isnt a note prominent in the scent, or just one or two notes that quickly fade away. That is not much different with Legend Spirit, but it does have a certain woodyness that sets itself at least a little apart from other EDT's.

The problem is that that is it. Its a 2-3 hour scent that has not one prominent note that is worth mentioning. Its not Particularly cheap either. Its a pretty harmless scent that because of that wood probably fits better as a 'special occassion' scent than other EDT's, but if that is your goal to get out of Legend Spirit, i would say there are much better, even cheaper options out there.

Its great for teenagers and as an option to choose from if you cant make a choice without choosing the wrong thing, i do think its not bad, but it doesnt fit as anything else than a underwheling harmless signature scent. From a score of 0-100, i would give this a 67

Legend Spirit ist für mich ein sehr sauberer Duft, welchen man gut tragen kann um frisch geduscht und Sauber zu riechen. Perfekt für den Alltag und für den Sport. Er ist auf keinen Fall aufdringlich. Außerdem ist der Legend Spirit von Mont Blanc für sein Preis echt jeden Cent wert. Ein Klasse Duft für die Schule und für den Sommer.

review_title: This one gets a lot of hype
review_content:
but it doesn’t quite live up to its expectations, at least in my opinion. It smells like it WISHES it was in the Invictus line, but doesn’t quite make the cut. The opening REALLY tries to be one of the Paco Rabanne trophy cups, but as it dries down it becomes quite a bit “thinner” in how it resonates and projects. Imagine how someone who was rocking Invictus when they “hooked up” would smell when they left in the morning. That’s the vibe I get. How someone who wore Invictus edt and didn’t scrub hard enough in the shower would smell. A thinned out, softer feeling Paco flask with a pinch of “soap” added to it.

It’s not a bad scent by any means. Some people kind of like Invictus, but think its a little too “loud” in sillage and projection. Legend Spirit would appeal to them. It’s softer, and doesn’t project as much; maybe a 1.5ft radius maximum. Sillage is also very weak, and it becomes a skin scent very quickly. It’s not bad, but it’s definitely not for me.

review_title: Goes in the direction of Invictus/Invictus Aqua
review_content:
This Montblanc also joined my collection this month. I have owned the original Legend for some time, and I ordered this flanker untested. It is not very famous, neither here nor elsewhere, but some recommend this fragrance.

This flanker of Legend is little known. One thing to note: The typical Fierce DNA from the original is not found here. The fragrance pyramid is also rather unremarkable. A fresh bergamot-grapefruit blend, followed by a light aquatic note and a subtle spiciness. Finally, there is a musk-wood mixture that is quite mild. The fragrance pyramid confirms this as well. It starts off slightly sharp-unpleasant and somewhat synthetic. This subsides after a few minutes. The Legend DNA is not recognizable to me at any point, which is not unusual for flankers these days. However, I perceive a strong similarity to Invictus/Invictus Aqua by Paco Rabanne. Due to this beautiful bitter grapefruit note, it leans more towards Invictus Aqua, especially in the first hour. As the aquatic notes come through more, it develops more of its own character. It is accompanied by light spicy hints that are very soft and rather pleasant in the background. In the final phase of this fragrance, fresh woods paired with musk come into play. The gentle woods fit well into this fresh attire. Especially from the second hour, it truly becomes a fresh, soft creation. This slight Invictus note is still present, but significantly softer.
Really a pleasant fragrance that can also be great for sports activities. It is truly uncomplicated and gentle. I have already tested it at the gym. I must say that it is pleasant and not intrusive during sports. For other occasions, it might be too unremarkable.
The performance is not bad for a fresh fragrance, but also not more than that. It starts with very good sillage, which, however, quickly diminishes, but remains in a pleasant range. Of course, it cannot compete with the performance of Invictus. Longevity should be around 5-6 hours, with the last hours being hardly noticeable.

In terms of price, this fragrance is really fair. I paid around 20 euros for 30ml, which I believe this fragrance is truly worth. There are certainly much cheaper fresh fragrances, but that should not diminish this scent. Not a must-have, but still a very solid release.

Is it currently being hyped quite a bit on YouTube? - Yes. Did I therefore seek out a sample out of curiosity? - Yes. Was that completely unnecessary since I have already snagged 80 other fragrances on Parfumo? - Yes. Am I still glad that I did it? - Yes. Does it smell exactly like Hubba Bubba bubblegummy sweet at the start? - Yes. Does the sweetness then settle down to reveal...

I am writing this comment because something happened to me with the perfume recently that I have never experienced with any other fragrance :D
I find the perfectly embedded grapefruit scent brilliant, but I was surprised by how many compliments I received about this perfume, both from men and especially from women. After two sprays on my neck and about an hour later, I was walking on a windy evening outside (!) to the stadium when a young woman, from three (!) meters away, called out, "Hey you in the black sweater, you smell really good!" I was really surprised, partly because I don't overdo it with the scent and partly because this grapefruit-musk fragrance is actually a soft, rather subtle version.
This perfume is totally underrated and a little insider tip from me ;)

In customer consulting, we are always supported by field representatives from different companies (those of you in banking know this), each responsible for their own areas, such as insurance, personal loans, funds, or even building savings contracts.

A few years ago, when the candidate for the last category was once again replaced, we were assigned a very special guy. Naturally, there are all sorts of people here too: brash show-offs who get a new AMG as their vehicle every six months, chronic depressives, sleeping pills, burnout candidates, but rarely truly good advisors - which is, by the way, due to the job being simply inhumane. For comparison: the current colleague works daily from early morning until at least midnight, has probably seen his children for the last time in a non-sleeping state six months ago, and will likely throw in the towel soon.

But there was one, a very special one, on whom all hope rested at that time. He was supposed to sell a massive number of building savings contracts. He was introduced to us as a highly motivated former securities professional who had worked at the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. This information could have been spared, as he exuded an unbelievably clichéd vibe from every pore. Hectic, fast, restless, bloated from coke. While waiting for the customer, sharply planning and highly focused with one hand on his chin, pacing up and down in the customer area, incredibly assertive and demanding (even though he was only supposed to support us, and no one was subordinate to him), and of course ridiculously over-motivated.
When he entered the office, he would call out with what was probably a freshly powdered nose, "Morning, hi, hello, Moin, Morning!". When saying goodbye, he didn't simply say "Bye!", but he would excitedly tap on the table and shout, "So! Ciao, bye, ciao! And sell, do, act, right?", before almost running out. He spoke incredibly quickly, concisely, and purposefully. He was not a "normal" consultant, but the purest caricature of one. Please don't get me wrong, I'm not criticizing him. I just still enjoy my somehow cult-worthy memories of him. Every one of his quirks was cinematic. None of my descriptions are exaggerated!

One of his main characteristics was that he would go to his car about every 15 minutes. We don't know what else he did there (it probably snowed in his car more often), but one thing was clear to all of us: the spray head of his bottle would be activated again soon! We only experienced him with the top note of this incredibly masculine, pleasing, somehow sporty and metallic scent. No one ever knew the heart, let alone the base note. The sillage was enormous, and due to the quarterly re-spraying, the offices still smelled of the fragrance even after two hours. The whole powder must have significantly damaged his nose anyway, and with the constant application of the little water, the poor guy must have been completely scent-blind.

At some point, I mustered the courage to ask him about the fragrance.
"Uh, Montblanc, yes," he said, while simultaneously continuing to work on his laptop and tapping his leg. "Okay, smells good," I replied, and went back to my office, as he probably would have already tuned me out as an unnecessary distraction from his work at that moment. Just the sight of this sales robot could bring one closer to their first heart attack.

Anyway, with the information I had available, I soon went to the perfumery to test all the Montblancs available at that time (this was still before the release of "Explorer"). I ultimately found success with "Legend Spirit" and realized for the first time that fragrances on one's own skin or "with the nose on the arm" never smell the same as in the air - because they always smell better there!
Fruity, fresh, clean, masculine, universally applicable, and guaranteed to please everyone. No unnecessary games or extravagant scent notes. The "legendary spirit" simply smells "on point". It has only one goal: to make you smell good or to make an impression. Sometimes, when you're tired of all the niche stuff, a reach for the white bottle helps, and you immediately feel as fresh as if you just did coke, uh, showered.

"Montblanc Legend Spirit" doesn't need an elaborate description. It's simple, and good at it. As a perfume lover, you might find scents with an oudy toffee note, spiced with cinnamon, sharpened with ginger, and made long-lasting with dog poop, more artistically valuable. But try reapplying that every 15 minutes - you won't last long with that!

No, sometimes it has to be simple. Sometimes, when you want to conclude a building savings contract and are frustrated because "unfortunately all building savings contracts under 10,000 EUR are currently sold out," you can also just work the spray head of this unspectacular little fragrance to vent your frustration and think of Mr. N.

So, bye, ciao, bye! Buy Montblanc Legend Spirit, spray, act! Invictus Aqua 2016 sold out! Do it! ACT!

I would like to dedicate my first comment to my latest acquisition :) I find that the fragrance is rather underrated in the reviews here. It is a fresh, fine, and pleasant scent that immediately reveals its grapefruit top note upon application, followed shortly by aquatic notes. The woods in the base note complement the whole quite well, without being too overpowering, in my...

The rather positive reactions to this fragrance don't really make sense to me. I just find nothing exciting about Legend Spirit, apart from the bottle. The bottle is really beautiful, the white color combined with the metallic accent adds some flair to the fragrance shelf.
The scent is quite inexpensive to acquire, and in my opinion, it smells like it. It has a very "teenage" vibe and reminds me of the first drugstore scent of a 15-year-old boy. The fragrance starts off somewhat acceptable with a noticeable grapefruit and melon-like scent DNA, quite fresh.
Over time, a bit of sandalwood becomes noticeable, but that doesn't make it any more attractive or interesting.
Otherwise, it's boring, as the fragrance develops absolutely nothing that brings depth and punch. Sillage and longevity are okay, especially for the price. I would also not recommend over-spraying this fragrance, as this "cheap drugstore scent note" literally takes your breath away. For teenagers, it's just about okay, thanks to the initial freshness, but I cannot recommend this fragrance for men.

I tested this one at Duty Free. It reminded me not only of Invictus but much more of Lacoste L12.12 blanc. So far, so good. I then applied it and got on the plane. Again and again, I thought during the flight (no joke): “Who smells so good here?”

When my girlfriend pointed out that it was me, I promptly ordered it. After wearing it several times, I found it increasingly annoying/synthetic, and so it had to leave my collection. The sillage really smells great, though!

Conclusion: A good everyday and sports fragrance with good H+S, but it lacks a bit of uniqueness and might be too synthetic for some.

Not a blind buy, but worth a test.

I find the scent very good, I skipped "sillage" as I can't really judge it.

I also got the "After Shave Balm" from Mont Blanc Legend Spirit, and combined with the Eau de Toilette, it's really amazing.

Also, the price is totally fine.

I know one thing: as soon as it's empty, which shouldn't take too long, I will get it again.

Shower, shave, After Shave Balm from Legend Spirit plus Eau de Toilette ... and just like that, I have 5 more women on Facebook and 7 more women on WhatsApp... ;)
When a child on the street shouts "Dad," I have to turn around to see if I'm being referred to.
Thank you very much, Legend Spirit!!!!

review_title: Of Hope and Other Soap Bubbles
review_content:
There is a book from 1940 that deals with hope. In "The Tartar Steppe," the Italian Dino Buzzati describes the life of the young officer Giovanni Drogo, who soon wants to prove his courage and fighting spirit. The story tells of empty hope, of chimera, and of wasting time. The soldier is assigned to a remote fortress in the desert. Waiting for great battles, he takes up his duty. It is said that the Tartars are preparing an attack on the base.

Over time, the orders in the fortress prove to be a futile endeavor. Weeks, months, and years pass. Sometimes it seems as if the longed-for moment of heroism in battle will arrive. But all in vain - the enemy does not storm, and there is no salvation.

With compelling pathos, Buzzati tells of an existence that fades away over time. After 30 years, having grown old and alone, Drogo leaves his fortress. As he dies lonely in an inn, he cannot witness the feverish preparations for war. The Tartars have launched an offensive on the post where Drogo once spent his life.

This Montblanc variant also plays with hope. The smooth bottle with the delicate snap cap is almost a work of art. The opulent opening, thanks to grapefruit, appears quite genuinely neat, but quickly transitions into a sweet-soft drydown. The appealing start with a freshness kick is unfortunately soon hopelessly over. Unnoticed, one is left alone with the quietly pleasing base.

And just like with Drogo, the desire is the scent definition in Legend Spirit. Not the reality.

So, I’ll keep it as short as possible! This scent cannot compete with the Montblancs I otherwise love: Individuel, Presence, and Starwalker "stinking" in my nose! Luckily, all three can still be ordered, but they probably won’t be produced anymore! What a shame: The good ones are being phased out, while the bad ones are kept! :-( Free after the motto "I liked the old songs, not the new ones"! What would I give to be able to smell Photo, Relax, or Bogner Man again ...

But back to LS: Not a terrible or bad scent, but I have enough options in my closet to reach for something else in case of "freshness." Why? LS has a very salty note for me, and I can’t handle that. I have no idea where it comes from, but that’s how I perceive it. Therefore, LS smells somehow "mustier" and "stricter" to me than other citrus aquatics, which I actually like very much. A bit like sweat, you know! ;-)

But of course, this is just my personal impression. So if you like it ...

review_title: A lot of quality for little money
review_content:
Montblanc really offers great fragrances for relatively little money. The Legend Spirit EdT is very similar to Paco Rabanne Invictus EdT. However, it is more exciting, fresher, and fruitier. Of course, it also has a decent amount of sweetness, but it also features aquatic notes, grapefruit, and bergamot. These provide the freshness.

The scent lasts about as long as Invictus, with excellent longevity and sillage (around 8 hours of good projection). A fragrance for everyday wear, for going out, to make a statement, for the club. Unlike Le Male or One Million, Legend Spirit can still be worn well at 30+. The bottle is beautifully white and silver and feels really high-quality. And the kicker is, of course, the price: for little money, you get a lot of fragrance quality! Definitely worth a try!

Salvatore opens his eyes, the light gently streaming through the slats of the closed shutters. He gets up, walks to the kitchen, and opens the refrigerator. The scent of the ripe grapefruit he placed inside two days ago wafts towards him. He takes the glass carafe filled with water from the fridge, fills a glass with the cold water, opens the wings of the balcony door of his...

Sometimes you need something quick (in the car, in the bathroom, or who knows where) and in my opinion, this is the fragrance - a no-brainer....

I've read for years that it smells like shower gel, but sometimes I wonder, what's so bad about that?

We all know cheap shower gels or deodorants, and most people use them too; are they bad? They can be annoying or feel less luxurious, that's true, but they do have a job, and they fulfill it - just like this fragrance here.

I've been using it for several years now, and when it comes to compliments, it casually outperforms many €200 (+) fragrances, and that alone says a lot.

When I wear it, I feel fresh - refreshed and really satisfied, that's how it should be.

AND the price-performance ratio is MEGA!
(200ml for less than 40 euros ;) )

Best regards

I like Legend for Women - and the men's version appeals to me as well. A subtle classic all-rounder that fits well with a suit and in the office - especially with public traffic. Legend is easily noticeable, but unobtrusive. I would love to catch a whiff of it on my friendly banker when he takes me aside for a "face-to-face" conversation. That way, the technical terms...

Contrary to all "rules," I wore it this winter when the snow was 30-40 cm high on the cars. Sure, this is a classic scent for summer or warmer spring days, but I was approached outside in the freezing cold by an acquaintance: "You've really doused yourself." I hadn't applied more than usual, and I was surprised because I didn't initially perceive the sillage as strong. In...

Here we have the well-known and also popular clean guy from Montblanc. I became aware of it through various recommendations. Not only was the scent highlighted, but also the very good price-performance ratio. You can get 200ml for a mid-range two-digit amount. And what can I say? Yes - you can't go wrong with this EDT! At least if you're looking for a fresh companion for...

review_title: Aquatic and Affordable Summer Hubba Bubba
review_content: In search of a fresh summer fragrance, I tested this one in stores. Since Montblanc fragrances generally offer very good value for money and I liked the scent, I made a direct purchase. SCENT: What does it feel like to wear *Legend Spirit*? - Like being at a summer beach party or exercising. I perceive an aquatic grapefruit that simply smells pleasant. A bit reminiscent of...

In itself, Legend Spirit is a great, fresh fragrance that can be worn by any man. Online, it is often claimed that it smells like Invictus Aqua (2016), which I cannot confirm for myself. JF often compares it to toilet spray in a positive sense, which I find quite far-fetched.

Longevity is rather "very weak" for me, as it quickly disappears even from clothing. The sillage is okay in the initial minutes but fades quite quickly, so in my opinion, the scent is only perceived close to the body. However, this is not a deal-breaker for its price. Compared to other Mont Blanc fragrances, the performance is rather weak.

I can imagine the fragrance very well on very hot days inland or on vacation. It makes sense especially when you know that you will be showering or bathing in the next few hours. It is also suitable for the office on warmer days, although one would need to reapply several times a day. It is also suitable for men who like to wear a fragrance while training at the gym or for applying "after" (of course after showering ;-)).

Conclusion: Acceptable for the price and very well suited for "unimportant" everyday situations.

Montblanc Legend Spirit is a fragrance that truly surprises for its price! When I first applied it, a strong, fresh hint of fruity notes immediately came through, like pear (even though there’s none in it, haha) or grapefruit. Very aquatic. The opening is really zesty, with a mix of the aforementioned grapefruit and bergamot that refreshes you right away and gives you that clean shower feeling.

What I particularly like is that the fragrance doesn’t change too much. Sure, over time it becomes a bit warmer, with those wood notes in the background, but that fresh feeling remains throughout. For the price you pay, you really get a lot - a great blend of freshness and elegance that is perfect for warm days.

One downside: the longevity could perhaps be a bit better, but at this price, you can just apply a little more, haha. If you’re looking for something light and fresh that isn’t overwhelming, then Legend Spirit is truly a good choice!

review_title: The No-Brainer for Spring and Summer
review_content: Montblanc Legend Spirit is for me one of the absolute no-brainer fragrances for spring and summer. When I have to rush to work in the morning and don’t have time, reaching for this bottle is almost automatic. Uncomplicated, fresh, yet not too synthetic and appealing to almost everyone. I think no one will have an issue with this scent. The versatility is a very positive...

This fragrance is the epitome of "fresh," "sporty," and "masculine."
It is perfect for the gym and everyday wear.
Projection is weak.
Longevity is unfortunately lacking as well.
However, due to the price, it is still absolutely recommendable.
Blind-buy potential.
For those who value strong projection, this fragrance is not recommended.

For me, definitely the best Montblanc.

For sporty people who often dress casually, it's just an awesome all-rounder.

The scent is fresh, slightly sweet, partly warm, partly blue, it really can do it all.

Many see a resemblance to Invictus Aqua (2016).

It is definitely usable in pretty much any situation.

I also don't think it's too youthful, as many claim.

You should definitely give it a try if you like freshies :)

review_title: You could have been so good!
review_content:
From the scent profile this fragrance gives off, it is clearly one of the best aquatic scents I know. The aquatic notes, bergamot, and lavender harmonize excellently. A brilliant everyday companion that unfortunately does NOT last long and whose sillage is also not really good...
It has the potential to be among the best, but unfortunately, it was not fully utilized.

All in all, you can't complain for this price; you get such a great fragrance for so little money (then you just have to take it with you and reapply).

It is perfect as a gym scent; the fragrance makes you want to work out!

The scent for a quick refresh. Fresh citrus aquatic fragrance.
The "no brainer" is more useful for me on hot days before/after sports or when I need to go out in a hurry. The longevity and sillage are okay. I find the price/performance ratio quite good. Perfect for younger newcomers to the world of fragrances if you like fresh citrus scents.

The Montblanc Legend Spirit is a lightly fruity fragrance that stands out with a very subtle grapefruit, moist, and also aquatic note.
In the dry down, it becomes slightly bright and woody.
It is a masculine, understated scent that is also very pleasant.
I really like the fragrance and enjoy wearing it on warmer days.

Montblanc Legend Spirit reminds me of a deodorant but with extra freshness. The scent has no strong development and smells of citrus after a shower. I love the smell, but the longevity and sillage are simply very poor. After 3 hours, it is hardly noticeable on me. However, during those 3 hours, the fragrance is well perceived and receives many compliments. I think it is the...

This is where it all began for me. My passion for fragrances, my collection, my day.
My brother, who had been enthusiastic about fragrances for a while, gifted me this one for my birthday. Giving a fragrance as a gift without prior knowledge is always a tricky matter, whether it is liked or not. But with this one, there was no problem. It is very pleasant, light, and fresh, not groundbreaking in any way, yet always useful. Even though my collection now consists mostly of niche fragrances, I still find myself returning to this one, whether on a hot summer day or during a visit to the university or elsewhere, it doesn’t matter. This one works anytime and never disappoints. It’s incredibly pleasant even during sports.

The scent is always appropriate.
Fresh and a bit sweet.
Perfect for wearing in the warmer seasons.
Great price for what you get.
It is almost always well received.
Recommendation for those who want to smell fresh but have a certain sweet touch. Unfortunately, the upper chrome part of the bottle came off for me, I had to glue it back on, but it doesn’t affect the scent, of course.

review_title: Daily Driver from April to September
review_content:
Citrusy-fresh, lightly peppery aquatic with a woody base. This is how one could briefly and succinctly describe Legend Spirit by Montblanc. It sounds very unremarkable, like an everyday summer fragrance. But doesn’t it want to be that? Whether it wants to or not, it is. And it does it well.

The bottle is simple and rounded, similar to the other fragrances in the Legend line. The white color fits very well with the image, a nice change from the typical aqua blue of other aquatics. The bottle cap is chrome-plated, as is the top. It feels quite nice to the touch.

What ingredients are often listed in a fresh fragrance? Right, citrus fruits. Here, bergamot and grapefruit provide a deliciously fresh opening, which is slightly enhanced by the pepper. The latter fades after a few minutes and is replaced by aquatic notes - bringing in a slight synthetic quality. However, the synthetic aspect hardly bothers me; the accord remains fresh up to that point. Cardamom and lavender now contribute floral-sweet notes, and I would even describe it as having a slight creaminess from here on. But really just very lightly; maybe I’m just imagining that. Musk and various woods round off the fresh scent, without completely drifting into a woody territory, but rather remaining fundamentally citrusy-fresh. The woods, in my opinion, fit quite well with the overall picture of Legend Spirit.

It’s a pity that the H/S doesn’t bring a bit more power. After 4 hours, it’s only close to the skin for me. The fragrance is perfect as an everyday scent from spring to late summer. Whether at the office, during sports, at home, or on a beach holiday. Well, for dates, I might recommend something else. For that, Legend Spirit is too fresh and sporty. The price/performance ratio is also still good here. I can highly recommend this one for all aquatic fans and freshie lovers!

Absolutely great shower gel scent for sports, whether at the gym, martial arts, soccer, or anywhere else where you sweat a lot and have close contact with people, the scent is always perceived as pleasant... "how can it be that you sweat like a pig but smell like you've just showered" I've heard that many times. I also like to wear MB Legend during sports - I would describe it as a bit less "shower gel-like," but still very fresh and suitable for the gym.

Cheers
MaxPain

Maybe some of you know Ulric de Varens - Flash. As a teen, or even as a young adult, I loved this scent. The problem with it was the sillage and longevity, as it lasted less than an hour. I searched for a replacement for a long time and found it in Montblanc - Legend Spirit. The UdV - Flash is a bit fruitier than the Mb, but the Mb is sweeter. And that's exactly what I...

That's what I thought when I sprayed the fragrance. Nice and fresh, ozonic, masculine (more for teenagers). The scent radiates a certain clean boy aesthetic. I had been at the gym in the morning, then freshly showered. Bam, ozonic fresh citrus, shower-like in the opening. Shortly after, the fragrance is fresh, relaxed, and ready to start the day. The scent is not very strong but accompanies you well throughout the day. School, sports, work, leisure. The smell of clean clothes with a hint of musk that is by no means overpowering lingers on you. A no-brainer.

Smells pleasantly fresh / sporty, I must honestly say nothing special, but it fits quite well for everyday use. It has a fresh lemony scent and leans towards a sporty direction, and for the price, it's quite acceptable. So, anyone looking for an affordable everyday fragrance will find this one quite satisfactory.

review_title: Great Beginner in the World of Perfume
review_content: The scent was one of the first I bought, and I still believe that it is a great beginner fragrance. It is fresh/citrusy, easy to like, and a perfect companion for everyday wear and summer. I think you will only meet a few people who don’t like the DNA of this fragrance. Especially for younger people, in my opinion, it’s a top recommendation. My only major criticism is the...

Montblanc Legend Spirit is a fresh, clean, and very likable fragrance. It feels unobtrusive, fits into any situation, and can be worn effortlessly in all seasons. An uncomplicated all-rounder that always works. Alternatively, there is Paco Rabanne Invictus Aqua, which for me has a more rounded scent progression.

review_title: For a Successful Man with Confidence
review_content: Men's Eau de Toilette "Montblanc Legend Spirit" is not one of my favorite fragrances, so the bottle is kept at the country house and I usually use it after shaving. The "Legend of Mont Blanc" was given to me by relatives for my birthday. The company is not the most famous, but for a gifted horse, as they say... Out of curiosity, I later checked the price online and found...

The scent generally has a very fresh and clean character. At first, it comes across as fruity and zesty, but over time it becomes increasingly aquatic. It is fresh, sporty, invigorating, and primarily targets a younger audience. It is perfect for sports, but it can practically be worn for any other occasion as well. As long as you don't mind smelling like some others, this...

Legend Spirit is for me the epitome of summer freshness in a bottle. You press once, and bam, you feel instantly transported to the beach. The opening is an explosive, almost sparkling blend of pink pepper and grapefruit. It’s a freshness that feels not cool, but radiant and invigorating.
After the first few minutes, gentle, aquatic notes join in, making the scent incredibly clean and carefree. The drydown then becomes warmer and woodier, yet without losing its lightness. You can feel the depth of oak moss and a hint of musk, which makes it super masculine and elegant.

I have been testing Montblanc Legend Spirit in my daily routine for a few weeks now and I must say: The scent is a pleasant surprise. The first impression is really nice - fresh, clean, lightly citrusy, as if you just stepped out of the shower. It feels very modern and unobtrusive, which I personally like.nnAfter a few minutes, the scent becomes a bit warmer and woodier,...

The ideal budget friendly option to wear in gym all year round. Begins with nice bright citrusy notes, which smoothly gives away to more aquatic notes. I get a bit saltiness too. After drying down, gives me a warm comforting vibe. Good sillage, which is never overpowering, makes it perfect to wear in gym or office too. Despite being an EDT, I always get decent 4-5 hrs of performance. Overall, a gem of a budget scent for summer.

I like to wear this perfume for the gym, it does its job, smells fresh and clean, and lasts at least until you finish your workout. The price is reasonable, and the bottle looks clean. The scent doesn't last long, but it definitely serves its purpose of smelling clean and fresh for a short time. So it's perfect for a gym visit.

Montblanc Individual in my opinion is the best releases from this house. A very clean and aromatic fresh scent. There is also some sweetness provided by the Tonka bean, Raspberry and the Vanilla notes, There is more than a resemblance to Creed Santal as mentioned on various reviews although this was released first, Also it has been compared to the original Joop. although only slightly. This more refined and not as cloying as Joop . If you dont want to spend too much on a fragrance or just want to add this to a collection this is perfect.

Occasion wise this could be worn all year round apart form extreme heat as there is some sweetness but this is purely subjective, Montblanc Individual is perfect for work environment or socialising during the day or night. The projection / Silage is good for the first 3-4 hours and also above average longevity. Go easy on the trigger as this could potentially be over sprayed depending on skin type. This would make a good blind buy and I have to say this is a quality of this release from Montblanc.

The bottle design is simple but effective.

Overall scent 8.0

I know, that's really cutting it short but Individuel is just great for office use, though it's kind of a lighter take on an oriental. The opening is sweet, but the sweetness becomes lesser the further you come into the drydown and I find it quite hard to dislike.
Is it synthetic? Yeah well, the opening has some synthetics with that raspberry tinge, but again it gets better and less obvious in the drydown where it turns smoother, fresher and more suave with the combo of bay leaf and cinnamon.

The green notes sparkle in warmer weather but I actually find this to be an all-year kind of scent, as the spices and berries are more prominent in colder temps, while the rosemary, greens and lavender give it a cooler take as the temperatures rise.

I cannot compare it to Joop Homme as I've never tried that one, but comparisons to Creed Original Santal are definitely justified - that Individuel is cheaper and was actually released before Original Santal just makes it even more respectable IMO. Appropriate for any age group, and I could even see it working just fine for enthusiastic youngsters in their early twenties, despite being launched in 2003. Adequate to good performance in regards to both longevity and projection. Overall, a very nice composition by Pierre Bourdon - the price to quality ratio here is really good and you won't offend anyone with this type of scent, so give it a whirl!

review_title: The Individual Needs That Differ From Each Person
review_content:
I noticed Montblanc Individuel by chance while looking for another perfume on Youtube, and a video appeared that examined the cheap men's fragrances with an unquestionably significant impact. Vlogger, like many other people on the web, referred to the similarity with Joop! Homme, the dark purple juice that I loved and wore just released in the early nineties. Hence, I pursued research and found that three colognes share the same vibe and common foundation, with a strong orange blossom initial note, such as Joop! Homme (1989), MB Individuel (2003), and Creed Original Santal (2005). The former has appealing qualities, much bolder, opulent and somehow cloying if worn in the wrong season, but was one of the biggest clubbing bombs, instead, this one is more on the aromatic side. About the latter, I have no idea since I never smelled it. So yes, at first glance, the similarity with Joop! Homme is inevitable if you happened to feel it or use it. However, this is only the first impression, because compared side by side the two share the same vibration, the same cherry syrup accord, but then proceed in two separate ways. Joop! is Joop!, no question about it!

I lastly manage to review this masterpiece, and wonder how come I have refrained from buying this for all this time. I bought it in May and wore it a couple of times, but umm... it didn't convince me at all. It is very sweet but yes compared to many super sweet fragrances it is relatively fresh. The performance of my lot is mediocre, low projection, low sillage, and low longevity, not a beast as you often hear on YouTube or read on blogs. So, what the fuss? Though, I love the overall redolence. As soon as you spray this scent on the skin, it gives you an instant boost of rich aromas, and you're going to notice that raspberry sweetness, delightful with clean laundry nuances but neither gourmand nor cloying. You can get it from the very beginning up to the dry-down where the note is supposed to be. But, there is also a sort of crisp freshness and balminess coming from the aromatic herbs and spices. My chemistry enhances the odorous notes of icy mint, memory balm rosemary, calming blueish lavender, sparkling coriander leaf, and juniper berry, which rise from the skin pleasantly. Instead, I don't get any citrus notes, yet I seem to catch some fruity pineapple accord, but it could be my nose. Other elements provide a woodier spice accord, such as cardamom and juniper. In this initial stage, Individuel is metallic, grey, a little deep. The cinnamon, raspberry, and juniper notes in Individuel give it a slightly fruity aroma which distinguishes it, in my opinion.

A little while later, it soon moves into the heart and leaves a relatively faint but noticeably sillage. There are a bunch of floral notes present, which creates a powdery feel. I can nearly detect individual blossoms like jasmine, violet, and orange flower, surrounded by a touch of green geranium. The interplay between the aromatics and floral notes are fresh and comforting.

Eftsoons, as it dries down, this clean freshness becomes woodier and creamier. The sweetness of the raspberry pairs with vanilla, on top of that sandalwood base. And a touch of amber, which arrives rather quickly for an oriental. A chocolate-like berry note lurks in there, too. Musk and moss hesitate, and I don't get them so pronounced as in Joop!. Thus, a luscious, slightly woody scent, with a creaminess, and dotted with cinnamon spice.

Provocative, some people love it, some others hate it. Though, I believe that this scent grows and grows on you, the more you wear it, the more you appreciate it. On my skin, the overall smell highlights juniper berries, raspberry, vanilla, cedarwood. The sweet, fruity, and spicy aroma makes MB Individuel perfect for those milder seasons where it is neither too warm nor too cold, Spring and Autumn's days fit flawlessly. It features remarkable notes that go well with the nighttime, either. Whether you’re going out to join a dinner party with friends, colleagues, or meeting the family, it gets serious!
The projection is below average, it's not overwhelming, but a bit weak, and I also get moderate longevity, of about half a day, depending on the weather. Individuel is everything but a solid performer, yet more than useful, for most occasions.
About the perfumer, Pierre Bourdon likes to create pure aura scents using complicated formulas and pyramids, and he does it successfully in Kouros, Cool Water, and Individuel. I love the first two more than the third, but Individuel holds its own and is worthy of Bourdon, and of anyone who wears modern orientals. If Creed Original Santal was inspired by this, there should be a reason, right?

This review is based on a 75ml bottle that I have owned since May 2020 (batch code i353, production date 2018-12-19).

Stay well; stay healthy.

-Elysium

When a designer fragrance is compared to a niche typically it's a compliment. If a similar designer scent is routinely considered equal to or better than the niche that is high praise! And this is what you will find in this mainstream Mont Blanc Indivduel as it is often compared to Creed's own Original Santal. I know it sounds over simplified but this edt's opening reminds me of my favorite chocolate and raspberry candy with the dry down reminding me of perhaps the worlds greatest smelling fabric softener, no need to get complicated here. It is very linear and that is just fine by me as this budget scent gives a very desirable sweet yet fresh ride from start to finish. Oh and the bottle design would looks right at home between any of my favorite Chanel's.

review_title: Nice and cheap fragrance for colder days
review_content: Fabric softener and raspberries in a bottle - this is what I smell. It last all day and then some without problems. I think it is a strong scent, so be careful with the sprays. Use for casual everyday, work/university. Can be used dressed up, since I still think it's a nice clean scent. I honestly have been thinking about giving it away, but when the cold hits this is one I am reaching for.

I know most accuse mont blanc of dooping creeds original santal but thats actually not true Why because Mont blanc individual was on the market before Original santal! so if any thing you could say creed flanked mont blanc ;) well lets now say my last piece on this if you have to make a choice between the two get this one it's better with better performance and you can get...

Sweet and heavy, Individuel is an excellent perfume.

Joop Homme is certainly more sinthetic and not as well crafted as this, why they differ.

I feel a very pronounced notes of cinnamon, vanilla and pineapple mostly.

Lasting power is high and with huge projection.

It’s a great value for the price. A very nice, fresh, and sweet fragrance indeed. In my eyes, it is absolutely worthy of the accolades it gets. Projection is very soft, however, barely reaching a 2 ft radius, and the sillage trail is limited as well. The longevity on this varies, but it averages about 6 hours on my skin.

For $20-$40, you can’t complain about those limitations, as again, the scent itself is actually very nice.

If you can find it, grab it, as it is a very versatile scent you can sport year round. Don’t set the bar too high as far as expectations go, but know that it is definitely worth the price you can find it at.

Pretty much all Mont Blanc scents share that trait; not mind blowing, but very nice and price worthy.

This is a great creation. I really enjoy wearing this one. Not too strong, not too harsh. Perfect for casual wear (of course, careful with the trigger). I like to use it in the fall and a bit in the early of winter. Some are using it in the spring as well, but I don't. Great for hanging out with friends as well. A bit sweet and also a fresh touch.
That raspberry feel makes it so approachable and warm. VERY cheap for the quality inside the bottle. A nice bottle and pretty unique juice. Not so many people are using it in my surroundings and that's why I love it so much. I always get questions like "what is this ? hmm.. what are you wearing ? you smell so .. different". I really appreciate some uniqueness in a fragrance. I guess we all do and this one has it. When it comes to performance .. Excellent for me. 6-7 hours , maybe pushing 8 with decent projection of 1.5/2 hours. For the price we pay, this is more than enough. I will always come back for this one because I really like it and it gets the job done.
Overall : 7.5/10

It's fresh, fruity, sweet, clean and possibly Montblanc's biggest hit since the advent of the fountain pen.

Individuel's raspberry and clean laundry combo has become such a popular scent in recent years that it almost feels wrong to jump on an already crowded bandwagon but it is hard to find anything to dislike about this fragrance. This is a modern smelling juice with enough personality to stand out from the many sweet-but-manly scents in the market these days. Versatility is another factor explaining Individuel's success: it's practically an office safe cologne in small doses and a sweet party beast when sprayed without a care.

All in all Individuel smells great, performs well and it's likely to remain a permanent presence in many men's fragrance rotations.

I have a CREED original Santal sample at home, and like many others I was wondering what is the point to pay premium €€ when you can get the cheaper Individuel, right? Well .. it´s not that simple.

I got myself a sample before buying a bottle of Montblanc to check with my own nose if it is really so similar like people want you to believe. And when you start spray it, they seem to have the similar sweet sandalwood direction, like JOOP Homme but less cloying.

After about 5 minutes, the CREED becomes very understated, in the same way Green Irish Tweed is vs Cool Water .. with a certain class and it´s less in your face, if I can say so.

The Individuel comes close to the skin very fast and it becomes this generic sweet, "not sure what I sprayed" sandalwood similar to JOOP smell.

Don´t get me wrong, if you are someone who could not care less about scents and perfume houses and notes and so on, you will find Montblanc a top choice and use it and spray it and could not care less about the details.

But if you are someone with a decent collection and a trained nose to sense the little things, you will understand what I mean.

The are similar, thanks to the influence of the great Pierre Burdon in both scent DNAs .. but in the Creed one I think Olivier´s influence can be seen, he also had a word into how it smells and what will come out from the sketch board.

Conclusion:
I would regret buying a full bottle of Montblanc and probably never use it and will just stay in the drawer, on the other hand the Creed is not so modern to make me use daily but I would like a bottle, maybe a 50ml one into my collection.

With the right price, maybe even used from the Souk - the Creed "wins" this versus.

it's interesting to see "individual" among the top perfumes of parfumonet. first of all it doesnt have the quality and punches nose with its synthetic notes. it's sweet like hell, as a sweet fragrance lover i couldnt tolerate this one. longevity and sillage are only good things that we can talk about.
It does indeed share similarities to both Joop Homme & Creed's Original Santal. A very nice scent at a good price :)

It's highly recommended by various influencers on YouTube. I blind bought it. The first time I sprayed, I smelt a wave of synthetic aroma. I hated it. Eventually, I started liking the scent after the dry down revealed the less synthetic base notes. As other reviewers said, the scent is like how freshly washed clothes with fabric softners smell like. It probably won't disturb anyone. It's safe to wear in places like the grocery store or the office. Although I don't hate it anymore, it still smells pretty boring to me.

After two years of ownership, my verdict is finally in: this fragrance is pure gold. Don't be fooled by the initial sweet blast upon spraying – give it five minutes. The drydown is where the magic truly happens, a golden aroma that lasts.
Wearing this cologne is like having freshly laundered clothes all day. It's sweet, desirable, and creates an undeniable aura of confidence. The projection and longevity are impressive, so heed this warning: two sprays max are all you need. This stuff is potent!
Forget the comparisons to Joop. While both are sweet, Individuel is in a different league. Joop is linear and overwhelmingly sweet, while Individuel is complex, evolving beautifully over time with added freshness and desirability.
If Joop is a one-dimensional charmer, Individuel is the sophisticated individual who becomes more captivating as time goes on.
Buy, Try, or Pass? BUY. A definite must-have for any fragrance enthusiast.

Intrigued by the hundreds of reviews comparing it to Creed's Original Santal (which I really like and which came out AFTER Individuel), I decided to get it.... The result? I have no regrets....
The similarity is there and you can immediately notice it. OS, however, is deeper and more structured, smells less like synthetic aldehydes, and is rounder and creamier overall. In short, it smells qualitatively better, and there's no arguing about that.
However, it must be said that Inviduel costs literally 1/10th the price of OS and performs better overall in terms of projection, longevity, and sillage.
Is it worth replacing OS with Individuel? Well, it depends on your budget, but let's just say that Individuel is a truly respectable "settler."
EDIT September 2025
I also bought Montblanc's Individuel to compare them, and I must confirm that the similarities are there. The mood and vibes are similar, but the Montblanc is significantly sweeter, with a fruity note completely absent from the Creed. Even on the drydown, the Montblanc has a sweet base, while the Creed remains dry and aromatic. The Montblanc also feels more like a shower gel, while the Creed does not.
So, are they similar? Yes, but also no... are they redundant? No... I prefer the Creed, but I also enjoy wearing the Montblanc.
EDIT
I tested the two half-siblings, Original Santal and Individuelle, in a 1-on-1 comparison on skin. Strange as it may seem, I must say that OS performs significantly better than Individuelle; in fact, the latter fades tremendously after half an hour, while OS remains quite strong and continues to be noticeable and consistent for the first two or three hours. In terms of longevity, the Creed is also superior. I confirm the differences in terms of olfactory profile, similar opening aside, the aromas take different directions from the heart onwards.

I think that this one is pretty hard to screw up. It maybe wouldn’t be appropriate at a funeral, other than that I think you’ll be ok.
Also it probably is more of a fall/winter type of frag... but I guess it is up to you.

The scent itself is like a sweeter, yet fresh but still a bit powdery kind of feel with raspberry on top.

I am not one for synthetic perfume. I blind-bought this because of the red berry note, which I can barely smell when I spray it on. It might just not work with my skin.

I have a friend who tried it recently, and it instantly became his favorite fragrance. Unlike me, he wasn’t coming in with high expectations. I guess this could be a hit if you're relatively new to fragrances and like a soft, masculine scent that won’t overwhelm the people around you too much.

I hate this perfume! It was a blind buy, and I regret every penny, even though it was really cheap. I have a real problem with sandalwood. Some sandalwoods really make me nauseous. I can't stand the smell for more than 5 minutes, and I have to wash my arm. This synthetic, creamy, sweet sandalwood—no, it's really hell to smell for me. Does anyone else have the same...

Unfortunately I don't understand the hype for this perfume.

It's cheap and that's it.

It seems to me the only point in its favor, for the rest I find it quite nauseating right away and I do not feel anything that could be barely considered 'fresh and clean'.

I feel a lot of sweet, synthetic raspberry, but maybe that's just my problem. XD

It's nothing groundbreaking. It's not challenging. While it's not too cheap smelling, it's not high quality. It's not the sort of thing you'd wear if you wanted to impress or make an impact.

But...

It's cosy and comfortable, it's nice (hate that word, but it fits), it's safe, projects decently and lasts rather well.

It's the sort of thing you'd wear if you wanted to smell good but not stand out. Perfect for those 'meh' dumb reach days. It's the sort of thing you could wear to the office and not have people bat an eyelid. It's the sort of thing you could wear taking your kids to their friends' parties. It's the sort of thing you'd wear to do the food shopping.

It's sweet without being cloying, spicy without being raucous and fruity without being overpowering.

Is it worth the hype? Probably not. I only bought it because of the hype, but almost two years in, I still find myself grabbing it when the occasion suits. Not the sort of fragrance to buy if you're only looking to buy one fragrance.

Definitely better in the cooler months, but pretty much a no-brainer for the cost (under €20 for 100ml), caveats accepted.

You won't get compliments by the bucket load, but you'll certainly be told you smell 'nice'.

A solid 7/10.

Individuel has to be one of the most popular fragrance community scents of all time, and a perfume I got for the second time in 2025. What can I say except that for all of your fragrance enthusiasts who have been in this never-ending game for a long time, Individuel is a distant cousin of Joop! Homme, and a fragrance from which Creed’s Original Santal took heavy inspiration.

TOP NOTES
Upon the first spray and a couple of minutes until the top notes start to fade away, I get this delightful mix of lavender, juniper berries, spice, and a touch of pineapple. In my experience, the opening is relatively fresh and clean, but not plain – the fruit and spice give it an energising character.

HEART NOTES
After 5-10 minutes, the scent transitions to the heart (middle) phase. Here, the pineapple and big spice notes start to fade, leaving behind a blend of herbal and floral tones. Lavender stays the most prominent note, and we are introduced to orange blossom similar to the one found in the famous Nikos Sculpture. Compared to the top, the heart is cleaner and simpler. It’s almost like the fragrance “cools off” into a soapy lavender/vanilla laundry scent.

BASE NOTES
For me, the combination of raspberry, vanilla, and top-notch implementation of sandalwood really comes forward, giving a creamy, woody warmth along with fruity and comforting touches. The dry-down (base) has a warm, soft, and subtly sweet quality. It feels like a comfortable sweater or flannel shirt in scent form.

OVERALL
There is always a place in your perfume collection for a versatile, budget-friendly men’s scent that will surprise you with its pleasant character. It’s not a high-end niche masterpiece, but it doesn’t try to be. Instead, it delivers a warm, sweet-woody scent with a touch of fruity freshness. Highly recommended!

Read the full review at scentgrail.com

If you like spicy scents then this one might be for you. If you want to try the fragrance without spending the money, try Nike Brown Men at around AUD10.00 or Gold Spray by Al Haramain.

On a spiciness level between 1 to 3, with 1 being least spicy and 3 being most spicy Montblanc is (1) much cleaner smoother then Nike Brown Man (2) and Gold Spray by Al Haramain (3) being the most spicy fragrance. I think that Montblanc and Nike Brown Man are almost identical on the dry down though.

The test of a perfume depends on whether or not you would buy it again. Personally, I wouldn't buy another bottle.

Montblanc Individuel begins with a sweet, fruity opening where the use of raspberry is instantly noticeable, but it also holds a freshness thanks to the floral notes and a nice use of mint. As it starts to develop, I get some more floral notes and the wood notes start to shine through a lot more with sandalwood standing out the most before the vanilla and tonka bean come in,...

review_title: The Golden Ratio. An Icon, Survived by Its Rival!
review_content:
Montblanc Individuel is a no-brainer for me in my collection.

It's a fragrance that I bought after seeing a YouTuber talk about it, and I knew right from the first sniff, "Hey wow,... there's really something to this!! It's truly special!"

For a long time, I thought it was a homage or a copy of Creed's Original Santal, which is what you might guess just by the scent, since Original Santal smells somehow more natural and a bit more luxurious.

But it isn't!
Individuel: year 2003
Original Santal: year 2005

However, I didn't care anyway, as Individuel smells more interesting to me; it just resonates more within me. Even if it is a bit more chemical/artificial - or maybe that's exactly why?

What does Individuel smell like?
Wow... with this note list, as long as the Old Testament, it's really a challenge to describe it! :D

I would say the raspberry plays a very central role; everything revolves around it. It is surrounded by sweet, floral, woody, and spicy notes, but there are so many and so different that I really find it hard to pick them out individually.

Let's say fruity sweet, with a slight amber touch, a bit sticky, somewhat "alien" or strange/chemical. Also fresh, actually quite a bit! It just doesn't stand out as much because the sweetness shines stronger, and there are so "many little" fresh notes that puzzle together here.
And overall, Individuel smells somehow typically masculine-cologne-like; it simply feels like a confident, sexy signature scent.
A little mysterious, but present, with great projection, yet not arrogant.

The Individuel lover likes to wear their fragrance often; it's also a "grab-and-go" kind of thing. It fits in really any season and temperature, and for most situations. It might be a bit too "happy" for a funeral, but otherwise, it really works for everything. So in the office, you'll quickly make a few new friends with it. ;)

Unfortunately, Individuel has now been discontinued after a long time on the market; it is no longer listed on the manufacturer's website. (But I guess you can still find it here and there in some online shops..)

In any case, I understand it, because even though it is very timeless, fragrances like Explorer or Legend are simply more modern and "do" something similar. But they are a bit easier to grasp in their DNA for the general public.

I still find Individuel to be truly unique, almost a kind of highlight from the house; it is, in scent, a bit like the golden ratio of this fragrance direction for me.

Just perfect!

I would also think of Joop Homme, which is somewhat similar, but Joop Homme is, in my opinion, much more obvious. (Le Male vibe) It smells much more like "the broad masses," you immediately think "I know that one..". And maybe a bit youthful...

Individuel is just... more individual. ;)

It's a fragrance where you are constantly asked what it is, with a nervousness in the voice of the person asking, wishing it were as individual as well. ;D

I should mention that I usually prefer niche fragrances over designer scents, but I find Individuel just has that "certain something"; I know some that are similar, but none that are the same.

So the name is 100% fitting for me. The bottle is beautifully shaped, clear, and yet practical - you just like to hold it!

Longevity and sillage are very good to outstanding for me.

I will definitely always stay Individuel(l)! :)

review_title: A droning, artificial raspberry-tonka bean brew without any class
review_content:
I must strongly agree with my very critical predecessors Cappelusman and Riotsk - how can such a fragrance joke receive almost 80% rating?!

Honestly - sometimes I wonder how some people here would rate a fragrance if they didn't know the average score.

In any case, I don't understand what qualitatively separates "Individuel" from the new, utterly trampled "Karl Lagerfeld for men"?

From my perspective? Almost nothing!
One is completely unjustifiably near the top 100 (of now over 10,000(!) men's fragrances), the other is in one of the last places, and both are ultimately a completely uninspired, synthetically annoying, uncharacteristic soup.

The many comparisons below with "Joop! Homme" are partly valid, but compared to "Individuel," the Joop! classic, although I don't really appreciate it, at least has 100% recognizability, profile, and artistic independence.

The name "Individuel" seems ironic to me - the opposite is the case!

If you definitely don't want to offend anyone olfactorily and want to receive mainstream compliments from less fragrance-savvy people, then feel free to grab this!

The opening of the 11-year-old Montblanc is already dominated by raspberry, somewhat syrupy-artificial, with slight hints of cinnamon and a bit of minty freshness.

Not as overpowering as "Joop! Homme," closer to the skin, but thus also more diffuse and shallow. And definitely somewhat artificial!

It continues with a bit of sweet orange blossom, along with some light floral notes, somehow also reminiscent of Hubba-Bubba gum. Largely style-free.

There are really hundreds of fragrances of this kind buzzing around, mainly thrown on the market by companies like Lacoste, Joop!, Sander, Gucci. So why almost 80%?! People!

From the roughly 30 ingredients mentioned above, I can at best perceive 5-6. Especially the base is a real joke; beyond the aforementioned raspberry, I can at most detect tonka bean, a bit of vanilla, and minimal amber.

Above all, there hovers an annoyingly persistent synthetic tone, like the cheapest synthetic musk in cheap deodorants. Horrible!

So, Montblanc, I can only shout: "Shoemaker, stick to your lasts!" They can make great pens, but with perfumes, they are (see also "Starwalker," "Legend") on a synthetic wannabe perfumer's wrong path.

review_title: When the Fragrance Becomes a Matter of Luck
review_content:
Clone or no clone, that is the question here. No, actually not. It is definitely not a clone. Still, I can understand the association well - Individuel immediately reminds me of Joop Homme. However, in the form of a modernized update.

It starts off fruity and sweet with a strong raspberry note. And yet there is also a minty freshness that vaguely reminds me of Versace's Eros. There, combined with apple, here with raspberry. In terms of content, it works almost identically in my opinion. Overall, I see strong parallels to Eros in the entire composition. As it progresses, the fragrance becomes more floral, but also simultaneously woodier, before it moves into the vanilla-tonka base. The sweet fruity berry note lingers in a subdued form until the end. Overall, the progression feels much more linear in practice than the ingredient list would suggest.

If one wants to draw a comparison to Joop Homme, Montblanc Individuel comes across as significantly more contemporary. I find it not only fresher but somehow more transparent. Moreover, despite all the sweetness, it clearly conveys the modern clean man. This makes it versatile and wearable. Strong enough to be noticed, but not too intense for the office. Quite well balanced, in my opinion. I cannot make comparisons to Creed's Original Santal due to lack of testing.

So I can rate the fragrance itself consistently positively. But I find these obvious quality issues from batch to batch intolerable. Minor deviations are known. And reformulations too. But what is being thrown onto the market in terms of fluctuations, I cannot understand. Can and should such things be factored into the overall rating? I think so. If I have to test three bottles to get "the right" fragrance, I no longer have any understanding for that.

Fragrance: Strong
Price: Convincing
Quality: Matter of Luck

Received today and tested at 25-30 degrees. It is often written here that this scent smells like a Joop clone, but I don't think so. It smells fruity and fresh right after spraying, and it has an interesting scent progression that, while remaining sweet until the end, is not as cloyingly sweet as others in this category. The vanilla, which was not mentioned in the comments, can be detected, I think, from start to finish. Sillage and longevity are quite good; the sillage is still noticeably detectable at a distance of 50 cm after 2 hours, and the longevity of 6 hours is also acceptable. Conclusion: Good scent, but somehow too much of everything; it wants to smell herbal, sweet, fresh, and fruity, but it is not perfectly balanced in any of these aspects. It resembles Creed Santal, but is not quite as harmonious, yet it costs only about 1/3! Despite all the criticism, it's a nice scent and a real compliment magnet, though not as overpowering as, for example, Ultra Male.

So many ingredients are listed above... all create an almost perfect scent that ranks among the elite of men's perfumes... I can very well imagine that it resembles Original Santal, which I haven't tested thoroughly enough yet. First, the hard facts, where Individuel also performs top: Longevity: 8-10 hours (even longer on clothing) Sillage: Medium to strong, better to apply...

review_title: It must be a counterfeit with all the great reviews....
review_content: After all the mostly great reviews about the legend - individuel - I ordered the fragrance blind. It is hyped by most people here and on YT. Many say it smells like Joop Homme and since I am a JH advocate from the very beginning and own all 3 formulations, I thought to myself if it's a kind of flanker - cool - !!! When I unpacked it and had the first sprays on, I was...

review_title: What was your friend's name again, who smelled unbelievably good?
review_content:
I wore the fragrance for the first time at a friend's birthday party. The next day, this friend told me that one of her friends asked, “What was your friend's name again, who smelled unbelievably good?” and she meant me (at least that's what my friend thinks, haha).

Now about the fragrance:
It is fresh and sweet at the same time, so you can wear it almost anytime as long as the temperature is below 20-25 degrees.
I really like the raspberry note, even though it smells quite synthetic.
The fragrance feels mature even though it is not woody or smoky at all.
It doesn't have much to do with shower gel, but still, it smells to me like freshly showered (don't ask me how, haha).

Longevity and sillage: are incredibly good for the price! I perceive the fragrance for over 8 hours.

Bottle: is stylish and “individual” ;)

Price/Performance:
20-30€ for a fragrance (75ml) that projects well, lasts long, and brings compliments. What can you say? Top!

review_title: A Delicious Alternative for Joop! Homme Fans
review_content:
This fragrance has been on my wishlist for a long time. I spontaneously ordered it. Since I really love Joop! Homme, I am very grateful for nice alternatives. Joop! Homme is a scent I love very much but wear very rarely. Best for me because I enjoy smelling it and feel comfortable with it. For the public, it is too well-known and "overused." Nevertheless, for me, it is one of the best fragrance classics of all time.
I read through the comments here and found: It polarizes. I like scents that you either hate or love. Since this is already the case with Joop! Homme, it must be similar with this one. It's interesting to test such fragrances and form your own opinion.
Additionally, Individuel is creating a hype online as an affordable super scent. Many YouTubers recommend this fragrance. You don't have to put too much weight on it, but it's definitely worth a test. Price-wise, you can take a chance on a blind buy. I paid 35 euros for 75ml.

The bottle is really beautiful and fits the image of Mont Blanc. Elegant and simple. It looks valuable.
Since I was very curious about this scent, I was very excited to spray it. I was very pleased. The similarity to Joop! Homme is unmistakable without being a true copy. It starts fresh and fruity. It is much tamer than its pink twin. The sillage is really similarly good, but that sharpness that could trigger sneezing fits is not present. Juniper berry and mint are well perceptible. I struggle with the rest. The fragrance pyramid lists so many notes that I find hard to decipher. Later, sweet notes come into play. Vanilla and raspberry are really very delicious here. Overall, a great composition that makes me feel comfortable from start to finish. Even though it is very sweet, I perceive this fragrance as masculine. The sillage is really as good as with Joop. The longevity is also really very good. I do not know the other fragrance twin from Creed. Since I generally reject niche fragrances, I don't care about that.
Individuel is best suited for younger people. It is quite versatile for occasions. It is suitable for everyday wear, but it would also shine in clubs and at parties. In terms of style, I think it fits better with jeans and a shirt. Seasonally, it is truly an all-rounder. Except on hot days, it can be worn well throughout the year.

Conclusion: Anyone who likes Joop! Homme MUST test this fragrance. A great alternative to the unfortunately overused classic. For anyone who does not like Joop! Homme: Stay away from this scent. By no means a copy, but the similarity is unmistakable. Price-performance: TOP! Hype justified!

review_title: "Fresh fabric softener with a raspberry vibe" Jeremy Fragrance anno 2016?
review_content:
It's been a while since I watched a lot of videos from the enthusiastic perfume YouTuber.
Today, I don't enjoy his videos as much anymore, as he has developed in a strange direction.
What has remained with me is the catchphrase that I always think of when I read "Montblanc Individuel".

I think he hit the nail on the head with that one.
Montblanc Individuel lives up to its name, as I - at least so far - haven't smelled a fragrance that goes in a similar direction.

My beginner's nose initially detects a nice interplay of bergamot, juniper berry, and laundry detergent, with the latter being subtle and hardly disturbing.
As the scent develops, it shifts and becomes slightly spicy and sweet.
In my opinion, the fragrance is consistently accompanied by an artificial nuance, which does not detract from the overall composition!

I think it's a practical perfume for anyone who enjoys clean, fresh, but also delicious scents!
Definitely worth a blind buy, as it is affordable (23€ for 75ml as of Nov. 2020).
