review_title: Joop Homme? No man! This is "Montblanc Original Santal" :-)
review_content:
Hi Folks,

I recently acquired this fragrance and initially had to struggle to get a decent batch (see previous comment from "Gaesch"). I was also a victim of the soap issue and could only truly enjoy this lovely scent with the second bottle.

Much has already been said about the development, and I can only confirm again that the longevity of this little water is extremely impressive, and Montblanc has created a real performance monster here.

Sweetness meets masculinity. That's how I would describe it. Last week, I was at the local "Kaufhof," and they recently have a respectable "Creed" collection. When I sprayed "Original Santal" on my wrist, I was almost blown away. Exactly the same DNA. The Creed is just softer, and Montblanc delivers a much better performance with Individuel. So, if you can get a better Creed scent for very little money, you can't go wrong. Get yourself a bottle while they are still being sold. But beware of batch 08H22H122 ;-) .... that's more like grandma's soap. ^^

Until now, I was not aware that Mont Blanc also produces fragrances. I only knew the company as a manufacturer of fine writing instruments and watches. It was only with Individuel that I discovered they can create exquisite scents as well. A big thank you to Jensemann for being the first to comment on this fragrance. After reading your comment, I bought it blindly and have...

because of the community :-)

I have to admit that the only reason I got this fragrance was the Montblanc brand. No. Of course, because it is supposed to resemble a Creed scent, and who wants to spend 200€ on a fragrance? I do, but not for (this) Creed.

I really wanted to test this fragrance because various perfume lovers were talking about it. And it’s not expensive either.

Well, I noticed the following during multiple tests of the fragrance: it doesn’t change - linear progression from start to finish.

Individually, it smells sweet and fruity the whole time, mainly like raspberry. An Albanian colleague, who is also my hairdresser and had never rated my perfume until that point, said: “you smell good, yes.” It’s worth mentioning a compliment I received from a lady’s perspective.

Personally, I don’t think much of this fragrance. It doesn’t have anything special for me and somehow smells like Hubba Hubba. I like Hubba Hubba, but I don’t want to smell like it. A fragrance you can wear when you don’t know what else to wear.

Longevity and sillage? Quite okay, about average. Especially for this price, acceptable :)

review_title: Fresh as the Mountain Peak of Montblanc
review_content:
I bought this fragrance blind based on the positive reviews here on Parfumo.
Scent:
Even though the fragrance pyramid resembles a novel, I find the scent not particularly complex. Right at the beginning, it smells dominantly fruity-fresh. As it develops, the freshness decreases and vanilla joins the fruitiness, which is not citrusy, orangey, or apple-like as often, but is clearly characterized by berries. The mentioned comparison of a "raspberry-vanilla pudding" is quite accurate.

Effect:
The way the perfume presents itself strongly reminds me of Jil Sander "Sun Men." Although the scent notes of both perfumes have no affinities, the astonishing lightness with which they manage to make heavy fragrance components appear light and fresh remains.
This perfume makes one appear particularly clean and fresh (more than any previously tested sport or aqua fragrance) and is a real treat, especially after showering, both for oneself and for those around.

Longevity:
The longevity is above average. On my otherwise very finicky skin, the scent lasts easily 10 hours. However, on clothing, the longevity is surprisingly low, although I prefer it this way rather than the other way around :)

Sillage:
With 68%, the sillage here is, in my opinion, underrated!
Especially in the first 2 hours after application, I am often complimented on my scent, and I can also perceive it almost the full 10 hours (despite the habituation effect), so I would rate it more at 75-80%.

Bottle:
Very simple but quite elegant bottle design, only the metal cover (between the glass and the cap) wobbles for me (though this may be an isolated case).

Occasions:
"Montblanc Individuel" is the quintessential everyday perfume. Whether you’re chilling on the grass with your buddies after university or heading to a classy evening event, this perfume is always appropriate. I would only avoid it for dates or romantic moments, as there are far more suitable fragrances for that (Rochas Man, Armani Code Ultimate, etc.), which are all significantly less suitable for everyday wear. Nevertheless, the feedback from women regarding this scent is very positive.
Best regards, Waldlichtung

review_title: Raspberry - Vanilla Pudding for the Empty Soul
review_content:
Since I’ve been quite adventurous after trying out a few fragrances from Montblanc, I’ve now also gotten Individuel.

The name isn’t exactly thrilling, and it’s one that’s been heard many times before, but it is definitely unique, especially for a not overly high price.

Montblanc - no hype, no exaggerated advertisements about various extremes of the two poles, and not at all in everyone’s mouth, which I noticed recently. Hardly anyone knows Montblanc or has ever had experience with fragrances from this house. I certainly didn’t until recently, but now I’m really excited and happy to have a few treasures in my collection.

As soon as I have Individuel on my skin, it bubbles up and envelops me with a very unique layer of mint and juniper berry. The juniper berry is very sharp and unripe. It plays the entire top note, and the mint is the icing on the cake. Together, they form a perfectly coordinated team that occasionally needs a red card. Because they can be quite loud on me. The opening is very strong and practically bombs into the olfactory cells. Caution! - Overdosing right from the start could have serious consequences. The other person could vanish as quickly as they appeared. After a few minutes, it subsides, and the mint loses intensity just like the juniper berry. A pleasant scent of bergamot spreads, mixed with a delicate hint of nothing - lavender. I had to really dig in to catch a whiff of the lavender. The quiet lavender doesn’t bother me at all. It’s good when the lavender just sneaks through the scent. Too much of it wouldn’t appeal to me. Cinnamon also arrives after a few minutes and becomes heavier and more intense. It’s high-quality cinnamon that lifts your spirits.

Once the scent has been on the skin for a while, it becomes more elegant and significantly stronger in character. Nothing remains of the shrill nature from the beginning. The jasmine stands out a bit, but it doesn’t particularly distinguish itself in the heart note. After about two and a half hours, I smell noble jasmine that has just begun to unfold. A fitted suit is surrounded by such a fine jasmine scent - fantastic. And definitely not feminine. The orange blossom somewhat dampens the unfolding and keeps everything grounded. The heart note merges with the base note after almost 3 hours. Finally, the moment arrives that delights me the most. It shifts from heaviness back to lightness, and a wonderful opening spreads in my olfactory cells. I think of vanilla pudding enriched with cinnamon and drizzled with warm raspberry juice. But not too sweet - rather a bit bitter in taste, as the raspberry is still unripe. Dull and sensual would fit. Because the vanilla is not too loud, the cinnamon highlights it a bit, and the unsweetened raspberry juice cradles the scent in a classic ambiance of nobility and kindness. A noble dessert, enriched with fresh mint and a few drops of dark chocolate. Also, a fine rosé wine. Such a dessert would surely make women happy as well.

The finish of Individuel is very gradual and suddenly extinguishes when it reaches its final point. Until the end, the fine raspberry - vanilla combination holds its ground. However, it is overshadowed after its peak by musk and sandalwood, which makes it harder and louder again. It is never arrogant or overly boosted. The patchouli then sinks the scent into depth and lets it drown in chocolate. A beautiful play of thoughts and olfactory cells for the empty soul, especially if one hasn’t been feeling so well in the past few days.

I’m surprised that there’s so much “sweetness” in the scent, and that it doesn’t smell like a lollipop factory. It is always muted in its sweet nature, which makes it so interesting.

The price is great, and the bottle is very appealing. A small sensory experience - for women and for men.

The longevity is very good - you can still smell this interesting combination of light sweetness and muted sensuality for hours, which then shifts into hardness. Masculinity wrapped in a lush berry scent, enriched with fine woods and vanilla, that knows exactly how to present itself without shooting anyone out of the game.

I am surprised that there is no comment yet on this truly wonderful perfume. I used to smell this scent so often on my former colleague, and it became my absolute favorite fragrance. To this day. I couldn't name a single creation that smells as good overall and, above all, lasts so long on the skin. Applied in the morning, there's still a bit of "individuality" in the late afternoon. :)
The notes that you can sniff out are clearly the vanilla and, even more beautifully, the raspberry. :) As cute as that sounds, this raspberry (it might also have been juniper berry, it's just both quite fruity :D), I just tried to inhale it when I had "Individuel" on my body. Simply wonderful.

As mentioned, vanilla and something "berry-like" are the main players in this wonderful fragrance that I still love today, and can no longer love, as it seems this scent is no longer available for purchase. Really, really a shame, but it seems to be the case at the moment that truly beautiful fragrances are disappearing and generic scents want to take over.

"Individuel," the name likely fits its wearer, I could always identify with this scent, and I would still do so today.

Mont Blanc, you have created one of the best fragrances that exist, a huge thank you for this! :)

Individually, it starts fresh - sweet, but also citrusy - herbal.

I would like to express my sincere thanks to our perfume "ErhanSaceros" for the bottling.

At first, one can perceive something very pleasantly aromatic - sweet, which is thanks to the juniper berry.

At the same time, there is also something Mediterranean - herbal to be noticed, which beautifully complements the juniper berry and ensures that the top note is given a lovely maritime aura, stemming from the lavender.

There is also a pleasant fresh mint detectable, which is responsible for preventing the scent from drifting into the sticky territory and is supported by a herbal - citrus note, so that the fresh aura is slightly intensified and comes from the bergamot.

In the background, there is a warming sweet - spicy facet present, which lends a pleasant substance to the top note and can only be cinnamon.

This constellation is perceptible on my skin for 20 minutes before the heart note unfolds.

Now something very deep floral, slightly creamy can be perceived, which is underlined by a very pleasant floral, subtly sweet nuance, thanks to the geranium and jasmine.

There is also a certain bright, sparkling note present, which arranges wonderfully with the geranium and jasmine and ensures that the scent remains pleasantly fresh - sweet rather than dull, stemming from the orange blossom.

In the background, there is a spicy nuance of violet that gives the heart note a certain refinement and makes the scent appear very pleasantly floral, yet still masculine - distinctive.

The heart note is perceptible on my skin for 4.5 hours before the base asserts itself.

Now something pleasantly sweet - fruity can be perceived, which is thanks to the raspberry and has always deterred me before a test or even a purchase, as I always thought that raspberry could only appear sweet - sticky.

But that is not the case!

The raspberry is supported by something very pleasantly earthy, slightly spicy, which is due to the patchouli, and it is precisely this component that ensures that the scent does not drift into the sweet - sticky territory, but rather gains a certain noble elegance without losing its sweetness.

At the same time, the base receives something very warm, cuddly, which is thanks to the lovely vanilla and the creamy - spicy sandalwood, evoking a wonderful feeling in me.

There is also a very deep sweet - spicy "tangibility" of the amber, which is responsible for the components of the base merging into a whole.

And yet, one perceives a certain clear, clean, and slightly mossy note in the background, which comes from the musk and the oak moss, setting very interesting accents.

Unfortunately, I could not perceive the tonka bean, vetiver, and dark chocolate, but I can very well imagine that they were merely used as support and let the scent fade away very pleasantly.

Overall, the scent lasts 9 hours on my skin.

The sillage is designed from the beginning to be perceived very clearly at arm's length, and this is maintained for 4 hours before it gradually diminishes until the scent finally completely fades away.

review_title: "Montblanc" has nothing to do with the Alps...
review_content: ... but is a company that has been based in Hamburg since 1906... And apparently also produces quite usable writing instruments, but usable fragrances (at least in this case) not. "Individual" is nothing here; sweet mass-produced slush that is completely interchangeable and an insult to any perfumer who has ever heard even a hint of natural ingredients. Ten...

Anyone who follows the fragrance YouTubers on YouTube, especially Jeremy Fragrance, will have noticed that Jeremy holds this cheapie in high regard. It is marketed as a simple, well-rounded office scent. "Fresh, luxurious fabric softener with a raspberry touch," is the classic quote from the aforementioned YouTuber. Additionally, Montblanc Individuel is considered a fragrance...

... Montblanc! :-) Yes, I know, it actually stands for poorly made, trashy films, but the association was just so fitting. And aside from the Hollywood business, there's nothing wrong with a refined sweet fruit, at least not in terms of perfume. With a staggering 21 ingredients mentioned here, it’s not hard to immediately pick out that one, the raspberry. It is sweet, as one would expect, but I actually don’t expect it to be so dominant in an EDT. However, it is called "Individuel," a name that asserts its validity right from the first spray.

The raspberry is, of course, appropriately packaged here, enveloped by a bit of mint and other herbs. It thrives on a bed of musk and wood shavings, with a few fallen petals scattered around to release their residual scent. And yes, with a bit of imagination, my nose can also detect a slightly chocolatey undertone. Overall, I’m glad that the raspberry doesn’t come off overly sweet. This keeps the sweetness within a very pleasant range that is tolerable for me as a fan of fresh scents.

Fortunately (for me), they refrain from giving the whole thing an earthy and/or prudish base to make the scent come off more gentlemanly, but also more old-fashioned. Overall, this creates a summery sweetness that fits the raspberry harvest season and that I associate more with a Berliner Weiße than with gummy bears. "Individuel" convinces me (aside from the price of around €30 for 100 ml) as an all-year-round scent for any occasion. I just have to feel like wearing it, but that’s easily the case once a week. Well done, Mr. Bourdon, I would say! :-)

PS: Could also pass as a unisex scent with a slightly stronger floral component!

A lot has already been written about this fragrance in the forums, so I'll keep it short and sweet: This one works for me. Fruity, lively, life-affirming. I've already received several compliments because of it. In short - it's not too sweet or overly heavy, but just right to create a harmonious overall impression. I don't need edges and corners; the wearer can bring those.

A little reassurance for fans

The license for production and distribution is held by Interparfums, Paris, and they have no intention of removing this popular men's fragrance from their lineup, as it has now found a loyal customer base worldwide and represents a solid foundation in their fragrance program. (Statement Interparfums.fr)

If you delve a little into the world of perfume, perhaps watching a few top 10 videos, you quickly come across this 20 Euro fragrance.

By now, I've learned from some blind buys, and this one contributed significantly to that. Of course, 20 Euros isn't a huge loss, but it can add up quickly, and the principle remains the same. I'd rather invest in the well-known ones, but back to Individual.

Heard a lot about it, bought it blind for twenty, didn't think much of it, should be enough for freshly washed, but then quickly disappointed.
The scent can best be described as a very, very strong synthetic sweet raspberry. The sweetness isn't even the main issue, even though it's way too much for me, but the exaggerated synthetic quality from start to finish.

In the end, I had to wash it off because it was just disgusting. So far, the worst fragrance I've had the chance to smell.
When you see all the positive reviews here, it really stands out how far opinions can differ.

Trying is better than studying.

review_title: Very sweet raspberries in vanilla sugar, chemically processed
review_content:
I’m glad that this blind purchase cost me very little thanks to a randomly received voucher! Until now, I only knew Starwalker by Montblanc, which I actually liked quite a bit, but it was somehow too ordinary for me. Individuel, on the other hand, is an absolute bombshell that really needs to be approached with caution.

Normally, I would start summarizing the scent development I experienced, but in the case of Individuel, I unfortunately find that extremely difficult. My nose can hardly detect any changes in the many hours after spraying. I also struggle to pick out the numerous fragrance notes listed here. Generally, Individuel has a vanilla-sweet raspberry theme, which seems to be surrounded by many other fragrance notes. You really have to be a big fan of sweet scents to like it. Nevertheless, the fragrance has a slight freshness, possibly caused by the mint. However, I wouldn’t wear it in very high temperatures, as the synthetic elements could be quite overwhelming.

Speaking of synthetics: Wow, someone has really been experimenting in the lab here! A remarkable artificiality envelops the actual scent, which I would probably really like without all this chemistry. To me, the synthetic aspect seems to be used solely to enhance the fragrance in terms of longevity and especially sillage. This likely creates that mixed perfume mush that hits you particularly hard in the first hours. You initially smell like an entire perfumery where a bunch of testers has just been released, the majority of which are women's perfumes. Towards the end of its longevity, the scent becomes relatively pleasant, as it no longer comes off as so cloying and sticky. Therefore, it can possibly be worn in small doses in everyday life. In principle, I perceive Individuel as a pure going-out fragrance, especially since the sillage seems to be made exactly for that occasion.

Longevity: outstanding; lasts easily 12 hours, hardly any scent change

Sillage: with several sprays, like a punch; filling the room in the first hours

Bottle: looks far too understated for the fragrance; well-made; sprayer unfortunately sprays very centered

~Conclusion~

I can completely understand the many negative reviews. I also cannot fully grasp the hype and high rating of this fragrance. Individuel is primarily one thing: not individual! Most of the time, it is an artificially enhanced mixture of a whole bunch of fragrance materials that have been meticulously brewed together in the lab. This synthetic aspect radiates the scent outward very powerfully, where it is also received much better than by the wearer, who unfortunately has to stay in the middle of this cloying scent cloud. Only subtle dosing tames it a little. Nevertheless, Individuel remains under the hood just a rather ordinary fruity vanilla scent, which I even associate more with women's fragrances. Even though I really like fruity and sweet scents, I have to give significant deductions here for the incredibly synthetic implementation. I would have gladly sacrificed the knockout sillage and stunning longevity for less chemistry.

review_title: "Is this supposed to be an office scent???"
review_content:
That's what I wondered when I, motivated by a certain Mr. Fragrance, smelled this fragrance from Montblanc for the first time.

The reason: In the top note, it exudes such a penetrating and, at times, aggressive bubblegum sweetness (like those cube-shaped Hubba Bubba gums that were often found right next to the candy aisle for the "colorful bags" at the kiosk), which it only sheds in the heart note and somewhat "calms down" with more tasteful floral tones.

So, after the initial shock, there follows a "positive sobering up," and the blend of the initially described sweet components with violet, amber, and delicate vanilla works surprisingly well, although I have different ideas about an office scent (this status is predominantly attributed to this fragrance based on my research of many forums and YouTube channels) (not necessarily more subtle, but definitely drier, less sweet).

Calvin Klein ("Contradiction," "Be," or most of the other fragrances from the same house), Lalique (Encre Noire Sport; White), Guerlain (Homme; L'homme ideal Cologne), or Creed (Himalaya) have repeatedly shown how diverse fragrances for this application area can be while maintaining a certain sweetness, fruitiness, or freshness in parallel.
Balance is the keyword here, and I must say that "Individuel" comes across as a bit too angular for me in this regard.

Definitely recommended for summer, but due to its wildness, in my opinion, not as versatile as I would ideally like it to be. However, given the excellent price, it is definitely worth a look.

I bought Mont Blanc - Individuel as a blind buy since I couldn't find it in a perfume store. It seems to have been discontinued. However, it's still available online. It is also said to smell like Creed - Original Santal. I had the chance to test that one, and I like it. So much for the preamble. The Individuel is a bit weak for me. A good office scent in my opinion, as it...

When searching for inexpensive yet "good" perfumes, you can't really overlook this one. I ordered it blindly for the low price. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed. In my opinion, it smells cheap and artificial. Not my thing at all. The performance is okay. The bottle looks stylish. Everything else, personally, I do not like.

Mont Blanc Individual is one of those fragrances that evokes a feeling in me that I cannot describe. The closest would probably be a kind of "safety" or "pleasant warmth" on cold autumn and winter days. I only wear it in the cold seasons and preferably with a black turtleneck sweater. Why? Because it does something right for me that few fragrances can: it remains clean despite its sweetness (which never becomes too much). I don't perceive it as really fresh, but very clean. Like laundry detergent with a slight raspberry-chocolate aftershave touch. Incredibly wonderful. The sillage and longevity are also good, and the price-performance ratio is excellent. You often smell unique, indeed Individual. It is well-received and enjoyed. As for the preferred clothing style with the fragrance, I also wear it with any other clothing, as long as the season is right. But because I feel comfortable in a turtleneck sweater and it is also cozy, it fits doubly well. You can't go wrong with Individual; I have also received compliments. I perceive the scent as rather masculine, although not typical. The name of the perfume fits perfectly. The bottle is pretty, clean, elegant, and has a high recognition value. The somewhat mechanical German style, similar to bottles from Hugo Boss. Professional indeed, but not too much, because Individual builds a bridge. And to clarify my association, here is a description of the "perfect Individual feeling":

It is Monday morning, in the middle of November. It is a freezing morning. The sky is clear, you can see the stars. I step out of the shower and put on my black, comfortable turtleneck sweater. It hugs my torso like a shadow. When I open the closet, the elegant bottle of the Montblanc fragrance catches my eye. I don’t hold back when applying, but I don’t overdo it either. The perfect amount. I grab the car keys and head outside. The top note of the fragrance in my nose, along with the icy winter air. A wonderful combination. I am ready for the day; Individual is my loyal companion, it does not let me down. In the car, I turn on the heating, slowly warming up the chilled vehicle. As I drive, a brilliant scent spreads in the car with the warmth. What a luxury. I feel pleasantly warm, not too much, not too little. It’s perfect. Arrived, Individual accompanies me as expected throughout the day. Clean, well-groomed like the turtleneck sweater and the morning appearance. But through the scent, also a little different, unusual, a bit Individual. I can confidently focus on my tasks; Individual is always there. Maybe today will bring another compliment, perhaps even another special one? Ah, here it comes. Warms the heart. The charmer in the bottle also hides playful facets, skillfully embedding them in the clean and professional. Another successful day is coming to an end. I go to bed. I look in the closet and see a stack of turtleneck sweaters and not far away a silvery bottle. I think I’ll do it just the same tomorrow; after all, winter lasts a few more days.

I am totally in love with this scent. It is simply perfect; quality at an extremely high level (a la Dior homme) and for the price it is available at, in my opinion, it is a must-buy. By quality, I mean the composition, not necessarily the ingredients themselves. There are few fragrances that appeal to me, which is why I think my collection will always remain relatively small, but this one competes with the very best for me.

It actually smells a bit like fresh bed linens... when I close my eyes, I associate it with a bed standing on a colorful meadow, nearby you can see a snow-covered mountain. The weather is icy cold. Berries and various flowers are growing nearby. Funny enough, my girlfriend said when I wore it that I smell like a "meadow full of love."

I am unsure if it is a scent that younger women would go for (my girlfriend compliments me on pretty much every fragrance I wear), but that’s not why I wear it occasionally. At least it is rumored that older women would love it, and I can wholeheartedly confirm that after seeing my mother's reaction.

Why not 100%? I miss a certain sexiness that I simply want in my fragrances (think Ch Men). But it has certainly earned a solid 90%.

Montblanc Individuel - one of the fragrances with an extremely large difference between the batches. Be careful, because you either get the full blast of raspberries that come out of the dryer, or you get something soapy, watery, strange..
How do I know this difference? I ordered a decant that contained an older batch - then I ordered a new bottle and I knew right away "Now I've been caught." Unfortunately, this one was watery, soapy, and it's hard to compare these two fragrances. What a pity.

The scent:
Fruity raspberry mixed with something clean, like you would expect from clothes that come out of the dryer. So a fruity clean guy. You can definitely compare it to Joop Homme - but it leans more towards the youthful side. In my opinion, this makes it very mass-compatible. You can wear it anywhere and anytime. Caution: Synthetic notes cannot be avoided here either, you can smell that - but I find it not that bad.

Longevity/Sillage:
Good! For the price, you can expect worse. It lasts about 4 hours on me with decent projection, then another 2-3 hours close to the skin.

Bottle:
Different! But nice. It looks good and definitely does not seem inferior to me.

Conclusion:
Get the older batches, because they are really good! The new batches seem to be diluted across the board, no comparison to the good old batches.
Otherwise: A great everyday scent that is wearable anytime and anywhere. If you don't like Joop Homme - still give it a try! This one has a Joop Homme vibe, but is implemented in a much more modern way.

In direct comparison, Individuel is the younger brother of Legend. Bright, sweet, and fruity, he screams for attention and goes out during the day and in nice weather to tell everyone how good his mood is.
Legend is the older, seductive brother who has left his youthful experiences behind and wants to appear a bit more serious.

Both brothers are still young and regularly go out. They can party, but they cannot distinguish between natural and artificial notes. It doesn't really matter at the party anyway, as all the scents mix together into a mush.

Individuel is sweet, fruity, and fresh. However, I can't pick out individual notes from the huge mix. The sweetness fades over time, making the scent feel a bit rounder on the skin. It always remains bright and cheerful.

Legend also starts fruity-fresh, but less sweet and a bit darker. It also smells artificial; I have to look up the notes, as I don't recognize them. Legend is a bit heavier, darker, and less sweet than Individuel.

Perhaps they are not brothers at all, but rather someone who wants to be Individuel during the day and Legend in the evening. Will he ever achieve this?

The scent smells almost identical to Joop Homme from the top to the base note (including the one-dimensionality), so I will spare myself the attempt to describe the fragrance, as the Joop! Homme scent is likely known to everyone. The difference is that Joop has a stronger cherry scent, while Montblanc Individuel is more mild and berry-like. As for the sillage and longevity: it lasts significantly longer than the currently watered-down, reformulated Joop, and the sillage is better too; even after 4 hours, you can be detected within a radius of 10 cm with the fragrance. In comparison: the current Joop is only barely perceptible close to the body after 2 hours. Conclusion: a perfect Joop Homme clone that is superior to the current watered-down version in terms of performance and sillage, but inferior to the original Joop from 1988. However, since the original Joop is no longer available, Montblanc Individuel should be the first choice for nostalgics of the pink juice :)

review_title: Does Individuel mean it smells different on every nose?
review_content:
I read the classification of this fragrance with surprise and wonder, because I don't smell most of it. Then I read the notes, and again, I don't smell most of them.

Could the "Individuel" stand for the idea that there is something for everyone, and depending on one's nose, circumstances, and personal state, different notes from the wild mix are perceived?

Right at the spray head, I smell the same as in the first minutes after application: something reminiscent of cough drops.

For one or two hours, a somewhat Al-Rehab-"Silver"-like fresh floral scent follows, which I like. And apparently women do too, even at high temperatures near the 30° C mark.

Then, soap sets in, which lasts for many hours and is accompanied by a mix that I can't distinguish. This is the clean, fresh, synthetic, but not unpleasant part, where I see parallels to Dior Sauvage. It gradually weakens, changes slightly into something again undefinable, and eventually, it is only perceivable with the nose on the skin.

I don't perceive disturbing synthetics, nor do I find it too strong. It spreads out, is noticeable, but not intrusive. I find it okay and have the impression that women like it more than I do.

Does it smell interesting, complex, and/or profound? No.
Does it come across as clean, unobtrusive, not overwhelming, and suitable for many occasions? Yes.

I was actually made aware of this scent by Jeremy, and it piqued my interest (as he praised it highly a few years ago), and I must say that the description "Fresh fabric softener with a sweet raspberry touch" fits very well.
At first, it smells very strongly of "artificial" raspberry, which, however, transitions after a while into the described, more pleasant sweetness and the scent of laundry. It is not particularly complex, but it simply smells fresh.
Overall, the fragrance smells very pleasant throughout the opening with a sweet note, is not at all overpowering, and is therefore, in my opinion, also suitable for the office.

The longevity is really long due to it being a synthetic scent (about 7-8 hours for me), and I could still faintly perceive it the next morning.
The price-performance ratio is really very good; you get a fresh, sweet fragrance with good longevity for comparatively little money!

Overall, for the low price, it is truly worth recommending if you want to smell clean/fresh!

For my work at a Swabian car manufacturer, I was looking for a fragrance suitable for the office environment. Since my department consisted only of men who were not really into perfumes, scents like "L'Homme" or "Boss Bottled" were not an option for me. Every meeting smelled of those, and I didn't want to be a part of that.

Through my first office scent "Legend Spirit," which was recommended to me in a perfume shop, I came across the Montblanc brand. Since I already liked Legend Spirit very much, I searched online for more fragrances from Montblanc, and "Individuel" caught my eye. I was intrigued by the rather rare raspberry note. After further research, I learned about the quality differences among various batches, but I found a small online shop that provided me with the batch number before shipping.

As for the scent itself, I can only say that it fully meets my expectations. Thanks to the lasting raspberry note, it stands out from the crowd of office fragrances without being too intrusive. During my time at the car manufacturer, I constantly received compliments, and my boss even asked me which perfume I was wearing.

For me, "Individuel" is a perfect office scent for anyone who wants to stand out a bit from the crowd and doesn't mind a rather atypical fragrance note. Additionally, the H/S is appropriate for an office scent, and the price is unbeatable. If you get the right batch, you can't go wrong with this fragrance.

Yes hello, who are you?
Let me guess, Joop! Homme?
Oh no, not at all.

I don't know Original Santal by Creed, so I can't make a comparison!
Joop! Homme, yes I know that, so I can definitely say that the first 10 - 30 minutes of the scent are quite similar.

Individuel has quite a few notes, it would definitely make a very tasty dish in the kitchen!
( let's leave out the amber and oakmoss ;) )
With all this chaos, it's difficult to perceive all the notes over time.
Clearly, I find raspberry, mint, orange blossom, sandalwood, cinnamon in the foreground.
In my opinion, the scent remains the same for me at least for several hours after the initial application; after 10 hours, I can still faintly smell the same scent as shortly after spraying when I sniff my wrist! (that Joop! Homme similarity, fruity-woody)

Longevity:
On the skin, quite good: 10 hours were already in.

Sillage / Projection:
I find it strong in the first hour, not overwhelming but clearly noticeable.
After the first hour, it pulls back close to the skin (at least for me)

Conclusion:
To put it briefly, the scent is a bit more robust, more masculine than Joop! Homme!
It could have been so nice between us, you really appeal to me.
If only you had a little more sillage / projection...

( Synthetic?! So what!? )

review_title: Unfortunately not like it used to be
review_content:
Sadly, the perfume has nothing to do with what I remember...
The scent has become strongly soapy and the longevity/sillage is so poor that even D&G The One Edt makes this one look old...
Very unfortunate!
By the way, the batch is 08H22H123

Overwhelming in the 2nd hour I'll keep it short and sweet I bought it blind because the 84% really piqued my curiosity. The price was right, you can't go wrong, and at the moment I like the combination of "Fresh/Fruity" The opening leaves deep furrows on my face.. And I start to think.. Not my scent Not my style Not what I wanted An hour later: With a smiling face, I sit...

Hello everyone,

I received it today and I'm torn because it is a heavenly scent.
My girlfriend kept sniffing my neck while we were window shopping.
"YES, this is it," she said to me, "the scent suits you *grrr nibble*"
I think this is a fragrance that I will keep buying over and over again!

The fragrance itself has already been well commented on, and I can only agree!
A great all-rounder, if I may say so?
Because it really suits every occasion, except for sports!
And its intensity is truly remarkable and admirable.
Just a spritz on the right and left of the neck is enough, and it lasts a very "very" long time!

Best regards,
Mikka

review_title: A true gem for little money / You can't go wrong with this one
review_content:
Hello everyone,

wishing you a wonderful holiday season as the year comes to an end... how time flies!

Today, I would like to share a few (very few) words about a fragrance that has been a part of my life for many years, the Individuel EAU DE TOILETTE.

I can't even say how many bottles I have emptied, but we're definitely talking double digits soon.

What makes this fragrance special and why I loved it so much is the FACT that it always works, always fits, never clashes/disturbs/annoys you, and on top of all these positive aspects, the performance back then was really quite good! A normal workday, a date, or a night out at the disco until the next morning - all of that was no problem.

The scent is generally sweet, fruity, floral, lightly fresh, pleasantly soft, and has a slight fabric softener note or a clean VIBE, which is why I celebrated it so much. Yes, it does have a certain synthetic quality due to the price, but it is FAR from being bothersome.

It is very well received by women, and that was always one of the main reasons for me (+ back then) why I always chose it, as I also met my wife with this fragrance.

The current or last batches haven't been as great (good) in terms of performance. If you see a batch from before 2017, then feel free to buy it blindly, and YOU will experience the MAGIC of the fragrance, and the performance is a whole different story.

A truly beautiful fragrance, and thank you dear Individuel EAU DE TOILETTE for the wonderful moments!

Wishing you a nice day/evening, or whenever you read this review, best regards, Benny
_______

review_title: The best blind buy I've had in a long time! Performance and all-rounder
review_content:
Do you like Joop! Homme? No? Then Montblanc's Individuel is not for you.
However, if you like the idea behind Joop Homme but are looking for something that isn't overly penetrating and sweet for everyday wear: then your search ends here.
I made it my mission to put together a good fragrance collection on a low budget, and after purchasing Nautica Voyage, Al Rehab Silver, and many others, there was no way around Montblanc's Individuel.
About the scent: Raspberry, vanilla, and mint create an incredibly good, sexy, and MASCULINE fragrance that, although sweet scents often do, doesn't get on my nerves. It's a tamed Joop! Homme with more depth and maturity.
Regarding sillage and longevity: I get very good longevity from this scent (around 8 hours), and my T-shirts still smell of the fragrance the next day, even though I haven't sprayed anything on them. The sillage is also very good for the first few hours, creating a pleasant medium-sized scent cloud around you.
Bottle: A very elegant and well-designed bottle that is flat and well-crafted.

Conclusion: Great everyday scent for younger gentlemen in the 18-30 age range. Very good for university/school/work, also suitable for dating and partying. Incredible quality for a ridiculously low price (22 euros for 75 ml).

The fragrance is somewhat synthetic on one hand (which is not surprising given the raspberry note), yet it offers an unexpected complexity and depth. Nevertheless, the scent is not heavy, but rather light with its sweetness. One could also say it is easy to wear and mass-appealing. It fits well in the office, on a date, and in other situations.

I have been testing Creed for some time. I have always liked “Original Santal.” Only the price of the “harder” and “more masculine” Joop put me off.
Until I stumbled upon the original scent and its description here.
I blindly ordered the MBI for a tenth of the price of Creed.
My nose can’t detect any significant differences between the MBI and the COS. The Santal is probably a tad fresher. But I can’t confirm this. Both are wonderful scents. But……………. I can’t wear it two days in a row. After wearing it once, the scent rather haunted me on the second day than accompanied me.
As a nice change for occasional wear, it is certainly suitable. But for multi-day wear sessions, it is too straightforward and unsuitable for my nose.

I have read almost only great things about Montblanc Individuel here on parfumo, so I ordered it blindly. However, I first tested Original Santal by Creed at the local Douglas to ensure I wasn't completely off regarding the fragrance direction. Since I liked the Creed, nothing could really go wrong. And indeed, the two fragrances are hardly distinguishable to my nose, with...

that's what I thought when I sprayed Individuel for the first time and held the bottle in my hand.
Holy moly, this stuff is sweet! It practically knocks your fillings out! The raspberry clearly dominates the fruity top note. Too sweet for me, I thought it was a bad purchase.

But if I've learned one thing here in the forum, it's that you have to take your time with a fragrance and see it as a whole. And that's exactly what happened. After about an hour, the raspberry takes a step back and a fresh, slightly minty, sensual scent emerges that completely convinced me.

I still need to get used to the start of Individuel, but the rest is simply heavenly!

...this fragrance can be categorized. If you get the right batch, then you’ll experience the full blast of raspberry fabric softener. The scent itself is fresh with a clear inclination towards a ripe raspberry. The longevity of 4 to 5 hours and even still noticeable after 7 hours - at least with my batch - is really solid for this price. Especially in everyday life, this fragrance is just right and you can't go wrong with it. For those who want a more modern version of Joop Homme paired with a bit of Original Santal, this fragrance is exactly the right choice.

As already mentioned absolutely accurately by my predecessor, this is a perfume that smells strikingly similar to Original Santal by Creed, and in my opinion, it even smells better.

I am actually a big admirer of the fragrances from the house of Creed, especially appreciating their high quality, but here I find the "imitation" even better.

The OS is, in my view, a bit sweeter, while the Individuel smells fresher and more harmonious than its counterpart. For some, the fragrance might be a bit too sweet, but that is always a matter of taste.
The longevity of the scent is also very good.

For a third of the price of the much more expensive Creed water, you get a high-quality perfume here that invites you to dream.

review_title: Fresh Laundry with a Hint of Raspberry
review_content:
It was my first perfume that I ever bought for myself and wasn’t given as a gift. I chose it because it was supposed to have a very good price/performance ratio, so I bought it blind.

When I first sprayed it on a warm summer day right after showering, the fresh scent filled my nose; it simply smells like freshly washed clothes with a hint of raspberry. If you pay close attention, it does smell a bit synthetic, there’s no doubt about that, but you can hardly blame the perfume for the price. That day was also the day I received my first compliment for smelling good, and I always fondly remember that.

I can definitely recommend the perfume for those who don’t want to spend too much on a fresh fragrance in the warmer months. And it’s also great for going to bed and always smelling fresh, so it’s not a waste :)

I don’t need to write much here! Anyone who wants to know how Individuel smells just needs to read the comments on Original Santal.
The top note of Individuel is a bit fresher. After an hour, however, the scents are almost identical to my nose.

Great fragrance and an excellent alternative to the much more expensive Original Santal by Creed.

I recently snagged a bottle at the Souk for a good price. The batch is from 04/20. It was listed here in first place as "similar to 'Original Santal | Creed'." I thought I’d give it a try since Creed is really expensive. I have a decant of that from a nice Parfumo. The Santal and the Montblanc definitely go in the same direction scent-wise. The Montblanc becomes relatively sweeter than the Santal quite quickly. The Santal is more fruity, slightly tart. The Santal definitely comes across as more high-quality. It should be at that price. However, I think I still made the right choice. The huge difference that would justify the massive price difference is simply not there. If you like it quite sweet and fruity, this one is a good option. Otherwise, it’s better to go for the Santal. I find the longevity to be very good. It was detectable on my little test sprayer on the wrist from noon until evening. The Santal held on even longer and was still faintly noticeable the next morning. I didn’t find the sillage to be that extreme in either case. But with one spray, that wasn’t to be expected either. The sprayer works great. There are worse ones in expensive perfumes. The bottle looks simple but solid.
I don’t need to emphasize the price-performance ratio here. 75ml for under €30 is already great.
Conclusion: I don’t regret the purchase and probably won’t buy the Santal again since the Montblanc is a good substitute for the Santal (with some compromises) for a small price. My tip: buy a sample of the Santal and the inexpensive Montblanc bottle and then decide. And don’t wait too long, it has been discontinued.
By the way, I can’t see the similarity to Joop Homme (which I read often here). For me, it’s much more artificial, sweeter, stickier, and less fruity. I didn’t like that at all. I hope I could help those who are undecided ;)

For me, this fragrance strongly reminds me of Davidoff's "Cool Water," with this one being a bit more minty and a little fruitier. I personally find it quite appealing, but... When you take a look at the extensive ingredient list and then spray a sample on your skin, you do wonder: "What am I actually perceiving from all of this?" Raspberry? Cinnamon? Musk? ...I don't know if...

review_title: Montblanc Belanglos - now also available in your stores!
review_content:
Dear friends of individuality,

today I want to talk again about Montblanc Individuel. There isn't much to say about the fragrance, but since I believe it is completely overrated, I still want to share my thoughts in a review.
One major point that comes up repeatedly with this fragrance is its similarity to Joop! Homme. Is Montblanc a twin or not? No, it is not!
However, it does contain a significant part of the fragrance DNA of Joop! Homme and has reminded me of that scent from the very beginning. Montblanc also has a large portion of its own fragrance DNA, which comes across as fresh and synthetic-fruity.
So, take a good portion of Joop! Homme, mix in some freshness, and round it off with a synthetically intrusive raspberry. The result is a confusingly sweet-fresh medley with a lab-created raspberry. I don't know the Santal from Creed, but if it really smells exactly like the Individuel, then I understand the popularity at this price even less.

With Montblanc, the price is manageable, but there are so many good fragrances in this price segment. However, I am also not a fan of Joop! Homme, so you as a Joop! fan may see it differently.
I would love to elaborate on the character of the fragrance based solely on the notes, but this scent is so generic, cheap, and olfactorily exaggerated and confusing that I find it neither possible nor necessary. It's not a truly unpleasant scent when viewed by the general public, but it is one that you smell today and forget tomorrow. Montblanc has created nothing of individuality here, so the name completely misses the mark.
Another prime example of why Jeremy's recommendations rarely resonate with me. But well, he also suggests Bleu de Chanel edT in the club...

The sillage is at best average. Freshly sprayed, the scent does rise from the forearm to the nose, but it quickly settles in close to the skin. Likewise, the longevity of 5-6 hours is not exactly impressive.

The bottle offers what is inside, namely absolutely nothing special.

Conclusion: If you love Joop! Homme or at least like the fragrance direction, you should take a look at this one. I cannot recommend this concoction to anyone else.

Thank you for reading!

New to the forum, I dared to make some blind buys of the cheaper fragrances, many of which "went south." After receiving 50 ml of Montblanc's Individuel for about 20 € including shipping, I thought during the first test: Oh dear, you can pass this on right away. So sweet, so floral, so berry-like... I even tried to wash the "stuff" off me, I found it so...

review_title: Third-Class Trash Scent / No Comparison to Creed Original Santal
review_content: I can only agree with Fabiano's comment, but I must add that the comparison made by some dilettantes to Creed's Original Santal is severely flawed. Only a part of the top note vaguely reminds (but only for the first few minutes) of Santal. Otherwise, these two fragrances are worlds apart. Creed is undoubtedly overpriced, but qualitatively it is definitely of much higher quality, less synthetic. Unfortunately, I bought this scent as a blind buy due to the comparisons to Santal... I totally regret it. I am now ordering Santal, the sample convinced me. With Montblanc, after 30 minutes, there are bizarre, artificial "aromas" that I am desperately trying to eliminate with soap.

Montblanc has created a fragrance here that will remain modern for many years.
The scent resembles Creed Original Santal.
I affectionately call the Creed Unoriginal Santal, as Montblanc was the first to see the light of day.

The fragrance has a lovely raspberry note, with mint and vanilla. It is fresh yet also fruity and spicy.

For the price, this fragrance is an absolute must!

Anyone looking for a Creed alternative will find themselves very well served here.

review_title: Sweet - Woody - Synthetic - But where is the raspberry?
review_content:
After I got to know Parfumo and read through various reviews, I actually decided to go for a blind purchase. What could possibly go wrong with a fresh raspberry potion? Back then, Individuel was still in the Top 100! I thought I would surely like it.

So what went wrong? Well, my nose went wrong. I sprayed the scent on my wrist and sniffed. Briefly fresh, then sweet-woody. What about fruity? The fruit is rather overshadowed. And what about the raspberry now? I have frozen raspberries every morning, and what I smell in Individuel as fruit does not smell like raspberries. Okay, I can imagine that someone might think the fruity component could smell like a raspberry. At least it goes in the berry direction.
I also don't see any similarity to fabric softener; the sweetness is too heavy and penetrating for that - and above all, the sweetness is too boring for me because I miss the playfulness. Just too well-behaved, the boy.

In any case, I was disappointed. The scent remained quite linear sweet-woody. Over several years, I have repeatedly tried to get closer to the scent. But we have not warmed up to each other until today. During the last spray, I was finally annoyed by the sweetness and was glad when the smell was gone.

However, my colleagues liked the scent! They found my Lacoste pour Homme by comparison not nearly as good.

When I first read the comments about this apparently great fragrance, I thought it could be something special for us, but I was far from correct.
The perfume is greatly overrated. I find nothing about the scent that smells fresh; it immediately goes into an extremely overpowering powdery direction, which I do not like at all. After 10 minutes, I already had a headache, so I tried to wash it off. The sillage is too extreme for me; considering it as an everyday scent feels almost dangerously unfair.
But tastes do differ. The fragrance pyramid sounds very exciting, but something went wrong here, as I only smell raspberry vanilla cinnamon, and it’s to the point where it’s no longer enjoyable.
On the other hand, the longevity is very good, as after 6 hours it became somewhat more pleasant, but it still won't be for me.
The bottle, on the other hand, I like very much; it looks like a small flask that is very well done.
I truly cannot understand why this fragrance is so hyped here.

review_title: A Dream Not Just for Christmas Time
review_content: I will keep it brief. Its name is Progamm. A very individual, fruity, slightly but very slightly oriental scent. At the start, it comes across as very fruity. Orange and raspberry are clearly recognizable. After a few hours, the juniper berry and sandalwood stand out. I only know juniper berry from gin :-) This remains the case until about 8 hours in. What is very...

review_title: Not so incredibly individual but still a price/performance killer
review_content: This fragrance is a mix from the category of fabric softener and all-in-one sports shower gel. - for me, it would be something like "heavenly blue" or "fresh cloud breeze" - now for your bed linens. A very clean, digestible scent that is versatile but also carries a hint of synthetics. I see it among everyday fragrances, which can easily be worn in jobs with customer contact...

Due to the lack of availability in local stores, I once again ordered a perfume blind.

This time, a representative from Montblanc, which, based on the descriptions and the fragrance pyramid, should match my taste perfectly.

And what can I say, it did. I can understand the often-cited resemblance to Joop's Homme in the first few minutes. A surge of fruity notes floods the nose and surroundings. An opening that, considering the cold and clear shape of the bottle, I wouldn't have expected.
Well, that shouldn't deter me. I'm curious about what will happen next. And quite a bit happens.
Whether the nose is just slowly recovering or the fragrance is only gradually settling down, after about 20-30 minutes a calming freshness blends into the berry cocktail, giving it a fresh elegance that should fit smoothly into almost any life situation.
As if adapted to the normal daily rhythm, Individuel transforms again as the hours progress. This time, the freshness fades a bit, and in its place comes a cozy mix of warm vanilla, amber, and tonka bean, which conveys a feeling of coziness and a pleasant atmosphere.
If a hint of woody vetiver had peeked around the corner here, the fragrance would have scratched the 90% mark.

It is likely due to its pompous appearance that Montblanc's Individuel does not only receive affection. For my part, I find it extremely successful and look forward to experiencing the versatility of this perfume anew each time.

Rather a typical and sweet everyday fragrance that can only "convince" through a synthetic freshness and an almost overwhelming raspberry.

With this number of fragrance notes, it is already to be suspected that hardly any are truly identifiable. With a lot of imagination, perhaps juniper and chocolate break through, but otherwise the scent strikes me as quite linear and one-dimensional, despite the seemingly complex fragrance pyramid.
Longevity and sillage are, in my opinion, rather disappointing. To truly enjoy the scent, you have to reapply it every 3 to 4 hours; otherwise, it's a short-lived pleasure.
The bottle has a cool shape but is otherwise absolutely unremarkable. The glass feels quite thin, and the spray head is nothing special.

Overall, Montblanc Individuel is not a bad fragrance. I really enjoy wearing it on cooler days in autumn and spring, as the mix of sweet raspberry and freshness particularly comes into its own for me. However, the scent is neither unique nor does it have noteworthy performance. At €23 for 75 ml, this purchase didn't hurt, but there are significantly better candidates for this price.

Edit: By now, I actually like it much more than I initially thought. The freshness compared to a Joop Homme is, in my view, the biggest reason to buy it.

review_title: My Ticket into the World of Olfactory Experiences
review_content:
It was 2015, and I was in my mid-20s searching for a perfume that stood out from all the stuff that was uniformly worn by the young men I knew at the time. Even though I know today that the scent is no longer a hidden gem, the design of the bottle and the name "Individuel," along with a few recommendations from larger perfume YouTubers, made it a good decision to buy the fragrance blind.
I opened it, sprayed it, and it was love at first sight.
I never had associations with cotton candy or syrup. I felt like the cleanest person on earth; with this perfume, you can't lose a court case... I never had to test that, but I wouldn't be surprised. The blend of spices and the metallic undertone were a novelty for me back then, as I had only been a fan of Paco Rabanne's Black XS and Boss Bottled until that point.
Unfortunately, after the first bottle, I purchased my second one from a less reputable site. The scent was not quite as good as I remembered, and the longevity and sillage left much to be desired.
When I learned that my favorite scent was to be discontinued, I wrote to Mont Blanc and sadly received the heartbreaking confirmation that I would have to say goodbye.
When I think back to my studies, you will probably always remain in my memory. If it is ever re-released, I will definitely spend money on it, and I mean seriously.
For anyone who still has an old bottle in their possession, consider yourself lucky.

review_title: Raspberry with a Laundry Detergent Vibe
review_content:
This was one of my first fragrances that I acquired this year as an office scent.

SCENT:
What does it feel like to wear *Montblanc Individuel*?
- Like wearing fabric softener (probably the lavender) with raspberry aroma. It also has a synthetic undertone to my nose. It doesn't have any particular association with a specific moment for me - it's just a clean man scent. Nothing more, nothing less. I don't perceive the comparison to Joop Homme at all. The latter is significantly stronger and smells strongly of sour cherry rather than synthetic raspberry.

When do I prefer to wear *Montblanc Individuel*?
- Preferably during the daytime and in the office. However, I wear it less often now since I own Prada Lhomme, which handles the *clean man* use case much better with its luxurious iris note.

How does this scent differentiate itself from other soap/fresh laundry/office scents that I have smelled so far?
- Dior Homme Intense: alongside the soapy scent, also wood and vanilla (more of a date character)
- Prada L'Homme: significantly more luxurious iris scent, which for me is in a different league.
- Prada L'Homme Intense: for me, more of an upgrade to a date scent, as the vanilla is very prominent here.
- Prada Amber pour homme: also very soapy and for me the number 2 soap, which also smells luxurious.

SILLAGE/ LONGEVITY:
- The sillage is good.
- The longevity is good.

BOTTLE:
- Looks like a field flask. Very elegant and well-designed. However, I don't associate the scent (raspberry) with the name and the bottle together. But okay.

PRICE/VALUE:
- I bought the 75ml variant for just under €25. The price/value ratio is really good.

CONCLUSION:
For everyone who has a tight budget and wants a solid laundry dryer scent for the office. However, those who invest about €50 more will get Prada L'Homme, the number 1 for the office, and will surely receive a promotion soon for the top-notch scent :-)

review_title: Raspberry Fabric Softener in the Tumble Dryer
review_content:
Montblanc Individuel is also an EdT that is rightly hyped on YouTube, available for little money yet offering good scent quality. Fragrance Dawg has mentioned several times that the fragrance bears no resemblance to Joop Homme. This is not entirely true, as there is a slight association present at first. However, it does not veer into the overly sweet territory like JH; instead, it is less heavy and simply smells cleaner. It is, however, far from being fresh. Individuel reminds me of a classic fabric softener used for towels and bed linens. When these come out of the tumble dryer and the laundry is still warm, you have to imagine the scent somewhat like that.

Individuel is suitable for rather cool to mild days, not for the height of summer. If worn then, it should be applied discreetly and reserved for the evening. The EdT is also suitable as a club scent. In the office, I find it usable as well, but here, just 2 sprays are sufficient. The longevity and sillage are really good; Individuel lasts about 7 to 8 hours on me. If you want to smell clean and well-groomed without spending much money, you should definitely consider this or at least give it a try. Montblanc fragrances are true price/performance kings!

The price-performance ratio of this fragrance is quite good, in my opinion. It's nothing special but also not generic. The bottle is well-made and fits perfectly in the bag, as it is quite slim. Longevity and sillage are not very impressive.

Good fresh scent for spring and summer, for me one of the top perfumes from the brand Montblanc, a wonderful fragrance that is affordable and also smells fresh, suitable for everyday wear or in the office.

Fragrances that I have added this year as office scents.

SCENT:
How does it feel to wear *Montblanc Individuel*?
- Like wearing fabric softener (probably the lavender) with raspberry aroma. It also has a synthetic undertone for my nose. It doesn’t evoke any particular association with a specific moment for me - it’s just a clean man’s scent. No more and no less. I don’t perceive the comparison to Joop Homme at all. The latter is significantly stronger and smells strongly of sour cherry for me, not synthetic raspberry.

review_title: An absolute classic and rightly so
review_content:
I haven't had Montblanc Individuel under my nose for years and I regret it a little. This scent is still so good!

A fresh-fruity fragrance with a pleasant sweetness and a very, very subtle spiciness.

Delicious juniper berry with various herbs (mint is worth mentioning), a pleasant raspberry that adds a nice fruity sweetness and your floral nuances. The floral notes, however, do not make the scent overly floral. They are very subtly crafted.

As it develops, you increasingly notice this wonderful raspberry note, which gives a really nice fruitiness.
Although the scent already has a certain fruitiness from the juniper berry.

Individuel is simply an absolute "No Brainer," as people say nowadays.
This scent works every time.
It just smells good, it is well-received, and I think the "clean man scent" fits here just as well.
The impression of "freshly showered" might also fit.

Many may find this scent boring, but I do not at all.
I just think this scent is really good!

For me, one of my favorite scents. Smells very, very delicious with sweet raspberry, vanilla, and freshness. I would love to eat such a fragrance. For this low price, you get quite good longevity of about 4 hours. On clothing, it lasted about 2-3 days for me and is a guaranteed compliment magnet. In my opinion, you can order this blindly, as the price between 20-25 euros is not too high.

Best regards

Maik

Shortly after spraying, the two main characters of this fine fragrance begin their play: the velvety and never overpowering vanilla and the mix of fresh berries. Right from the start, cinnamon joins in, giving the scent a pleasant spiciness and preventing Individuel from appearing too sweet. I immediately envision a large bowl of vanilla ice cream with warm raspberry sauce,...

A true everyday hero! The first spray hits you directly with a sweet raspberry note that isn't too sticky - really pleasant and not at all overpowering.

What makes the scent truly special is the blend of sweet and fresh. You get a clean fragrance, thanks to lavender and a bit of citrus, which gives off some shower gel vibes but has a certain twist from the raspberry.

The longevity is solid and the sillage is okay as well - which also describes the character of the fragrance well, as it is by no means intrusive. For me, it is the perfect office scent.

At a price of around €25, it's also an absolute value for money monster!

I bought it for the second time at Notino and I don't recognize the scent anymore. I previously had a version from 2016. In the meantime, the scent could no longer be perceived after 1 hour.

Scent:
Nevertheless, this scent that I originally bought is a very special one. I understand why it is associated with Joop Homme. In both, you cannot perceive all the components, but you hear a jumble of several sweet and floral notes. This one is significantly fresher compared to Joop.
Mainly, the scent starts off fresh for me, then becomes sweeter over time. The floral component also becomes stronger as time goes on. The raspberry note is not common and makes the scent stand out immediately and come across as individual.

Occasions/Seasons:
Generally, a scent that can be worn in any season. However, I prefer to wear it in autumn and spring. For me, it's an everyday perfume, as you will hardly encounter any negative reactions with it. I've also received consistently positive feedback at work. As someone over 40, I definitely wouldn't wear it anymore, as it is just too playful.

Conclusion: Great price, you can't go wrong at all. I'm just surprised at what version I ended up with. Reformulation?

A fresh, slightly sweet men's fragrance with a raspberry note and a hint of vanilla. It feels clean and pleasantly unobtrusive - perfect for everyday wear and the office. The longevity is generally good, but the sillage is rather subtle and quickly becomes close to the skin. I still like it and find it a shame that it has been discontinued.

Smells simply clean and aquatic, making it particularly suitable for summer, but it also works as an all-rounder.

Very worthwhile for the price. In this regard, one can hardly complain about the longevity and sillage.

Definitely receives some compliments.

In my opinion, however, it is more suitable for younger adults or teenagers.

review_title: Unexpected Visit from a Pleasant Guest
review_content: When I spray this fragrance, a pleasant freshness and lightness comes into play, which I did not expect. I can smell the orange blossoms, also a lot of bergamot, but raspberry? They didn't put that in my bottle, or I don't recognize the scent of that berry. What surprises me at first is the closeness to Joop Homme, which, however, is absolutely wearable for me. A very...

The fragrance is only my third scent. The Mont Blanc Individuel is wearable in any situation and in every season. In my collection, it is definitely the "all-rounder" and yet not boring or inconspicuous, but with intense fragrance nuances.

Starts fresh, clean, and airy (probably from lavender + mint) and sweet, then quickly adds a bit of spice; the sweetness from the raspberry note (like raspberry candies, not fruit) mixed with the spiciness of cinnamon adds a unique accord to the fresh-clean notes. I also discover a faint powdery note that slightly enhances the airy-fresh, clean scent of the fragrance; fresh-clean candy-sweet and lightly spicy-clean, straightforward and not very evolving (although the fragrance contains many different notes), it has a fresh clean aromatic quality with moderate sweetness, mainly candied raspberry but mixed with nuances of chocolate-vanilla and amber, while cinnamon and sandalwood add some spice. GOOD SMELLING "mass appealing" fragrance that is still unique, subtle enough to wear in the office or casually during the day, but loud enough to stand out and sweet enough to be worn at night and/or by a woman.

* Very similar to Sander for Men by Jil Sander, it has the same fresh, clean laundry + sweet atmosphere; MB Individuel has raspberry that Sander does not have, and is just a bit sweeter and spicier.

If you like raspberry and vanilla, you will surely enjoy this, especially for a small price. Unfortunately, for me, it is too synthetic and too sweet. After wearing it for a while, I feel like I have consumed way too many sweet alcoholic drinks throughout the day and find myself in a corresponding hangover state. Longevity is okay.

The scent is initially fresh, berry-like/sweet, and feels very light. Over time, this berry sweetness becomes more pronounced and somewhat overshadows the freshness, making it seem a bit heavier in my opinion.
The longevity is somewhat weak; after about 1-2 hours, it becomes very close to the skin and hardly noticeable on me. Although the price makes it a bit more bearable, it doesn't quite match my taste, but I can understand why it appeals to many.

After reading the overwhelmingly positive reviews here in this great forum, I couldn't resist making another blind purchase.

The first spray on my wrist made me suspicious, and my first thought was "this smells just like those toilet blocks from back in the day!"
I had to let that sink in for a moment, but I wasn't ready to throw in the towel just yet.

Yesterday morning, just before work, I went all out and applied a generous amount (chest, neck, hair, behind the ear, etc.), fully aware that this could be my last day at work due to a massive scent disturbance. Although both men and women are quite used to my choices. ;-)

And lo and behold, in this quantity, the actual scent revealed itself to me. A delicate mix of various berry types with a hint of vanilla, and I even think I can detect a very slight note of chocolate. Very (re)freshing and in no way overpowering.
None of my direct colleagues, who have to endure me, and there are quite a few since I sit in an open-plan office, said a word about this scent, and I've had my share of comments before. :-)

I myself could perceive this wonderful fragrance all day long in a very pleasant dosage, but the sillage on my skin seems rather weak and is in no way comparable to other "powerhouses" like A Men, Le Male, or Fahrenheit. For this reason, it will surely not be an evening or going-out scent for me, but it is definitely suitable for every day, every season, and regardless of whether it's work, sports, or play.

Anyone who enjoys this fragrance direction (Gourmand?) can buy it without hesitation and shouldn't be deterred by the initial scent test.

I give it a clear recommendation, even though I wished/expected a stronger sillage.

It was a failed blind purchase. The first time it smells disappointing, the second time a little better. Solo, it smells strongly of laundry detergent to me. It layers well, for example, with Mesmerize Black - this makes the scent a bit sweeter and gives it a peach-like note. I definitely advise against a blind purchase.

Sweet but still very fresh.
I think these words fit very well when it comes to describing Mont Blanc.
I have had the fragrance for a short time and have already had several opportunities to test it. It progresses quite linearly and shows not many changes from the opening to the dry down. It is fresh and has a certain berry sweetness that I simply find great.
It is very suitable for everyday use, regardless of the season. I have received some compliments. It lasts about 6 hours on my skin and even until the next day on clothing.
I find it perfect for when you come straight out of the shower and just want to chill with a friend.
However, a major drawback: I personally find the bottle simply ugly and very, very awkward.

review_title: Take 08/15 shower gel and throw in a pot of raspberries
review_content:
The scent starts with a typical 08/15 men's shower gel note, which quickly changes as a very dominant raspberry note joins in. This is really intense and feels quite synthetic.

At this moment, the scent strongly reminds me of Joop! Homme EAU DE TOILETTE as it has a similar sweetness.

There isn't a significant change in the course of the fragrance.
The longevity and sillage are fine, but you need to reapply throughout the day.

For me, the scent is ideal on rainy days.

I was blinded by the good reviews. It smells extremely pungent only of soap and that for hours. Unfortunately, I only read later that it was reformulated and watered down.. According to the batch code from April 19. I will dispose of this cheap soapy mess.

review_title: Burning Top Note, great remaining scent development, poor longevity :-(
review_content:
Now I have an original manufacturer sample of Individuel EAU DE TOILETTE in front of me and I am a bit disappointed but also intrigued. Strange feeling, right? Yes, the scent development was a bit odd and possibly due to the age of this sample. However, I did not expect the longevity to be so poor at 4 to a maximum of 5 hours. The sillage is only marginally better.

The top note is burning, quite synthetic, and initially sour-fruity with a lot of bergamot. Then, green and herbal aromas of mint, rosemary, and coriander creep in. The heart note, however, smells very nice, floral, and sweet with lavender, geranium, iris, and violet. Then a lovely cinnamon aroma emerges. I really like the base. The raspberries surprise me, and I also detect vanillic, creamy, sweet, woody, and balsamic hints of tonka beans, amber, and sandalwood.

Since the longevity and the top note were so poor, I will have to retest the fragrance at some point and then revise this review. But the rest really offered a lot and was quite nice for me.

I have been a Parfumo user for several years, but I am only now writing my first contribution. To match this, I chose one of my first fragrances - Montblanc Individuel.

Back then, promoted by the "old" Jeremy, I ordered it and was indeed not disappointed.

Today, after a long time, I opened the bottle again, sprayed once in the air and bam… throwback to Mexico.

It’s Friday evening, in a small town on the Mexican Pacific coast. The mood is excellent and the weather perfect. Full of anticipation for the upcoming evening and date, I get ready and finish everything off with a generous amount of Individuel (yes, the performance is unfortunately weak, so please a bit more!).

On my way down to the hostel bar, I run into my group. A colorful mix of Europeans, Americans, and a few Latinos. It took no more than a minute and I was already collecting the first compliments. The scent develops in the tropical warm summer night, with a fresh sea breeze, into a real magnet. I enjoy the fragrance with every gust of wind, and so does my date. ;) For the setting, the scent is perfect. Relaxed and not too intrusive. Exotic and laidback. Just like the Mexican coastal town.

It may be that I am particularly enthusiastic about the scent because of the memory. In any case, it is worth a try!

In my opinion, Montblanc smells fresh, but also slightly sweet. Not aquatic/spicy like Sauvage or Coolwater. Much more like freshly washed clothes, fruity and simply absolutely pleasant. Definitely unisex and appealing to everyone, but I would still consider it very special, as it stands out from the big mainstream fragrances.

At first, it is clearly noticeable in the air. Unfortunately, that fades after 1-2 hours. After that, it may still be perceptible on the skin for another 5 hours.

From me, a clear recommendation and perfect as an office scent or on a summer evening near the sea.

Hasta luego.

The fragrance pyramid sounded really exciting, the reviews all read wonderfully, and I so wished it could be a scent for me. Something fresh that I could wear well at work, so I had a sample sent to me.
So after a shift, I took another shower and applied it, and wrinkled my nose. Brrr, I thought, this is dreadful! Give it some time, the top note is already slightly not your favorite. It does get better, but we simply can't become friends.
Unfortunately, I don't like it at all, as I find it extremely artificial and it reminds me a bit of bathroom cleaner.
A week later, I tested it again to be absolutely sure, and my reaction was unfortunately the same.
Now a colleague at work is getting the sample as a gift, and in this way, the fragrance might find a new admirer, and I get the chance to smell it on someone else.
P.S.: My fresh scent for work has become Superdry Steel, by the way.

Montblanc Individuel strikes me as strongly reminiscent of classic aftershave in the opening - fresh, clean, but also somewhat old-fashioned. The often-mentioned raspberry note is something I personally do not perceive at all. Overall, it is a fragrance that one can certainly wear, but does not necessarily have to. It remains subtle, unexciting, and rather unremarkable, without any significant edges or angles. For me, it's not a must-have, but also not a misstep. The longevity is solid at about 5-6 hours. The bottle has a nice design. The price is affordable, but not a blind buy.

Hard to describe: first sweet, synthetic, then fruitier - especially raspberry.
Then a light, airy freshie, while the sweet note remains.
This transitions into a bitter-spicy base without completely losing the sweetness.
However, the projection and longevity are not impressive.

It must have been around 2011 and one of my first fragrances. Back then, I stood in front of the Douglas shelf full of Creed bottles and had fallen for Creed Santal. When I saw the price (today we would fight over it), I quickly averted my gaze...
Then I heard about Mont Blanc Individuel as a substitute and found it to be a great alternative without having to leave the store with a tear in my eye.

At this point, I would like to mention that production has NOT been discontinued. Sometimes it’s harder to find, and sometimes you can get the fragrance for a throwaway price. I had a similar experience with Missoni Wave.

However, Individuel has already undergone several reformulations, and my recently purchased bottle brings back some memories, but with a distorted image.

I remember it being much fruitier (raspberry) and a bit longer-lasting.

As several previous reviewers have aptly described, it is now noticeably "cleaner." Not bad at all, but it used to be better. Otherwise, you can't really go wrong with this fragrance - it fits almost any occasion, any season, and you won't offend anyone with it. At least you still smell like Individuel, as it flies under the radar among the masses.
