Some time ago, I received a bottle of Individuel as a gift. Oh nice! I had always wanted to test it. The story of that day is quickly told. The lady of the house often hung around my neck, sniffing and repeatedly getting carried away to make enthusiastic comments. Well, it could be worse.

However, this enthusiasm has not quite transferred to the wearer. The fragrance undoubtedly has a certain elegance - it is not a troublemaker, it doesn’t scratch, it doesn’t cling, it is not synthetic - but in its development, it is overall too one-sidedly sweet for me, without a balancing counterpart being provided. From the listed top notes, I can only smell homeopathic doses of vanilla; the scent clings to the base after a very short time, with the cinnamon-raspberry mixture showing extraordinary endurance. Somewhere, a few violets also sprout. Unfortunately, spicy aromas do not come through to my nose.

In contrast to some others, I don’t like to spray it on in warm weather, especially not at the office, because then it starts to annoy me due to the already mentioned cinnamon raspberry. This can lead to slight headaches. In such situations, the good longevity (up to 10 hours) turns negative. However, since my surroundings, both at home and at work, perceive the scent very positively, I wear it from time to time. If we do get a hint of summer now, it will first move to a back corner and will only be brought out again in autumn.

Montblanc Individuel has pleasantly surprised me. The scent starts off really fresh and fruity, with the raspberry note standing out nicely for me, not too sweet, but beautifully balanced. It's not a fragrance that completely breaks the mold, but fundamentally solid.

I like to reach for it when I need something quick and don't want to indulge in an expensive perfume. For around €30, I think you can't go wrong here. Solid quality, decent scent.

Is it a wow fragrance? No. But in my opinion, it doesn't have to be. For me, it's the better and cheaper alternative to Joop! Homme.

Perfect for everyday wear when you want to smell good subtly without overthinking it.

Fluffy, creamy, cuddly vanilla and musk with a lovely sweet clementine on top. The combination of warming vanilla and lively citrus often puts me in a good mood, and this is no exception. It gives me mandarin cheesecake vibes, but with enough musk and subtle florals to make it easy to wear. None of the flowers in the heart really stand out, they just keep the scent from becoming too literal of a gourmand. A touch of benzoin in the base adds extra warmth.

The musk in this is not the typical white musk that many drugstore scents have, it's a bit sharper and more modern.

I understand the comparison to Initio Musk Therapy, but the intense vanilla in Montblanc Signature makes it easy to tell them apart.
Other aspects of the scent are similar to Lattafa Yara, which I absolutely love. The color of the bottles of these two is very telling, Yara smells like the pink version of the white-yellow-gold Montblanc Signature.

This would work on most occasions and temperatures, so it would make a good signature. It's not the most complex, sophisticated scent, but it's not a super girly and playful sugar bomb either. Just a happy, creamy-clean, delicately sweet, femine perfume. The character of the scent is soft, but it's not weak, I actually find it quite dense texturally.

It's totally worth the upcharge compared to Zara Frosted Cream, which isn't as smooth and has an artificial note that this doesn't have.

Best way I know how to describe this is a "clean marshmallow":

- A little bit soapy-musky (like a white musk - very inoffensive, but also with the indistinct floral blend of a white soap)
- A pillowy, soft, vanilla marshmallow cloud as the base

It's calming, classy, soft, slightly sweet, and clean. As the scent evolves, more of the clementine and ylang-ylang show up - a bit of sharpness cutting through the fluffy-ness.

The dry down feels a little confusing, as the clementine and ylang-ylang seem to compete with the overall softness of the other notes - so it wasn't for me personally. But I know this is a love for many, so it's still worth sampling.

The first day that I wore this, I had worked a 6 hour shift and afterward, joined 3 of my friends at Starbucks for coffee. We were there for a couple of hours and at the end when I hugged everyone goodbye, my one friend said, "Ohhhhhh, you smell GOOD!!!" My other friend then said, "So that's the smell I kept smelling!" She then asked me to text her the name of the perfume, along with a picture of the bottle and box.
After 8 hours, I could easily still smell it on myself and others could smell it on me as well, which is a testament to its strength, lasting power and projection.
First and foremost, this is a musky perfume but it's not a pungent smelling musk. It's refined, classy, alluring, sweet and creamy. Beyond the musk, I get something floral. It almost has a rosey vibe to it, so I'm assuming it's the peony. I believe the vanilla note is what's giving it that sweet touch but it's not at all gourmand. The ylang ylang chimes in to give it some depth. I don't smell the other notes. Everything mixes nicely for an overall pleasing and almost addictive effect.
This really is a beautiful fragrance, especially for the price. You can easily find this online at a reasonable price point.
The bottle itself is stunning, the white and cold combo is so pretty and expensive looking.
The fragrance reminds me of a Narciso Rodriguez creation at a fraction of the cost.
A very successful blind-buy for me indeed!

review_title: the phantom limb of someone else's life
review_content:
Montblanc Signature is a weird one in that it's not really weird at all (it's pretty basic in composition and execution, right?), but it makes me feel some weird, twisty things. If that makes sense. It's a sort of echo-y, empty, fresh, woody,- dewy-floral melange that smells like you're using someone else's shampoo, a pearlescent lather of white musk more expensive than you care to consider. You're sleeping under a stranger's crisp white sheets, cool against your skin, the lingering dryer sheet scent of magnolia petals and fat peony blooms, their honeyed sweetness clinging to the fabric.

Maybe a friend of a friend has an apartment for rent while they're off being an influencer in France, so you're availing yourself of their expensively furnished, minimalist-chic accommodations for a few months in a particularly hip part of town. You spend a lot of time lonely in the apartment, trying on her silk blouses and cashmere sweaters, picking through her curated book selection of vintage Vogue and art photography books, and trying to get a sense of who she is. You're also stalking her social media a fair bit, and like a magpie hoarding glittering scraps, you gather up her turns of phrase and mannerisms, embellishing your own reflection with borrowed plumage. You begin ordering Door Dash deliveries under her name, all the culinary delicacies she'd artfully Instagrammed in her travels, noodles slick with sauce, and hundreds of tiny, bitter cups of coffee. You imagine her beside you, laughter echoing in the sterile silence, a phantom limb you ache to touch.

The line between mimicry and metamorphosis blurs. The creamy magnolia unfurls, a faded photograph of intimacies never shared. The luminous musk, clean and faintly powdery, becomes a shroud, a borrowed identity that both suffocates and intoxicates. This fragrance doesn't just smell like wearing someone else's perfume; it smells like the unsettling alchemy of becoming someone else. And in that borrowed skin, in that stolen life, the question lingers: just how far will you go to become more than just her shadow?

review_title: Surprising quality for an affordable price - signature scent worthy
review_content: Mmmm! This is delightful. Reminds me of VS Tease Cream Cloud, but much more nuanced and with better performance. I love the heavy bottle and the simple yet addictive vanilla and mandarin combo. Truly an easy reach and a very good candidate for a signature scent, if only I could settle for just one!

review_title: Its an all year, all hours of the day kind of scent
review_content: Such a beautiful bottle. I do really get a sweet clementine, creamy vanilla and clean musk with a tiny bit floral background. This perfume has all the right elements of being just right, not to much of anything, and so well blended. Its an all year, all hours of the day kind of scent. I had a 50 ml that I ran out of sooo fast, got a 90 ml that I later on sold but now I'm...

Sprayed some on the back of my hand this afternoon, just out of curiousity.
I would have sworn there'd be Tiare flower in this, but apparently this is not the case. It reminded me of Guerlain's Terracotta a little, only with a more plasticy (doll-head) vibe and even a little of my Intense Tiare, but way less strong, less fresh and ozonic and less vibrant; more creamy. I wonder which note made me think of Tiare flower. Could this be the Magnolia?
Anyway, I find it just 'okay' not groundbraking. I think it is because I'm very sensitive to vanilla, don't like that note when it is too obviously there.

review_title: If only they'd cut down on the synthetic musk a bit...
review_content:
It's a great scent. It's based on orange, with vanilla, magnolia, peony, and ylang-ylang. It's the kind of scent that any perfume lover would imagine, and it doesn't disappoint. I think it's okay to buy it blind. However, as I get closer to the end, I get a little squeaky feeling like a synthetic fragrance...it's a little bit stinging in my nose. And it gives me a headache. If it wasn't for that, it would really be a signature fragrance. I think it would be a much more amazing scent if the precision of this scent was improved. It's a minor issue for people with less sensitive noses. I can't buy a full bottle because it bothers me.
But the bottle is very cute. A white ice-like ink bottle. It's a good taste.

I’m very much into the sweet and clean part of this perfume. I love the creamy vanilla, the marshmallow and magnolia scented soap make me think of sunny rooms where a fresh breeze blows through the curtains.
But on some moments something awful happens and the magnolia bumps into the musky benzoin notes. The soapy undertone smells like old lady SO bad I wish I could scrub it off wherever I am at that moment.
I’m terribly fussy but these moments always make me hesitant to grab my bottle of Signature, even though I really enjoy the most of it.

Withe bottle full of sweet innocence. I bought this fragrance after reading a reviews that compare it to the scent of Nivea cream . After a full day wearing I must disagree. It starts as very fresh, slightly sweet white musk with good projection . With the time floral notes are disappearing giving a way to more sweet vanilla and some creamy notes At that point it smells like vanilla/ coconut creamy dessert with white musk Longevity is very good and projection is fine, leaving nice trail behind you throughout whole day. On the first day of wearing i had a woman following me only to ask the name of my perfumes. Its perfect everyday scent for spring and summer. Highly recommended.

This smells so good. On my clothes it smells like a very fluffy and smooth orange musky cloud. I’ve heard reviewers call it an orange milk bath and that’s pretty accurate. It’s very comforting and clean. However, I only get that beautiful scent on my clothes. I cannot stand this scent on my skin. It’s like it breaks a part on my skin and becomes unbearably synthetic...

Love at first sniff! It’s everything described, but no one thing super strong. So it’s kiiinda creamy, it’s vaaaguely fruity. White is the perfect color to describe this fragrance. It’s delicate, sweet, comforting. It makes me want to roll around in a puffy white comforter in bed after showering on a Sunday morning.

For some certificate, I received a Montblanc fountain pen from my parents - in green and black with a real gold nib.

This gem had already accompanied my father through his school years, and I was instructed to take good care of this treasure.

And I must say, the gold nib glided effortlessly over the writing paper - like a sailboat over smooth water.
It did wonders for my handwriting, and it also increased my desire to write.
I think, anyway - there should be more handwritten notes again.

But one day, my precious writing instrument was gone - and to this day, I don't want to accuse any of my classmates of theft.

In any case, I was sad about the loss - and I have not found this design in stores to this day.

But I found the scent to match the valuable fountain pen - which also greets me with skillful curves.
If the pen was made for writing poems and love letters - then Signature is perfect for a rendezvous.
The counterpart doesn't necessarily have to be a man - a private conversation with a girlfriend works just as well.
Wherever a dignified setting is given, the bright, softly vanillic scent feels at home.
The flowers remain transparent through the aquatic mandarin - and musk refines this noble fragrance even further.

Its elegance is round and has momentum - refined with poetry - just like the word "Back then" is written.

...am I the first to write about this scent?! Admittedly...it seems to be quite new...I received a fragrance sample during my last purchase and initially left it aside. I first thought it was a men's perfume because the scent card came across as...well, um "masculine?" Today I realized that it is intended for the ladies.

The scent card says Floral-Oriental-Musky...so absolutely my type...sprayed it on and...yesssssssssss...how amazing is THIS?! According to the fragrance pyramid, there should be Clementine in it...nope...I don't smell it...I don't know why, but the top notes of perfumes vanish on my skin like various ships in the Bermuda Triangle. What I smell is something floral, light...maybe the Magnolia?! Ylang Ylang takes the lead, the Rose remains subtle but present in the background...the Vanilla makes it creamy, the Musk gives it longevity. Overall, a beautiful, well-balanced scent.

It fits spring, but definitely also for summer...in my mind's eye, I see a woman walking along the beach in the evening...her skin still heated and warm from the hot day, exuding this sensual fragrance...it has something flirty...light...she gets invited for a drink by a James Bond look-alike and yes...it will probably lead to a one-night stand...why not?! This scent promises enticing summer evenings and nights...

The fragrance can definitely still be worn well in autumn, as long as it hasn't gotten too cold yet. Longevity is 4-5 hours, decent sillage but could definitely be more, because it really is a great scent...it's definitely on my wish list...

review_title: Delicate, floral, powdery, creamy, clean, and soapy
review_content:
Recently, I discovered this fragrance in the perfume shop and was immediately taken with it (which is rare for me, almost never happens). This scent is so wonderfully delicate! I usually don't like most floral fragrances, but this one is different. The floral notes are very subtle and not overpowering. For me, it is a “fresh scent,” creamy, powdery, and slightly soapy in feel. So pure... Along with this purity comes the delicate peony. Still, it doesn't fall into the “smells like fresh laundry” category, because that’s not my thing, at least not on the body. I don't perceive the clementine at all. A sweet, fine, and very feminine fragrance with good longevity. Suitable for everyday wear, in the office, for going out, and in my opinion, ideal in spring or on not too warm summer days (which we have right now ;0). The bottle is also very beautiful. For the gentlemen: your lady will surely appreciate this fragrance! :)
Edit: I have now used it almost daily for a while, so I’m raising my rating to a solid 10! Super beautiful scent, I’ve worn it quite often in the fall, even though I initially associated it more with spring.

I became aware of Signature about 6 months ago, but I can't quite remember where.

So, I was on my way to the perfume store and somehow already knew that I would like it. Me and creamy scents? Bring it on! The fragrance pyramid sounded exciting, Ylang-Ylang paired with vanilla? I'm definitely in! And then white musk added? A dream.

The scent caught me right from the first spray. At first, I get a very light citrusy clementine, but that fades away quickly. What remains for me is a light tropical climate. No worries, there's no sweat involved here. Every time I smell it, I think of my beloved Ylang in Gold by Micallef, which I always say is somehow tropical and summery (am I the only one who sees parallels?). This is due to the sweet Ylang-vanilla combo, which makes the scent feel very dense. You have to like that, no question.

Still, the scent is never too much for me, not even for the warmer seasons. It stays in this clean/powdery/creamy genre. More creamy than dry and powdery. I also think that the bottle reflects the scent quite well with its white color. In my eyes, the scent is super feminine!

I often wear it to work, and every time I get close to my jacket (I often spray it on the collar), a warm sweet aura surrounds me, giving a really cozy feeling. The sillage is definitely there, but it's not a beast mode scent (the Ylang in Gold is definitely not that for me either). Longevity is okay.

The price/performance ratio is fantastic. That's why for me, it's an absolutely underrated designer fragrance that I don't want to miss. A 30 ml bottle is not enough for me here.

Anyone who likes scents in the direction of Zadig & Voltaire - This is her, Micallef - Ylang in Gold, and TF - Soleil Blanc should definitely check out Montblanc! I prefer it to Soleil Blanc, especially because you can get it for a fraction of the price. And if not, then I'm still glad that I don't smell it on every corner :D

Addendum: I layered it with Hypnotic Poison EAU DE TOILETTE and bam: Compliments in the city from strangers. "It smells like something I know, delicious, but still different." Under the shirt Dior and on top Signature. I think the mandarin in Signature Dior adds a new dimension. Something lighter. Both fragrances are based on vanilla, which is why I think these two...

...I actually wanted to buy nothing and just browse online.

This Corona....
They say Germans are saving more and therefore have more money set aside. This unusual surplus in some people's accounts can also be attributed to the current Corona measures. People are spending less....

Yeah, right! All those who are currently saving a nice surplus are either very careful with their money or not fans of online shopping, which I unfortunately am.

Thus, this white, bulky-looking bottle has now moved in with me, of course in 100ml, because it was "cheap" and as a German savings model, I wouldn't have saved anything otherwise if I hadn't seized the good price.

Now I have once again become the mother of a new scent for me. It was a spontaneous blind buy, no risk no fun.
I was all the more eagerly excited about my surprise fragrance.

At the beginning, a fruity clementine immediately unfolds for me, and the magnolia also flashes with slightly citrusy peaks. But the vanilla is right there for me and stays. The scent becomes creamier with a pleasant sweetness; I also perceive the slightly citrusy notes every now and then, but only very subtly.
Overall, it feels warm, creamy, sweet, and vanillic to me, and yes, a bit of bright floral comes through as well.
It fits well on nice, sunny but not too hot days, like right now in spring.
I find the sillage very pleasant for this type of scent; it envelops you without being overwhelming to others, and the longevity is good; it stays with me all day.
Phew.... I was lucky. I find it beautiful, and fortunately, my partner does too.

Until the next bargain buy

With my hand on my chest, I tried to calm my racing heartbeat. Phew, why was I suddenly so hot? He had smiled at me. And he had flirted too. I closed the door and made sure it was securely locked. “He loves me,” I squealed in the highest pitch into the voice message for my friend. “I knew it,” I concluded my hysterical outburst with a spin on my office chair.
“Just because Erik returned the pen and said thank you, you think he loves you? But that’s normal among colleagues. Don’t exaggerate, he just has good manners,” she replied. As much as I appreciated her opinion, I didn’t want to hear that. “You should agree with me,” I grumbled to myself and threw my phone roughly onto the paper-laden desk. She had a talent for pouring a bucket of ice water over me verbally.
And even if she might have been a tiny bit right, I still didn’t want to leave anything to chance. Men are not just visual types; they also respond to sensual scents. In the perfume store, I looked for a creamy fragrance with a coconut note. Isn’t it attractive when you’re reminded of a cozy vacation and the dream woman is sitting right in front of you? Sometimes you have to give clueless men a little nudge. Signature smelled wonderfully creamy, soft, and cozy. The saleswoman assured me it would have a hint of coconut in the background. The bottle resembled an iceberg. Completely convinced after testing on the scent strip and my sleeve, I sprayed lavishly into the air as the lady looked away and walked ecstatically through the cloud of fragrance to the checkout.
I received comments about my new scent from all the mechanics in the workshop, but not from him. That only heightened my hunting instinct. So instead of 15 sprays, I now applied 30 pumps to my ample décolletage, just like in the perfume store, and walked extra slowly with a sexy hip sway from the office to the lift, where he was busy installing new brake calipers on a blue BMW.
“Lilly, watch out, don’t end up in the pit with your shoes,” he called out, gesturing with his muscular arm to keep a distance.
Awwww, he’s looking out for me, I thought, melting inside. He seemed to like my platform shoes too, as he stared a little longer than usual at the heels with wide eyes. “Do you like them?” I asked, trying to move along the car body like a cat. Unfortunately, my blouse got caught on the side mirror. I lost my balance, crashed against the driver’s door, and flopped quite inelegantly onto the ground. Of course, right in the middle of an oil stain. To make matters worse, the alarm system started blaring terribly. I couldn’t understand his words as he bent over me in shock. He was surely explaining how he had been terrified for me and that everything would be alright again. I was like wax in his hands, which were fumbling to help me sit up again. For a moment, I considered pretending to faint so he would carry me away, but I was already disillusioned when he pulled an Allen key from beneath me. “Not that it gets lost,” I heard him say as a colleague at that moment turned off the deafening alarm. For my taste, he was handling the metal thing a bit too lovingly. But how could one be jealous of an Allen key… The truck driver Günther came around the corner and lifted me under the arms to help me back on my feet. When he noticed the dark oil stain on my mini skirt and the torn blouse, he threw me a huge coverall out of pity. Bad-tempered that the handsome Erik seemed to be harder to impress than I thought, the unpleasant workshop smell of the coverall hit my nose. Signature came to the rescue. This time, 50 sprays. Aileen, our apprentice, strolled in, drawn by the “immense cloud of fragrance,” as she said. She grabbed the white, asymmetrical bottle and examined it for a while before spritzing it on her neck. It took no more than 10 minutes, and I heard giggling from the workshop. Of course, I immediately shuffled with the monstrous piece of clothing to the customer glass window. I thought I was going to have a stroke. There stood Erik with his outstretched sooty hands, leaning forward and sniffing Aileen’s neck, which she coyly presented to him. Erik rolled his eyes with a grin, and it was easy to see that he really liked what he had under his nose. Since when could Aileen be so shy? I had never known that trait before. I burst through the iron door and called out in a voice that was way too high, asking Erik not to put our apprentice in danger. The oil stain was still there, after all. Before I knew it, I grabbed the girl by the scruff and pulled her into the office. There, she first received a lecture from me about the dangers in the workplace. I made sure she was busy for the next 7 hours reading all the safety instructions of the company and writing a summary. I would then present this at the next team meeting with an impressive display of my bruises, which by then would surely have turned a nice blue-violet.
No matter how hard I tried to establish safety and a good collegial atmosphere, especially between Erik and me, the situation slipped further out of my control.
It broke my heart when I heard that Aileen and Erik became a couple. He fell in love precisely at the moment he sniffed her scent on her neck. Since then, it has been her signature, and he only called her creamy pearl. “Pepepeee Fruchtkwaaaahk,” I couldn’t help but mock him internally with a jutting chin. At some point, she casually mentioned that he had said I always smelled like sour tangerine and that he had been very busy avoiding the tangerine box. It was just too much of a good thing.
It was so unfair. I had discovered Signature and Erik first. They both actually belonged to me. If they were a piece of cake, I would have licked them and loudly proclaimed that everyone would be disgusted and they would surely stay with me. But that’s just not how life works. On clothing and in the perfume store, the scent worked wonderfully creamy, slightly sweet, and indeed with a hint of coconut in the background with a bit of imagination. The fluffy creamy musk cloud is lightened by a touch of zesty tangerine. The subtle fruitiness fits well and reminds me a bit of a delicious dessert or a skincare product. The flowers included in the pyramid are so well blended that I don’t really perceive them. But in the overall composition, they seem harmonious. On my skin, however, Signature instantly transforms into a tangerine overload that becomes so sour that it repels rather than attracts. Neither creamy, floral, nor coconut components come into play. Even the sweet vanilla completely drowns in the sticky acidity of the citrus fruits.
Since then, I have understood a lot. In the presentation on workplace safety, I mentioned that with all ambition, letting go is also part of it. Not everything fits together. Blouse and oil, for example, do not. The other examples like Signature and me, or Erik and, well, whatever - I kept more to myself. After all the bruises had healed, I wanted to give my Signature bottle to Aileen as a sign of my blessing. Unfortunately, I found out that it was already empty. No wonder with 30 ml, I thought, and aimed in a high arc for the trash can. Bam, sunk. At least I can hit, I patted myself on the shoulder and hoped fervently that Cupid would also drop my Signature right into my lap. The rest would then come by itself.

I tested the scent when it was newly released. Although I thought it might fit my preferences perfectly, unfortunately, I didn't like it that much. It was a bit too sweet for me, and somehow it smelled like a standard drugstore fragrance. So, I wrote it off for a while. However, as it often happens with me, even though I didn't like it, it stuck in my mind. It has been on my wish list for a long time. There was something familiar about it that imprinted itself in my nose. When I was browsing here in the souk, I ultimately found a great offer that I couldn't resist. I'm really happy about that, as I suddenly like the scent so much that I will definitely get the large bottle. I no longer perceive that standard drugstore scent note, thankfully. The scent doesn't have much of a progression on my skin; it smells the same from the top note to the base note. I mostly perceive clementine and vanilla, hence the association with an orange cream. Does anyone know the Balea hand soap Raspberry & Magnolia? For me, it's the same scent.

I first sprayed it on a paper strip for testing, 2x. The entire room smelled incredibly good afterward. Unfortunately, it doesn't last long on the skin, but it lasts very, very long on fabrics. In my opinion, it's a year-round scent, not too extreme even in summer.

Despite the initial difficulties, this is a scent I no longer want to miss in my collection!

Before I became part of this wonderfully fragrant community, I spent quite some time in various perfumeries. Whenever it was time to shop, it was clear (at least to me) that a visit to some perfumery was a must. I always thought I knew almost all designer fragrances. Until I came to Parfumo :). Again and again, I read in various threads about Signature EAU DE PARFUM. Whether as a compliment, a recommendation, or even as the scent of the day. Well, the reviews spoke for themselves, and I ordered a sample. After "Angélique Noire | Guerlain," Signature EAU DE PARFUM also convinced me after the first spray. I can't actually say that about every fragrance - especially since these two still remain among my favorites!
Montblanc has truly managed to create a fragrance that perfectly balances the fine line between sweet and creamy, zesty and calming, fruit and flower. Like some others, I perceive the clementine (could also have been a mandarin ;-)) from start to finish. This light citrus with a minimal bitter hint is, in my eyes, the icing on the cake. In late autumn and winter, it feels most comfortable, thanks to the vanilla that conveys a sense of warmth. This fragrance is the epitome of sweet-creamy; it couldn't have been described more accurately.
What does all this have to do with my title? Well, it’s also the case that Signature EAU DE PARFUM lasts for hours with just one spray and becomes more and more beautiful with each passing minute. Warm, sensual, yet still present. It is noticed without having to overwhelm with it! An incredible sillage!
And at this point, I must say that quite a few niche houses could take a slice from this. Here, affordable goods are delivered. I am truly impressed by this fragrance, by this price, and by the presence it offers! TOP!

review_title: A Little Basket of Flowers and Sweet Clementines!
review_content: Well, the pen king Montblanc has really outdone himself this time. For a company whose core competence lies in the production of exclusive writing instruments, we have here an extraordinarily well-made perfume. This impression is already conveyed visually when looking at the high-quality bottle. It resembles a luxurious ink bottle in white and gold and is made of heavy, cut...

I bought this fragrance blindly from Notino. And let's be honest, how often do we let ourselves be influenced by social media and then think that a scent, just because it sounds so grand in the descriptions of others, must also suit us? Personally, I tend to advise against blind purchases. Because as tempting as a fragrance description may be, in the end, we are all quite particular about our perceptions. What is a fragrance dream for one person might be a fragrance nightmare for another.

Signature by Montblanc has been described by many as a cream cake with a hint of clementine. But that's not entirely accurate. Anyone who conjures a cream cake from musk and vanilla is, in my opinion, a charlatan. The true star here is the clementine, which accompanies all the nuances throughout the development. So it's more of a fruity fragrance. And then there are the floral notes, which certainly do not shy away from lingering in the background.

But what brings about a love-hate relationship for me with this fragrance is this constant cool, almost menthol-like touch. I have no idea if it's due to the ylang-ylang (Soleil Blanc has this synthetic cold as well), but it feels like I’m being laid on ice. Still, it’s a lovely sweet scent that smells a bit like fruity body lotion, but with a little twist.

If the fragrance were a person, it would be a dental assistant. Totally well-groomed, in her pastel-colored work attire, super nice and pretty. When she leans over to put on a bib for you, you catch a whiff of her floral, creamy perfume, along with that typical dentist smell that lingers throughout the practice. That cool, clean scent.

I personally like the perfume, but it is simply not what it claims to be. Whether I find this specific association good or bad, opinions differ for me. It depends on the day. In any case, it is a fragrance for warm days when you could use that cool refreshment.

review_title: A Bed in a Cotton Field
review_content:
A bed in a cotton field and a coconut cream meringue in hand. The scent is fruity, floral, sweet, and yet clean. The bottle couldn't be more fitting for the fragrance.

No one can definitely be bothered by this scent...because you can't even say whether it's the perfume or a nicely scented, freshly washed piece of clothing that you're wearing.

An absolute feel-good fragrance for home or the office...but after 4 hours I already need to reapply. The sillage is subtle.

Also very suitable for young ladies and affordable.

Ah, the scent from Mont Blanc has been my long-time "signature scent"; at a time when I didn't know anything about perfume and was the only one in my circle of acquaintances who had even the slightest interest in fragrances.

I can't even remember how I stumbled upon it back then... maybe it was a lucky coincidence because I found the bottle so beautiful?
Well, who knows, but now to the actual review:

The first impression is always the bottle of the perfume, and here it really matches the scent perfectly! The fragrance starts off softly citrusy, you can immediately smell the clementine. Along with that, there's a slight creaminess, yes, it could be vanilla. The fresher top note can be enjoyed for about 10 minutes, after which the musk and vanilla come into focus and stay there.
The clementine remains ever-present but rather caresses the creamy heart and loses the slight acidity from the first few minutes.

With this scent, I feel like I've just applied lotion and stepped out of the shower; I then put on a white blouse or a sheath dress.
It's definitely impossible to offend anyone; with 2-4 sprays, I'm ready for the next 8 hours. The scent is ideal for work in the office, going out to eat, meeting friends, or even for a cozy evening on the sofa.
If you're unsure in the morning, you can't go wrong with a reach for the "signature." Even with a headache, it gently caresses the nose and has a calming effect with its creamy-clean heart note.

I will definitely always have a bottle on my shelf, even if I now reach for it significantly less often. Because every few weeks, I have a day when I hardly feel like wearing perfume or just can't decide in the morning. And then I know who I can reach for with a clear conscience; I simply know my all-rounder :)

I became aware of this fragrance from Montblanc through a video on the well-known platform. It was described as suitable for a signature scent. Creamy with musk and vanilla notes. Due to the lovely description, I ordered the perfume blind from the perfumery. I was not disappointed. On me, the scent smells very creamy and exceptionally pleasant from the first spray. I smell coconut in its best form, even though coconut is not listed here. Creamy, sunscreen-like coconut oil. Vanilla and musk are clearly noticeable. I don't perceive the floral notes, however. Some report that Signature smells slightly sweaty or artificial on them. That is not the case for me at all. My skin loves this scent. I have to keep sniffing my wrist when I wear it. So beautifully coconutty, slightly sweet, yet elegant and like I've just applied lotion after a shower. The sillage is close to the body. Longevity is about 5 hours, definitely no longer. For me, the name is fitting for this perfume, and therefore I wear it more often and in every season. However, not at work. Signature would distract me too much in the office :)

review_title: Dupe to Musk Therapy or the more expensive version of Impulse Vanilla Deo?
review_content:
I really had high expectations for this scent after hearing in so many YouTube videos that it is a dupe for Musk Therapy by Initio or at least strongly resembles it. For my nose, it does not. There may be minimal similarities regarding individual notes, but that's about it. Musk Therapy is truly a "luxury therapy" for my nose... the Signature by MontBlanc, on the other hand... "Vanilla OVERDOSE"!
I often like vanilla notes in the base, as they tend to make fragrances softer. However, here the vanilla takes over from the very beginning and is the most dominant note from the first second.
I didn't have to think long about the associations this scent evokes in me... my 14-year-old self, in the locker room after gym class, the entire locker room smells like Impulse Vanilla Deo. I apologize to all Signature lovers & I hope you forgive me for this comparison - maybe my nose is just strange in this regard... However, the scent actually smells exactly like this deodorant or perhaps leans more towards a VS body spray. Although at around €30 for 30ml it is a cheapie, even these €30 would actually be way too expensive for this scent and already a good investment for the piggy bank for Musk Therapy.

Feel free to let me know if you share my view, or if you also had initial difficulties with the scent, whether you later gained other notes/a different impression of the fragrance!

In a fragrance full of splendor and shine,
Clementine dances in a crown of sunlight.
Magnolia blooms in a delicate glow,
Peony lets its heart blossom fine.

Ylang-Ylang, so enchanting sweet,
Like a kiss that greets the senses.
White musk, gentle and pure,
Wraps the skin with tender pain.

Vanilla, like a fine dollop of cream,
Seduces the senses, makes them linger.
Benzoin, with its warm sound,
Emits an aura that captures hearts.

Naive creaminess, so lovely and clear,
A sweet fruity start, wonderful.
Vanilla-musk mousse as a topping on top,
A fragrance that enchants, a heavenly flow.

Light synthetic notes, yet hardly felt,
A cream bath for the senses, to seduce.
Nurturing and flattering, at any time of day,
A scent that simply feels beautiful, feminine, and tender.
______________________________

The poetry of this fragrance says it all. Signature EAU DE PARFUM is a lovely, almost tender everyday scent that never seems out of place. With it, you simply can't go wrong.
Wearable at any age, at any time of day, and for any occasion. It is neither flashy nor inconspicuous; you always smell well-groomed, and Signature flatters its wearer immensely.
Sillage and longevity are superb, and price/quality is unbeatable.
The cream fragrance lovers among us have a gem in this one for their collection.

Creamy-sweet? Yum, bring it on!

Here it is now thanks to a generous perfume. Straight onto the wrist! Spritz, spray. Smell.
Yes, it is sweet. Sniff sniff. Deliciously sweet like powdered sugar on warm fluffy heart-shaped waffles.

A quick glance at the fragrance pyramid. It's a lady. She rushes over. "Clementine," calls the pyramid. Hmm. Sniff. Hmm. "Sugar?" I reply cautiously.

"Magnolia, peony, ylang-ylang!" booms the obviously advertising-savvy fragrance pyramid voice, now a bit louder. I shrug apologetically. "Sugar?"

The pyramid loses patience. It fires "Benzoin!" then, in staccato "White musk!" I slowly shake my head and duck. It screams: "VANILLA!!"
"Ah," I say, "yes, that could be mixed in with the sugar."
The fragrance pyramid sulks away.
The sugar stays, though. Quite a while. Just as it is, no transformation in Sweetbeak's house included.
Yes, for so long that "delicious" has turned slightly intrusive.

"Goodbye sample, you may move on," I bid farewell. Then a deliberately cheerful voice thunders behind me, "Whooo" -
The fragrance pyramid is back! It thunders with mouth corners pinned up: "Who likes SUGAR?"

A little inkwell from Montblanc, filled with fine perfume, was something I absolutely wanted and ordered it blindly. I don’t like sweet scents at all, which I completely overlooked. Since I ordered the small bottle, I didn’t receive a little inkwell, but a slim version (I’ve posted the photo below). Only the content could comfort me. However, the first spray was not a comfort, but rather a shock. Powdery sweetness spread across my arm - as I said, I’m not a fan of sweet perfumes and definitely not of powdery ones. I was disappointed and the bottle disappeared into the cupboard for a while. Weeks later, I made another attempt, again this sweet powderiness, but this time I couldn’t help but keep my nose on my arm. Something was different from other sweet scents, and suddenly I liked what was rising to my nose. Today I can describe it like this: Magnolias and peonies hook onto the ylang-ylang and keep it in check, and over time a dry vanilla appears, and I smell something woody, even though nothing of that is mentioned in the pyramid. It’s exactly this combination that makes the scent so completely different and I like it very much. I don’t smell mandarins at all, and I don’t miss them. I am surrounded by a fine veil,
that stays with me for many hours. I would say Montblanc Signature polarizes and definitely has niche potential. I will still get the inkwell - I, who cling to chypres like glue.

I ordered the fragrance blind, after all the recommendations and reviews I had read, I thought to myself, this must be my scent. Ordered it quickly and waited impatiently for it to arrive. Once it arrived, I sprayed it on and thought wow, this is exactly my thing. At first, the clementine greets me, which then slowly transforms into a creamy fruit vanilla ice cream. For me, it's a very beautiful feminine scent that fits perfectly in spring/summer but is also quite wearable in autumn/winter. I wouldn't have thought it, but I actually like it even a little better than "Musk Therapy | Initio," as it is a bit sweeter/fruity. Now I have a new favorite fragrance that lasts about 7-8 hours on me and is noticed by others without being overwhelming. Price/Quality is also top!
For me, a blind buy that was absolutely worth it

It feels like there is no more uncomplicated women's fragrance.

Montblanc Signature starts off light and airy, then comes this clean creamy note that almost resembles a good body lotion, only to become softer over time with musk and vanilla.

The best allrounder for the cold seasons! Whether for work, a date, shopping, or Netflix & Chill.

Only in summer would it be too powerful for me.

A sunny morning with a cup of coffee. You sit by the window, light streaming in as you gaze at the calm sea waves - this is what Signature feels like. Warm and gentle, with notes of vanilla and white flowers, like a tight hug from a good friend at the beach. Perfect for moments when you just want to feel good, at peace with yourself, and your own presence is enough.

I really like the scent, not overly musky, not that soapy powderiness that reminds me of mothballs and triggers a sneezing fit. Subtle clementine, so when you wear the fragrance, it feels like putting on your favorite white T-shirt or sweater. Out of curiosity, I of course bought the definition of C A that same week....oops, quite a similarity but a clear point for Mont Blanc. In my opinion, it's a fragrance you can wear for any occasion or season.

The scent is incredibly creamy with a fruity note. However, I also find it somewhat heavier and stronger. The fragrance definitely stands out and radiates something warm and cozy. Unfortunately, it starts to annoy me after a while. I am still new to the world of perfume and can't quite pinpoint which note bothers me. I would recommend using a lower dosage of the scent.

I ordered the Montblanc some time ago along with another fragrance. I tested both and initially, my attention was drawn to the other fragrance. Montblanc sat in the display case for several months. At some point, I tried the white crystal mountain again. I sprayed it on and let it develop for a bit. Somehow, I actually liked it quite a lot and I noticed it on myself from time to time, thinking that it really has remarkable longevity. After testing it several times, I liked it so much that I became downright addicted to it! When I didn't know which fragrance to choose, I reached for Montblanc and felt good! Additionally, I find it very invigorating and somehow youthful. It has a fruity - creamy and also well-groomed quality to it. The longevity is really great too. I love it when I can smell my applied fragrance for several hours - even days on clothes. The scent is also never too much for me! A truly wonderful fragrance :)

I first caught a whiff of this fragrance from a colleague at work.
I followed her beautifully well-groomed, fragrant cloud and had to know what had enchanted me so.
It gave her such a polished, angelically pure aura, which is also emphasized by the bottle.
She revealed to me what she was wearing, and I made a firm decision to check out this scent for myself. That was during my training, and a few years later, it has become my cleanly maintained fragrance of choice and sits in my locker at work.
Since I work in a hospital, it always gives me a sense of cleanliness and lightness and has become a lovely companion in my daily life, which patients also find very pleasant.
Layered with the matching body lotion, I can still smell it at the end of my shift.
Montblanc Signature calms me and simultaneously gives me a cheerful feeling, making it one of my favorites that has enchanted me for a long time and gives me the feeling of radiating light!️️

Once upon a time at Easter a long, long time ago - probably in 1991. My sister and I received the long-awaited Ultra Hair Barbies from our grandma - Barbies with hair down to their ankles. A small pink comb and a mini tube of hair gel were included in the packaging for styling the dolls. Out of (not entirely unjustified...) concern that we might apply the gel to our own hair, our mother immediately confiscated it. However, my sister found it a few days later in the bathroom cabinet and of course we had to test it - but indeed on the Barbies, where it didn't hold very well. However, it smelled quite nice: sweet, soapy-clean, a little citrusy. And that's pretty much how "Signature" smells - a blind buy on my part, prompted by the good reviews. Just to be safe, I only ordered 30 ml. I usually do that when I'm not sure if I'll like the scent and this size is available.
I can't really detect a scent progression on me, only the clementines disappear relatively quickly. After about three to four hours, the scent is close to the skin, and after another two hours, it has vanished from the skin. It lasts a bit longer on clothing. Unfortunately, musk hardly comes through for me, which might have given "Signature" a bit more edge. So it remains a subtle, light, and clean scent that has given me a nice flashback to the early nineties. It doesn't blow me away, but it's quite pleasant and not intrusive. It will surely work well in the office.

review_title: For those looking for a signature scent....
review_content: Ok, the name says it all: an absolutely worthy signature fragrance (and a cheapie). The creamiest mandarin meets fluffy musk. For me, one of the most beautiful designer fragrances, an absolute crowd-pleaser. Fruity, not too sweet, and so beautifully creamy that you want to bite into it. Creamy mandarin cocktail with musky whipped cream. Suitable for any season, for any...

... buy a bouquet of flowers. So I go to a good flower shop and have a beautiful bouquet made for me that includes both peonies and magnolias. It’s simply a wonderful bouquet that exudes its scents enchantingly. I arrive at my invitation and the lady of the house opens the door for me, and I hand her the bouquet. She smiles at me and says I am the only one who has brought her a bouquet of flowers so far. She smells it and is simply delighted.

When applying this fragrance, the first thing you notice is a slightly citrusy, fresh floral accord that blends with the creamy note of musk and the woody scent of vanilla. A hint of resinous notes comes through as well. The composition is enveloped in a touch of powdered sugar. For me as a man, the floral accents are noticeable and remain, but at least on my skin, it’s not as strongly feminine as one might expect.

The longevity and sillage are good.

Here we have a women’s fragrance that men can also wear (imagine a 2-meter tall guy with a full beard and chest hair, and I’m not talking about just three hairs on the chest; he’s a bear, not just a regular guy) without becoming feminine. I would say the right age to start wearing this is around 21 years. It can be worn all year round. During the day, in a women’s suit or outfit, it works well in the office, at a meal, a meeting, or just while shopping. In the evening, I can also imagine it on a man when both are at a dinner, or in a club, or just at a party.

This is a fresh floral creamy slightly citrusy resinous woody sweet vanilla scent. If you like that, this is just right and at a reasonable price.

review_title: Creamy Clean Scent without Laundry Notes
review_content:
It was recommended to me because I was looking for a "Clean Girl" scent that doesn't have that biting (just my subjective opinion) laundry smell.
So off to the perfume store and onto my arm with it. Immediately the disillusionment, it smelled absolutely old and musty, almost as if it had gone bad. I let my friend sniff it, and we both grimaced in disgust.
What a shame, it seems not to work on my skin. I know this feeling all too well when that happens.
Out of sheer frustration, I spontaneously picked up another fragrance.

Later in the day in the city, I sniffed my arm again... and wow, what was that? Suddenly it was warm, creamy, and a bit sweet. I thought I was imagining things... it was wonderfully fresh. But not too fresh, rather powdery fresh.
Now I regretted not having taken it with me. I would have endured the initial minutes of disgust.
So the fragrance was promptly ordered online.
And when it arrived, there was great joy upon spraying it, it smelled so wonderful right away. No more musty scent. I don't know what changed, but I'm glad I stuck with it.

Signature is more than a fragrance for me - it is a part of my daughter, a delicate veil that accompanies her throughout the day. When I gifted it to her for her birthday, I knew it would become something special for her. And so it has. Since then, Signature has been her faithful companion, the scent she wears every day that makes her the unique person she is.
It is a fragrance that enters the room and immediately tells a story. The refreshing, creamy opening with the subtle citrus note is like the first ray of sunshine in the morning - light and invigorating, yet never too overpowering. But it is the heart note that unfolds the true magic: vanilla, so soft and sweet, that it reminds one of the scent of freshly made vanilla pudding, filling the room with its warmth. It is the perfect blend of innocence and sophistication that gives the fragrance a wonderful lightness, but also a seductive depth.
I love to smell it on her. When she comes home from school, I am enveloped by the gentle veil of Montblanc "Signature," which hangs in the air like a whisper of memory. At school, she tells me, compliments are pouring in. Her classmates call it "dream vanilla," which aptly reflects the character of this fragrance: a dream of vanilla that gently but persistently floats in the air. The scent is never too loud, never too sweet - it remains subtle and elegant while still making an unobtrusive statement.
It is fascinating how this fragrance connects with my daughter. It has become a part of her, like her favorite jeans or her unforgettable smile. And it is no wonder that she already has her third bottle of it - Montblanc "Signature" has become a staple in her daily life. It is not just the fragrance that beautifies her day, but also one that accompanies and underscores her self-confidence.
"Signature" is a fragrance that carries her into the future like a precious, handwritten diary. Each spray is like a gentle flutter of wings, reminding her that she is unique. The scent is delicate, but not inconspicuous; it is sweet, but never kitschy. It is the perfect blend of youthful freshness and elegance that she already radiates. This fragrance has evolved from a gift into a familiar, intimate companion that exudes warmth and lightness.
It is a fragrance that makes her world a little more beautiful - and I can only hope that it accompanies her for many years to come.

First, I want to address the "DUPE" (Definition by Christina Aguilera).
They both smell really similar BUT it’s the "consistency" and scent development that, in my opinion, is different but relevant. The Definition lacks this creaminess that I love so much in Signature...
This beautiful creamy vanilla musk that blends with the skin is completely missing in Definition, so even though it’s cheap, it’s not an alternative for me personally.

The opening is clearly mandarin,
After a short time, finally this soft vanilla musk mix appears, which blends so wonderfully with the skin.

Longevity + sillage are also good.

I had sold it at first. But I kept thinking about it, somehow I missed it, and so I had to get it back.
I will definitely get a larger bottle as soon as my 30ml is empty.

review_title: Do I want to smell like ice cream? YAAA
review_content:
If the Cuja Mara Split Ice were a perfume, it would be Signature by Montblanc... Super delicious, unobtrusive, fruity and fizzy while also being creamy. This scent always makes me think of summer, watching the sunset with ice cream in hand.
Longevity is about 5 to 6 hours for me, but what I enjoy the most is that the lightly fizzy clementine always remains present. Sillage and projection are rather minimal, more intimate.

I don't know why this fragrance is talked about so rarely.
Such a pleasant sweet, creamy scent that slightly reminds me of sunscreen.

It reminds me of ylang in gold or Nivea sun, both of which are among my absolute all-time favorites.

Price / performance is also more than acceptable in my opinion.

Montblanc Signature has personality and character, but above all, it is extremely elegant and refined. It does not try to grab your attention, but it has a gentle power.

The white color suits it - ideal for the office, work, every day, at the theater, on a date. Suitable for the strictest dress code. Despite its delicacy, it lasts 3-4 hours. It has no long sillage.

The scent is very pleasant, light, cozy, soft, and calm. It reveals more interesting aspects on the skin. It is powdery, floral, very soothing, intimate, and pure.

From the very beginning, there is a strong citrus note. And in the base, vanilla provides sweetness and warmth. White musk is pure, soft, and slightly powdery. Maximally filled with light and air. The overall result is a wonderfully soft perfume that can become a signature scent.

The bottle feels nice in the hand and looks good. It is a smooth, heavy piece of glass, shaped like a Montblanc ink bottle. The inside is white lacquered, and the transparent glass on the outside captivates with the play of light at its edges.
On the light gray box with Saffiano pattern, the name of the fragrance is handwritten in golden letters, as a reminder of the power of words and that handwriting is unique, just like people.

The perfume is ideal as a gift.
Furthermore, it has unfortunately already been discontinued.

I ordered Montblanc Signature blind because the fragrance pyramid really appealed to me. I like it a lot, but I have to say it reminds me very much of Christina Aguilera's 'Definition'
Even though the two don't have any parallel fragrance notes. Interestingly, Definition has always been my 'signature scent', so it somehow fits again
Slightly fresh, slightly creamy, and yet very distinctive.

review_title: Beautiful clean girl scent that captivated me from the start
review_content: I received a large bottle of Signature EAU DE PARFUM & I will be getting the scent in a larger size as it captivated me from the start. Montale Signature is a warm, creamy, and pleasant clean girl scent without smelling like laundry. Right from the beginning, a pleasant sweet clementine scent comes through. The fragrance impresses with warm & cozy musky notes...

Yesterday I received a fragrance package and along with the new bottle, I found a sample of the scent Signature EAU DE PARFUM in the package.
I hadn't encountered this one before, so I sprayed it on right away...

Wow! Signature is a scent that I quickly grew to love. It is extraordinary and has something uniquely special about it. No other perfume smells like this!
Yes, I have some fragrances that lean in the same olfactory direction, but they are still not comparable.

The zesty clementine in the top note provides a fresh, fruity, and slightly tart start that instantly lifts the mood. Then the floral heart note unfolds with magnolia, ylang-ylang (very subtle), and peony, soft, elegant, and simply beautiful. But the best part comes with the base: white musk, vanilla, and benzoin merge into a deliciously creamy warm combination that feels both cozy and sophisticated.

I just can't get enough of it and have to keep sniffing my wrist. Signature is a scent that imprints itself in your memory.

By the way, the name fits perfectly; the fragrance definitely has signature potential.

Thank you so much for the generous sample, dear A. It’s going straight into my handbag.

The scent is supposed to be similar to another very well-known fragrance, but I simply don't see the resemblance. I prefer the Montblanc Signature much more. For me, it's an everyday companion that accompanies me in all situations. Nice and soft, creamy and slightly sweet, and you can definitely smell the musk.
The fragrance is great as a Mother's Day gift as well as for personal use. Gentle and beautiful! Every time I wear it, it feels like I am being enveloped and lovingly embraced by the scent.

Truly worthy of a signature, as the scent is not strong and you don't get tired of it quickly.

I had some concerns about the Ylang Ylang, as it can easily take over the composition. But no, here it holds back in moderation, allowing the Clementine to take the lead, which comes across pleasantly delicate.

The Magnolia and Peony are also so subtle in the background that they all harmonize well together.

The Vanilla adds a slight sweetness, but it doesn’t make the scent too sweet.

All the components blended together make the Clementine come across rather creamy, which feels refined.

On me, the scent lasts for 6 hours, after which Musk and Vanilla linger close to the skin for a good hour.

I initially had difficulty warming up to the scent, which was probably due to the vanilla. Once the vanilla takes the lead, I can no longer stand the fragrance. Mont Blanc has managed to change my opinion with Signature.
At first, I felt the usual aversion to the scent. But the dry-down convinced me - suddenly I wanted to spray it again. And a day later, everything in me was screaming for this fragrance!

It is such a light scent that goes wonderfully with casual, airy outfits. A lovely spring fragrance for mild days.

A typical Clean Girl Aesthetic fragrance! Creamy, fluffy, soft .. absolutely fascinating! It opens with citrus notes that thankfully are not piercing, followed by floral accents and a creamy, woody base. The combination of mandarin, blossoms, and vanilla creates a harmonious balance that feels modern. The price-performance ratio is top-notch here. On my skin, it is very...

I received the fragrance by chance as a sample and initially didn't think much of it, nor was I directly drawn to it by the design or the name. In my opinion, it definitely has, as the name suggests, potential for a signature scent! I would describe it as follows: Creamy-fruity (I can definitely smell the clementine lightly, and I also perceive a mild pineapple note). A...

For this year's spring, I wanted a scent that would accompany me with a fresh fragrance throughout the day.
At first, I found it quite likable, and now it has truly become a love.
The top note starts with strong mandarin, which I already find beautiful, but what I love the most is when, after about half an hour, this wonderfully maintained, creamy fresh scent spreads through the warmth of the skin. Such a pleasant and beautiful experience.
I also received compliments for the very first time when I started wearing this fragrance.
It is currently carrying me through many warm days. I would also say that it can be worn year-round.
The longevity for me is about 7 hours with 6 sprays. The sillage is quite moderate, but it lasts as well.
I love it and don't want to be without it anymore.

I also bought this little cutie blind and have already reordered it twice. It’s not exactly what I was looking for, but it’s not wrong either; maybe it just sweetens the waiting time until I find my real "baby" ;-)
I find it to be a simply pleasant floral scent, slightly pear-like for me, that is neither intrusive nor particularly special. But it is nice, with medium longevity and sillage, so you can't go wrong with it, and it's quite suitable for everyday use.

Mont Blanc Signature was a blind buy. I was completely surprised by the light fruity note that surrounds the sweetness. A great evening summer scent that is perfect for wearing to dinner. The musk scent comes out later, very sensual and seductive.
All in all, I am positively surprised and will probably wear it more often.

I was surprised by this perfume. A wonderful perfume enthusiast sent me a sample through a swap.
At first, I was very skeptical as creamy and fruity scents are not really my thing. I prefer lighter and fresher perfumes.
Now I dared to spray it on. My first thoughts were: oh no, not another fruit basket. But then it unfolded into a very pleasant creaminess.
A beautiful scent emerged. I felt completely comfortable and happy. One could think I had just showered and applied an expensive body lotion.
I was also totally surprised by the longevity and sillage. It lasted through an entire workday, and in the evening I could still perceive the scent.

A great all-rounder perfume, no matter if for work or leisure. I would wear this on warm as well as on cold days.
Good mood is guaranteed.

It's admirable how diverse tastes can be.

It reminds me of a scent from my childhood: There used to be these red-and-white striped yogurt candies from Campino. And they also came in orange-and-white striped for a short time. (Probably a limited edition with orange?) In any case, they smelled like this fragrance: a bit creamy, but not too clean, rather like fresh yogurt. Orange citrus fruits (the scent has a very clear...

On the test strip and on my clothing, I smell a salt or licorice note that is not listed in the fragrance notes and that I personally don't like very much.

On my skin, the scent develops quite differently - creamy, well-groomed, addictive, and not a trace of salt. After testing it several times, I had to get the bottle.

If "Signature" were a color, it would be a light, orange, -almost white- pastel shade, mixed with a bit of beige.

"Summer vacation in Spain, freshly showered, enjoying the evening sun, on the way to the terrace for a light, Mediterranean dinner. Waiting for the sunset, inhaling the warm, yet fresh summer air."

I have been searching for a while for a fragrance that is creamy, fresh, a bit fruity, but definitely not too powdery and sweet.
"Signature" is the fulfillment of my desires, it combines all of that:
This scent is so harmonious, clean, slightly fruity, but not too sour and - wonderfully creamy! (Hardly could the fragrance direction "Creamy" describe a scent better!)

For the final touch to the "Signature scent," it lacks a bit of that certain something, as the fragrance is very straightforward, and not "extraordinary" enough, perhaps also a bit inconspicuous.

For me, this is not bothersome-
"Signature" is a well-groomed, pleasant women's fragrance, as velvety as the fuzz of a peach. A scent that is not cloying or intrusive.
It is a skin-close fragrance (sillage not really outstanding), which is my only point of criticism.

"Signature" by Montblanc is, for me, the number one among all fragrances in the "creamy" scent category:
The Crème de la Crème of creamy fragrances!

I sprayed the fragrance and found it pleasant at first - creamy, clean, and sweet. Exactly what you would expect from the scent notes.
Then came the obligatory test on my husband (he gets headaches from some fragrances, so I usually hold new perfumes right under his nose):
His comment: “Smells like girl’s deodorant.”

And just like that - there it was, the most intense flashback of my life: sports locker room, 8th grade. Impulse Vanilla Kisses.
The first good impression was gone. Since then, unfortunately, all I smell is: cheap deodorant with a nostalgia factor.

This summer, I spontaneously tested Montblanc Signature in the large D, without having it on my radar beforehand.... this creamy and slightly fruity yogurt freshness immediately captivated me!
As the name suggests, it could easily be a signature scent, as I find it quite unobtrusive and somehow wonderfully well-groomed and creamy, especially in the dry down.
In the end, the beautiful vanilla remains, with a pleasant longevity of about 7 hours.
It reminds me of the fruit yogurts I often ate as a child....

I find this pretty and sweet scent quite special; I haven't smelled many of this kind, so it definitely has to join my collection!

The Montblanc Signature was recommended to me in a perfume store. I would never have thought of it myself. And then I was shockingly in love and had to have it. It’s somehow creamy but also has a fresh sweetness to it - hard to grasp for my "beginner's nose" but just a great scent. Montblanc "Signature" has since become my daily signature fragrance that makes it clear I’m around. Leisure, work, no matter what. It's there. For me, it’s more of a spring to summer scent, but it might accompany me a bit into autumn. Great love.

Signature is a passionate, seductive fragrance.

The scent is sweet and creamy. It is thoroughly accompanied by vanilla and musk. The fragrance truly feels very soft. But the floral notes are not lost in this scent either.

It is a fragrance that can/could always accompany you…….but I also have criticism. As beautiful as the scent is, and I really like it, where is the longevity? I have never had a fragrance with such low longevity. Even in my surroundings, the scent was hardly noticed, if at all. That is unfortunately very disappointing.

So in conclusion: a purely passionate fragrance that will seduce you but unfortunately not for long.

It's rare for a fragrance to catch my attention on the first sniff, but when my colleague wore this one, I couldn't keep my nose away from her and had to buy it immediately.
Apparently, I particularly like creamy cozy scents, because that's exactly what we have here. Definitely a new treasure in my collection that I won't part with.

My first impulse buy! I smelled the fragrance at Douglass, without knowing the pyramid. On the paper, I detected a dominant, freshly cut green pear that quickly became powdery, creamy, and clean.

After testing for a while, the clementine is definitely very present in the top note, but it evaporates quickly - just like the rest of the perfume, unfortunately.

The powdery note remains in the end, but unfortunately, after 1-2 hours, I can't smell anything anymore... I spray it 2-3 times again during a workday.

What a pity! I will use up the fragrance because I like it so much, but the longevity does not encourage a repurchase.

Very wearable and pleasant everyday scent. I perceive orange and vanilla and find that it smells a bit like a body lotion. Initially, there is a lot of alcohol, which, however, evaporates within a few minutes and leaves behind a nice citrusy creaminess. For me, it's more of a scent for daytime, especially in spring and summer.

For me, or on my skin, this fragrance is primarily vanilla, or it ultimately remains rather vanilla. I find it very pleasant and rather light. One could say that at first it even smells a bit fruity. The top note should be clementine, and the heart notes are magnolia, ylang-ylang, and peony. The base notes are vanilla, white musk, and benzoin resin.

I can wear rather heavy, "oriental" or vanilla scents well. The perfume is also said to be categorized as Oriental-Floral, and is therefore perhaps more feminine. The perfume has been available since 2020. I have long been using mainly Moncler pour femme, and Montblanc reminds me a bit of that.

Recently, I have also enjoyed using Montblanc as an alternative. However, for a lasting signature scent, it is unfortunately a bit too boring in the dry down for me.

This had been my signature scent since 2007, until it was recently dethroned by Bvlgari Man Extreme. It's an excellent office frag because it seems to evoke modern architecture with that crisp, well-blended mandarin-ginger combo, with a touch of aquatic-ness from the bamboo. It's a little sharp off the top, but when it dries down, the cedar comes out and gives it a solid base to hold onto. In fact, the overall feel is one of pencil shavings amidst a bowl of citrus fruit. At least, that's what I get.

I don't know why, but this frag always reminds me of academia. Maybe it's the pencil shaving analogy reminding me of elementary school, but I can totally see this being the signature scent of Principal Seymour Skinner from the Simpsons. It's just got that blue, sharp and proper feel about it, with and air of reliability and calmness. An easy dumb reach if that's what you're looking for. Perfect for most occasions and all ages. Plus, the longevity is good for a freshie. I just wish they had made the bottle bigger.

review_title: A Nice Unique Scent with Bamboo note
review_content:
It is a Wonderful Fresh Fragrance, Light, Clean and Bright with Unique Bamboo note. If you like a Fresh Citrusy Style Perfume with Bamboo note and a bit of the spices, you will like this one. It smells so good and very pleasant. It opens up with like fresh citrusy , bamboo and spices notes in the background then dry down is woody musky. This is perfect for the spring and summer and I really enjoy it and I'm so happy that I have it in my collection. Longevity is average.
Thumbs Up.
Rating : 7.5 / 10

review_title: It is definitely similar to Versace Man Eau Fraîche
review_content:
But much less intense… from opening to dry down it’s quite a few decibels below the Versace it replicates.

I actually prefer this one though… as it dries down it becomes smoother, and that bamboo note has me wanting more and more.

Performance wise, though, it’s quite weak. MAYBE a 1-2ft radius for a half hour or so, and then it sits on the skin leaving a very faint whisper of a sillage trail, for 4-6 hours or so.

For the price you can find it for, you shouldn’t be complaining… but you WILL be wishing it could go a little louder, for a lot longer.

Opens beautifuly with a nice bamboo note but then it just disappears. Big disappointment.

Lasting power is like 1 hour. Sillage and projection are average.

This could easily be between the top ones if the notes were better worked.

Anyway, if you're looking for an inoffensive scent for office, this scent may be your choice.

Updated January 2014

review_title: Great in top note but gone fast
review_content:
This is my one of the best fragrance in term of opening scent. The bamboo and citrus is quite nice but after 1-2 hours, the scent will be like skin scent and after 4-5 hours, it almost disappear. Waring this fragrance outside room may lost the scent more quickly.
Note that, All is use by myself. It may difference with another person skin. Please test on yourself again.

There is something almost soothing about Starwalker's opening bamboo and bergamot combo, a gentle blend of sweet soft wood and sharp citrus with all other supporting notes in the background –fir, ginger, cedar, sandalwood– adding to the quiet, zen-like balance. This is not an aggressive scent that will turn you into an alpha male; it's a fresh, watery fragrance preparing...

review_title: Synthetic, but smells nice in the air
review_content: The is very synthetic to my nose and not necessarily pleasant smelling. It's also a bit bitter. This becomes more bearable after it dries down a bit. It's got a cheap vibe, If I wear this on my neck it will just annoy me. Other people seem to love the smell when I wear this. That and great versatility/appropriateness are reasons why this will stay in my collection anyway. A dumb reach for me which apparently smells good in the air but not so pleasant from up close. I can not wear this on my neck because it chokes me, so I wear this on my shirt and arms. Lasting power below average. I'd say there are better options for the money (Explorer?).

When I first wore Starwalker for a day at the office, I thought: Damned, this is good ... and not just hit but hype-worthy! It immediately reminded me of Aqva Amara, which smells completely different but still shares something in common with this Montblanc: It should not be discontinued until Bvlgari was so hyped this year that it made an unexpected comeback. And while Starwalker is also a discontinued model, I felt: This exceptionally good fragrance deserves to be hyped as well, so that it continues to be produced. Because taking it off the market would truly be a sin!

Right from the start, Starwalker impresses with a fresh, bright fruity opening, a refreshing mixture of the top notes of bergamot and mandarin. However, it is not too citrusy, as one might assume, but equally bright, soft, and slightly sweet, which is mainly thanks to the mandarin - very pleasantly light, friendly, and likable. I liked this scent from the very first second, but it gets even better ...

For the first three-quarters of an hour, not much happens, and you simply enjoy the beautiful atmosphere that this Montblanc creates. But then the heart notes gradually come through, forming a -albeit very subtle- counterpoint to the initial fruity sweetness: Ginger and nutmeg (perhaps also the pine resin) make it a bit spicier and thus more transparent, more differentiated. There’s more going on in the fragrance, which now increasingly feels stimulating and revitalizing, yet remains bright and fruity. Just a well-rounded affair. Nothing drifts off in any unwanted direction; instead, it "matures," gaining depth - well done!

But then, after about 1.5 hours, this Star-Walker becomes a Star-Climber by playing its true trump card: The wood! Because on its journey, sandalwood and cedar now join in, giving it increasing presence, which after another half hour becomes a bit sharp and crackly due to the cedar, although it always remains embedded in the soft-creamy sandalwood - a very attractive duo.

Thus, Montblanc's Starwalker develops into a woodier, more expressive, and contoured scent in the drydown. Yet the fine freshness always remains, as the top notes never disappear with about 30-40% of the fragrance share. This final mélange, the mix of a clear, bright-dry wood base and the fruity freshness of the top notes lasts unexpectedly long (on a shirt) with a distinctly noticeable sillage - at arm's length.

In my opinion, this fragrance is neither particularly green nor metallic, nor does it smell like "almost only mandarin," as stated in other reviews. Sure, Starwalker is fruity and initially does lean somewhat towards Versace's Man Eau Fraîche, but at most 40-50% of its citrus freshness. Because the top notes of Starwalker do not constitute its dominance; rather, wood makes up nearly 2/3 of the fragrance's progression. Primarily, it is a sweet wood scent with a (citrusy)-fruity overlay.

So Starwalker is a bullseye that will surely accompany me for a long time, also because it is a good all-rounder. Perfectly suitable in spring and autumn, especially during the day in the office and leisure time. Because for me, the woody freshness of this wonderful scent is simply

hype-worthy!

First, one can perceive an intense and powerful refreshing citrus note, which also brings a fine clear, pure-acting sour herbal undertone thanks to the bergamot.

At the same time, the bergamot is accompanied by another citrus note that carries very tender sweet, rather floral traits and conceals a pleasantly warming, bright wooden aura in the background, which I would never have attributed to bamboo.

These two notes are accompanied by a subtle sweet fruity nuance that lends the fragrance a beautiful softness and comes from the mandarin.

A little later, the citrus aura has changed slightly; it has indeed become more typically lemony and has pushed its sour aspects a bit into the background to give way to a fine, smooth wooden nuance that stems from the ginger.

The ginger is accompanied by a beautifully pronounced masculine aromatic note reminiscent of white pepper, which I believe is responsible for the fragrance not drifting into insignificance but truly providing relief in sweltering hot temperatures.

These two notes are accompanied by a pleasant ethereal, almost aquatic, softly perceived shower gel association that surprisingly fits wonderfully with this scent, and I also would not have thought of pine resin here.

In the far background, and only detectable on my skin, there is a lovely nuance that feels warm on the skin, carrying a very subtle sweet spicy hint, which is thanks to the amber.

In the last 3 hours, I cannot detect any of the aforementioned notes, but only:

Balloon!

This balloon is not fully inflated yet, but only halfway, and do I find that bad? - No - It's just something different, and I find that extremely pleasant and yet interesting :-)

You wonder if I have inhaled the helium from the balloon? - But of course! :-)

No, seriously now, the "balloon accord" becomes pleasantly soft woody and subtly bitter, where I can very well imagine that this comes from the sandalwood in conjunction with the vetiver, though I would have never thought of these two notes, I would rather have leaned towards vetiver.

Unfortunately, I could not perceive musk, but I can very well imagine that this note was used for complementation.

Overall, the fragrance lasts 7 hours on my skin.

The sillage is designed from the beginning to be clearly noticeable at half an arm's length, and this is maintained for 2.5 hours before it gradually diminishes until the fragrance fades away.

I would like to express my sincere thanks to our Parfumo "Honk1510" for the decanting.

...and stylistically positioned somewhere between "L'Eau d'Issey" and "Luna Rossa", although clearly "brighter" than the former.

"Starwalker" comes across quite pleasingly, the opening is energetic, fitting well with spring and would accompany the weeks nicely when the last snow disappears and the first longer sunny days arrive.
The well-perceptible, soft musk aroma is noticeable quite early and is well integrated.

A slightly metallic touch gives the whole composition a minty feel, contributing to the vital aspect. However, I always have a bit of trouble with this, as such fragrances seem somewhat distant to me.
