I walked into the office and immediately received more compliments, as you can read in the headline :))) I've never received so many compliments before. Totally amazed, I went home, and my colleague texted me that the office still smelled like me... I thought, huh, is the Explorer that strong? Because it was only 5 sprays, and exactly 4 and a half hours had passed, and the scent is still very present.
I am so impressed with the Explorer.
Regarding longevity, I can say after 4 and a half hours that I can still smell it, and my wife is confirming that right now.
If it lasts a good 7-9 hours, that would be great, and even if it doesn’t, the perfume is still worth the money.

I would really recommend it to everyone. In my opinion, it can be worn in any season and for all occasions, and it suits every age. It's a very masculine scent with a compliment factor.

So, conclusion after a good 11 hours:
The scent was very present after a good 5 hours. After 8 hours, it was relatively close but still noticeable. Currently, it’s the 11th hour, and it's still very close to the skin but still smells good. So either the Explorer projects wonderfully on my skin, or I got a good batch :) haha

Goodness, how good can an opening and a top note be?! The Montblanc Explorer: “Yes!”.

The well-known and popular pineapple-bergamot combination from the large and sinfully expensive model from Creed hits just as hard in this significantly cheaper version as it does in the original. The differences primarily show in the development: the Explorer feels a bit bumpier and less rounded and harmonious than the Aventus. The components blend together a bit more seamlessly in the original. If the two fragrances were cars, one would say that the gaps aren’t quite right. I hope you understand what I mean.

My predecessors hint at it: longevity is indeed not the core competence of the Explorer, but reapplying is possible without immediately booking an appointment with the insolvency administrator.

At least on my skin, after about an hour, it’s not really perceptible anymore, while others can still smell it. Up close, it becomes noticeable from 4 hours onward.

A super pleasant daily office scent, and in spring and summer, a few people will surely turn around sniffing to find out who smells so fantastic.

Clear recommendation to buy.

I noticed the scent in public. The young gentleman kindly wrote down the name and recommendation for me. A really good fragrance that enchants from the very beginning. The bergamot at the start gave me a wow effect, which I miss in many perfumes.

Fruity is rather the impression that embraces the nose upon the first sniff. The real star here takes the stage in the heart note. Haitian vetiver, rounded off by the leathery scent, and the transition to the base note with patchouli and cocoa makes the performance an unforgettable experience.

An explorer who collects the ingredients during his continuous journey and offers them to the businessman at the bustling harbor with a radiant, confident smile. The businessman carries on the scent and the legacy.

A successful perfume for the self-assured and victorious man. Montblanc, gladly again!

It is immediately apparent where the inspiration for this fragrance was drawn from. The similarity to Aventus is unmistakable; however, the scent is not better. The fragrance opens with a naturally smelling bergamot note that reminds one of fruity Aventus batches. It is invigorating and ripe, and since this note is sometimes used to mimic the pineapple note, the Aventus DNA...

In the past, I always used a leftover bottle of Aventus by Creed as my signature scent. Then there was an almost 1:1 imitation. But something always bothered me. Somehow, the DNA was too fruity for me. After a while, I always perceived a sting in my nose. And then I tried Montblanc Explorer. Instead of a fruity pineapple, we have a fresh bergamot here. The scent comes across as significantly fresher and calmer. However, it is also flatter than Aventus by Creed, which is a positive aspect for me as a daily wear. Overall, the scent is an all-rounder and can be worn at any time. On top of that, there's the unbelievably good price and many compliments, as the scent DNA is very pleasing.

review_title: Montblanc Explorer - From a Mispurchase to a Valued Classic
review_content:
Back then... years ago... at the beginning of my niche discovery journey... I was on my way to the perfume store to grab Aventus when I was persuaded to give Explorer a chance. Once home, I sprayed it on and immediately put the scent up on "eBay" :)
However, since I didn’t want to sell it off, I kept it and must say today, after about 400 samples, that I give it at least 8-9 out of 10 fragrance points.

By now, Montblanc Explorer has undoubtedly convinced me and deserves a strong rating. This scent is well-known in competition with some big names in the scene, but it has carved out its own place and impresses with an excellent price-performance ratio.

Content-wise, one cannot help but notice the striking similarity to Creed Aventus and Armaf - Club de Nuit Intense. The refreshing combination of citrus notes and spicy accords is 95% reminiscent of these classics.

What Montblanc Explorer does just as well, if not better, is its unmistakable masculine presence. The woody nuances and the slightly smoky note give the fragrance a depth that lends it a distinctive and masculine flair. This is one of the aspects that has led me to perceive this scent as the best of the three. Similarity to Nishane - Hacivat perhaps 85%.

In terms of longevity and projection, Montblanc Explorer has also impressed me. The scent lasts for hours and can confidently be worn in the office if one wants to be noticed.

Considering the overall package, Montblanc Explorer is an amazing "discovery." Its similarity to top-notch fragrances like Creed Aventus, combined with its masculine aura and unbeatable price, makes it a true gem. Clearly, the uniqueness is somewhat lacking by now.

Nevertheless, for anyone looking for a high-quality fragrance that won’t break the bank, Explorer is definitely worth considering.

Often we ask ourselves what exactly a clone is or what can be considered standalone. In fact, the Explorer bears a strong resemblance to Aventus by Creed. But it is incorrect to refer to it as a clone; rather, it is a kind of zeitgeist fragrance. All fragrances, whether it’s Molecule 01 or even Sauvage by Dior, come dressed in the guise of aquatic freshness. It was clear that Montblanc would come up with its own offering to launch on the market. Unlike, for example, Aventus, the Explorer is available in every regular store, and the pricing practically invites you to buy. Someone once described the comparison between Porsche and Twingo; actually, the comparison should be: Porsche vs. Mazda RX-7. Both are not just cars that drive, but both are sports cars.

The Explorer even has slight advantages over Aventus in daily office use. Aventus is so high-quality that the wearer practically fills the room with its scent. With the Explorer, the sillage and longevity ensure that it lightly settles in the space. A really good colleague, indeed. Always there, not too intrusive.

As many have already written, Explorer should not necessarily be labeled as an "Aventus clone." There is a certain similarity present, but it does not lean towards the smokier "Club de Nuit."

Sillage and longevity are okay to good, but just right for wearing the fragrance in the office. However, those hoping for a Sauvage-like performance will be disappointed. In my opinion, it could perform a bit better; then it would be nearly perfect.

Nevertheless, I have received more compliments for this fragrance than for any other. In the office, female colleagues asked me several times what a wonderful scent it is, as they would like to buy it for their partners.

The bottle looks good, but unfortunately, it is hard to see the amount of contents. Better to check several times; you don't want to end up living without it for a short time ;-). Those who like this fragrance will keep buying it again and again.

First of all: I don't know how cre*d @ventus smells, so I will pretend that this fragrance doesn't exist...
This scent is just so good for teenagers and young adults, it smells fruity fresh with a cool aftershave vibe.
After a few hours, you can smell the light leather and cocoa (could also be because I know what's inside ;) )
You can wear it anytime and anywhere, as it is strong (but not overpowering), you could even wear it in winter. However, I prefer spring/summer and autumn.

The bottle is really very stylish with this leather-like wrapping and the chic Montblanc emblem. The cap feels very high-quality and heavy, also in the shape of the Montblanc emblem.

Today, Montblanc "Explorer" has come into my possession, and of course, I immediately compared the scent to Aventus. However, I cannot agree with the many voices that claim Explorer is a nearly 100% scent twin of Aventus. Aventus is significantly more citrusy than Explorer and smells more natural! The longevity also doesn't compare to Aventus. Explorer is not a bad fragrance,...

Adam and Eve had two sons, the firstborn Cain and then Abel.
Abel became a shepherd, Cain a farmer.
Cain brought an offering to the Lord with fruits from his field, Abel sacrificed the firstborn of his flock.
The Lord looked graciously upon Abel's offering, but not upon Cain's, and Cain was furious about it.
God noticed his anger and urged him to moderation, but Cain invited his brother to his field and killed him there.
When God asked him about Abel, he replied that he was not his brother's keeper.
God condemned him:
Because of the shedding of blood, the earth would no longer yield him fruit, and he would be a fugitive forever.
Cain went away.....

In this case, Montblanc Explorer is the younger brother of Creed Aventus, but let's not get hung up on details.
First: The bottle does not need to hide from its brother.
I must admit it has been a while since I tested Aventus, and I didn't take any notes or anything..
What I do know is that Explorer comes pretty close. There may only be nuances where Aventus is "better".
The crux of the matter, why the younger brother here surpasses the older one, is quite simple for me:
These nuances do not justify a price increase of over 200 euros..for that money, you can get SEVERAL other beautiful fragrances.

review_title: So cheap, So great, Want it
review_content:
I would like to dedicate my first comment to MB Explorer. I am relatively new here, but I am itching to share my thoughts since I am not quite sure what to make of the whole "(Aventus) hype".

First of all, I have absolutely no idea how Aventus smells. I have never smelled it. Many people talk about how great MB Explorer is, what a good price-performance ratio it has, and that it resembles Aventus quite a bit. Especially on YouTube, it is praised by influencers, and here on Parfumo or Fragrantica, it is rated very well. How closely it resembles Aventus in the end, you can probably judge better if you know both fragrances.

While searching for a new scent, I stumbled upon MB Explorer for the first time in a drugstore. I had done a bit of browsing online beforehand and knew that it was supposed to be very similar to the famous Aventus. So I sprayed it on a test strip and tried it out. I can still clearly remember what I thought: "Well, a bit fresh and smoky. Is this how Aventus is supposed to smell? That's nothing special."

Due to a little online shopping addiction caused by Corona, I eventually decided to buy MB Explorer for cheap. So cheap, why not treat myself even if the first impression wasn't that great. After all, it is rated very well, so the argument goes...

I received the fragrance, sprayed it on, and found that my first impression had not changed. Citrusy-fresh bergamot with ambroxan in the background. This is how the entire fragrance unfolds for me, from opening to end. Monotonous. Boring. About 1 hour of projection and 6 hours on the skin, that's it. Not detectable on clothing the next day. The bottle, by the way, is quite stylish, feels heavy in the hand, and has a quality feel to it.

I will probably test Aventus in the near future to form my own opinion. But I believe this fragrance direction simply does not suit me. Tastes are different, and maybe I will remember this next time I make impulsive purchases.

BM Explorer, in any case, will be given away.

review_title: Sought and Found; the Great Love
review_content:
I stumbled upon this wonderful site quite by chance over the past year.

Since then, I have spent countless hours here in anonymous (unregistered) mode. I’ve gathered inputs, expanded my perfume horizon, and annoyed my wife when I was once again on my phone and she asked me what I was doing. ;-)
At the beginning of this year, I finally mustered all my courage and created an account.

Parfumo, thank you for existing!

So, here’s my first comment on a perfume. I’m almost a little nervous thinking about all the high-quality comments I’ve read, but it will be fine.

Montblanc Explorer, what can I say? I stumbled upon this perfume quite by chance. On a free day after Christmas, feeling a bit bored, I decided to go buy a new perfume. My wife’s enthusiasm was somewhat limited: "What, another new perfume?!" but I didn’t really care.

Once I arrived at the perfume store, I ran like a tiger between the shelves, looking at all the different perfumes, and suddenly my eyes stopped at the Montblanc Explorer packaging (a tester was not available). Spontaneously, as I am, I decided to buy this perfume without testing it first.
I still have the habit of buying a perfume without trying it beforehand. Sometimes I do it like with wine; nice label (or beautiful bottle/packaging); yes, this one must be good! Most of the time, I’m right, or lucky! Hahaha

Barely in the car, I freed the bottle from its packaging and treated myself to one spray on the back of my hand. WOW! What is this?! WOOW!!

Rarely have I been so blown away when spraying a perfume as I was with Montblanc Explorer. I don’t yet have the experience to distinguish individual notes, but what flowed into my nose was simply incredible. Fresh yet sweet, new yet familiar. A scent I had never smelled anywhere before. It was love at first sight; I fell in love, we found each other; One Love!

Yesterday, I sprayed Montblanc Explorer for the office (3 sprays). Sprayed at 6 AM, and I perceived this wonderful scent throughout the whole day. Even when I got home in the evening, I could still smell it, not just on my shirt, but also on my skin. I was and am thrilled!

I have already tested and bought several perfumes, but I was often disappointed by their weak longevity; that is very important to me. Rarely have I noticed the scent in the evening after work. Not so here.

I have often wondered if I would ever find MY perfume; or as most here say, my signature scent.

I believe now, after yesterday, I have found my office signature scent.

Since I like the women's fragrances from Montblanc, I decided to explore the men's fragrances as well.
I came across Explorer, which I liked immediately.
No, not for me - it's too masculine for that - but it would suit my boyfriend well.
He is a nature-loving man with whom I enjoy going on rides in the forest.
The woodiness of the trees blends well with the leather of the tack.
You feel secure on the horse's back - and free at the same time.
Moreover, Explorer radiates a pleasant calm.
You ride at a walking pace and keep an eye out for the animals of the forest.
The deer are not disturbed by us and continue to graze peacefully.
A relaxed scent for nature-loving gentlemen - who are at peace with themselves.

I have been testing Aventus and Explorer in parallel for days, and for this beautiful close-to-the-original homage in a much more premium bottle (for those interested) at a comparatively bargain price (about €40 per 100ml), I give both thumbs up.
We don't have a 1:1 clone here (of what, when each Creed batch smells different from the other...) but the almost euphorically fresh-fruity-spicy scent is just as present, as well as the similar drydown including the two inherent longevity (6 to 7 hours) and the rather polite, skin-close sillage.
In my humble opinion, perfect for the office and everyday use. One always appreciates a waft.
If you have one, you don't need the other in my opinion... unless, of course, Creed as a status symbol in the mirrored cabinet for the initiated. ;)

review_title: Yes, I'm only testing it because of Aventus…
review_content: … I have to admit that. The Explorer is certainly a fragrance that many overlook. After all, Montblanc is not the standout brand when it comes to perfume. But thanks to the community here, this scent is probably the most sought-after MB. I tested it because I simply love "Aventus | Creed," but the batch variations and the associated H/S inconsistency...

Well, tastes are different. Whether it's Aventus or not, I find that Explorer has nothing to do with Creed. It does start off very much in the direction of Aventus, but it develops completely differently in the drydown. It is very versatile, and I even find it quite good now in December. You can't go wrong with Montblanc fragrances, as you get a lot of quality for little money. I would always prefer Explorer over Club de Nuit, as I find it much more pleasant and it doesn't scratch like Armaf. The performance is really solid too; it lasts about 6 hours on me, which is really strong for the price.

In conclusion, I can say that the fragrance is really great, and I wear it more often than, for example,
Sauvage, Bleu de Chanel, Dylan Blue, etc. If you're looking for a fragrance for everything and don't want to spend much, this is the perfect choice.
An absolute must-have for everyone.

I initially resisted buying it for a long time, and now I want it to stay. By that, I mainly mean in my nose. I was once again looking for affordable everyday scents for the office and finally got this fragrance.
At the first spray, I thought, wow, this is exactly what I wanted. Lightly citrusy at the beginning, clean, and it develops very rounded on the skin; there’s nothing that bothers me about the scent itself, quite the opposite. I’ve been wearing the MB in the office for 2 weeks now and have surprisingly received a lot of compliments, which of course makes me happy. The problem I have with the scent is that I can completely spray myself in the morning and feel like I can't perceive or smell it at all after about 2 hours... maybe a little if I go outside and the wind blows past me... which I find quite curious since people have approached me even after 7 hours or longer and asked what I was wearing. I've heard of fragrance blindness, but I haven't experienced that yet. Well, now I'm looking for a scent that smells just as good but performs stronger for me personally.

review_title: The Aventus Twin That Isn't Worth Mentioning
review_content:
Montblanc Explorer:

The new Montblanc. When it came out, I thought to myself, WELL! Has Montblanc once again copied a fragrance and interpreted it themselves? A comparison with Aventus is not worthy, as this scent is quite synthetic. You wouldn't compare Mike Tyson with Manny, would you? Different weight class, thus different rules. But let's get to the scent and packaging.

The packaging is nothing special, but you get the impression that the bottle is well-made. A metal cap with a leather strip around the bottle does make an impression! When you remove the cap, the vaporizer is also quite good; I've seen worse. The opening is unfortunately very close to Aventus; I would even go so far as to say that perfume novices wouldn't recognize the difference in the opening.

The scent starts with a sweet Ambroxan opening and develops after about 1-2 hours more into a minimal leather-woody direction. A little later, you can also detect the cocoa note, but the Ambroxan is ever-present. I would estimate the longevity and sillage to be in a good range for a designer. The scent is still noticeable after 6 hours before it becomes more skin-close after about 3 hours of spraying. I can't perceive a significant development in the drydown; rather, it's a linear scent intended for the masses. After about 3-4 hours, only a sour synthetic scent remains, which might be reminiscent of green apples but comes off more leather-woody. It even gets so extreme that I get headaches from the scent in summer. Longevity for me is the standard 6-8 hours, and sillage is quite good in the first 1-2 hours for a designer! The season is more spring and autumn, as it is too fresh for winter and simply too synthetic for summer. With the fruity Aventus-like opening, it's a signature scent that one could wear on any occasion. Especially suitable for work, as you don't want strong niche fragrances in the job.

I would recommend this scent to someone looking for an affordable Aventus alternative, as I rate it too low in character as an independent fragrance. There are better scents in this price range that show more edges. For me, however, due to its overly strong synthetic nature, it has become a clear pass.

Top Note: When I first smelled this fragrance, I immediately thought of Creed - Aventus. The opening is very fresh and fruity, primarily dominated by bergamot. I also perceive a hint of pineapple. Development: Unfortunately, the fragrance quickly becomes extremely dry and synthetic (within just a few minutes). It gets to the point where I wouldn't compare it to Aventus at all...

Unfortunately, the fragrance always has to be compared to the admittedly better Creed Aventus. If I imitate a composition, I have to accept the comparison as well. First of all, I think Montblanc has created a great fragrance here once again, and I enjoy wearing it very much. Before I delve deeper into the scent, I would like to briefly describe the presentation of the...

I still remember the first time I tried this bottle, sprayed it on, walked out of the store, and then went back in to buy the good piece.

Before that, I didn't know Creed Aventus at all until my passion for collecting perfumes developed.

Now, to the point, this scent is truly the best you can have in a men's shelf! I've easily had it three times already and will gladly buy the next bottle when mine runs out. It's just such a fragrance, the fresher version of the original model and at an unbeatable price, it's almost like a gift.

I don't really notice the cocoa, maybe a hint of leather could be detected. But the bergamot, pink pepper, patchouli, ambroxan, and a touch of woods, this combo is just so incredibly awesome and simply fun.

Sure, the scent isn't dominant, it's just a freshie with a duration of about 2-4 hours, but hey! Just transfer it into a 5ml perfume spray and always have it with you for a quick refresh, I always have it with me ;). It's also a scent for any occasion, an all-year-allrounder for every season and event.

It also brings in mega compliments, one of my favorites: it smells so fruity delicious, what is that?

Conclusion: Price 10/10, Scent 10/10, Longevity 6.5/10

I bought Mont Blanc Explorer as a 100ml bottle at a good price from Notino, and what can I say, I am thrilled! I spray it on my arm even when I'm not going out just to smell it because it smells so incredibly good. But it does have a few issues... the longevity is relatively good; I can still smell it a bit after 14 hours, although it's almost only ambroxan after 6-7 hours. The sillage, on the other hand, is less impressive; right after spraying, you can smell it at arm's length for about an hour, and then it's very close to the skin. Still, it's an absolutely good fragrance, and a blind buy is allowed as long as you purchase it at a discount online.

This is a question I ask myself daily... and it's a yes and no!

One of the first perfumes I bought after extensive research, and I still see myself in it. This slightly peppery scent paired with the lightly fresh bergamot at the beginning still makes me melt. The drydown develops into a more mature character. For the price, as a Creed clone, it's always recommended!

As my first real perfume, on what I hope will be a long, diverse journey, it will always hold a special place with me. (Even if it's mainstream and just a clone/dupe, and even if this criticism is valid.)

review_title: Good Fresh Cheapie - like a Offshoot of Creed Aventus
review_content:
Montblanc releases are a safe bet. Good quality for little money. I am a fan of Legend Spirit: A better and fruitier version of One Million. Explorer is another successful release and in my opinion a weaker version of Creed Aventus.

Citrusy opening, then a lot of Ambroxan comes in. A bit of pepper. There’s really not much more to say.. It immediately evokes associations with Aventus. Unfortunately, the scent doesn’t last as long as Creed. Good 3 hours, more subtle sillage. I like to use it around sports and in everyday life on warm days. Price/performance is top as always with Montblanc. The Explorer doesn’t offend and is suitable for anyone under 40.

The Montblanc Explorer is a truly high-quality citrus pineapple scent and suitable for any situation. Want to meet friends in the park? Montblanc Explorer. Have a job interview? Montblanc Explorer. Meeting your in-laws? Montblanc Explorer. I have a travel size (30ml) and love to take it with me on trips, etc. It's simply a super safe, crowd-pleasing everyday fragrance that you just can't go wrong with!

The scent starts off fruity/fresh for me, it smells very clean and carries a certain masculinity that I really liked.
Unfortunately, in the somewhat shorter scent progression, not much really changes in my opinion. Only the Ambroxan becomes a bit more prominent. After 4 hours, it can only be perceived close to the skin.
Still, it's a good fragrance and the price-performance ratio is also top-notch.

I have almost finished the 100ml of this fragrance. It is a great scent that fits best for work/school as it is not too strong or overwhelming.

I think it is no secret that it is inspired by the legendary Creed Aventus. However, in my opinion, it is not an identical dupe. You definitely get the Aventus DNA with the citrusy spicy top note and the smoky slightly green base and heart note. With Aventus, I get more pineapple, which I miss in the Explorer. I would describe the Explorer as a designer version of Aventus, as it contains a lot of ambroxan and the smokiness is more pleasant.

It is actually always wearable and at around €40 for 100ml, you can hardly go wrong. Of course, it is a bit synthetic and not as good as the original. However, anyone looking for a nice office scent should check this out in a perfume shop.

First time for me. I received my first perfume as a birthday gift years ago. I chose it myself, and it was Versace Eros Flame. I didn't know much about perfumes and slowly started to dislike it. Until this summer, my interest in perfumes was awakened. After a super fun hour with a Douglas employee, during which he showed me many perfumes and I was able to expand my horizon (and his too, as I was probably the first customer who could associate a place, people, a memory, etc. with each scent, which he could also feel).

The ones that brought me back are 1. AdG Profumo and 2. our cheapie here.

This one is especially similar to Aventus in the opening, no question about it. It is an Aventus clone, period.

Explorer opens very citrusy, with a hint of pepper and a kick of Ambroxan. Sometimes it unfortunately starts off very alcoholic as well. Give it a little time, though, and it gets better! But this perfume doesn't give the wearer much time either, as it seems to fade after about 3-5 hours. So spray a bit more than usual if you want it to last longer on you!

It’s a typical freshie, just like you know it and many others. Not complex, but still nice! It feels really good in the summer.

The price, especially for the small bottle outside of perfumeries, is great, so you can treat yourself to it ;)

If you know someone who only wears Bruno Banani and other discount scents, be so kind and upgrade this regular Joe to Explorer ;)

review_title: Perfect Everyday Scent and Great Alternative to Aventus
review_content: Great citrus notes at the beginning, followed by an increasingly beautiful bergamot, and in the drydown, it becomes more and more woody and slightly smoky. A very masculine everyday scent that you won't clash with anyone at work, yet it always brings compliments. In direct comparison to the big role model Creed Aventus, I can hardly perceive any difference. On the contrary,...

When I looked at the bottle, I thought I would give it a try. The Montblanc Explorer fits well in the hand and is stylish. I sprayed it on my wrist and got a nice fresh breeze in my nose. It has a fruity pineapple note that is very similar to a well-known niche fragrance.

Longevity: Unfortunately, the longevity is not very strong, but for the price, it can be accepted.

Conclusion: For me, it is a nice all-rounder fragrance that can be worn anytime, whether for sports or in the office.

I got Explorer 2020 as an affordable alternative to Creed Aventus. Back then, it was a solid alternative - today I feel that its composition has changed. Nevertheless, Explorer remains a solid all-rounder for me and can be worn on almost any occasion thanks to its discreet freshness. The pineapple note from Aventus no longer hits the mark for my taste, but that’s not a...

Montblanc Explorer is the absolute mainstream clone. It smells great but is much cheaper than Aventus. It also doesn't have a smoky note like CDNI. It smells pleasant and has a certain Sauvage twist due to the Ambroxan. I find it a pity that there is no pineapple note included.
I like it because my budget is limited and I just want to smell good at work, for example. However, if I really want to feel elegant and "chic," I tend to reach for another fragrance from my collection...

Montblanc Explorer belongs to the category of fragrances that can be worn effortlessly for any occasion. It has certainly made its way into the mainstream, but there are good reasons for that. For a very fair price, you get a scent that may not stand out from the crowd, but can be worn for any occasion and always receives positive feedback, whether at work, during sports, or...

So the scent naturally reminds me of Creed Aventus or Club de Nuit, but I still find that it has something unique and stands out a bit from its clones. For me personally, it smells a bit more alcoholic at first and then develops into a synthetic kind of freshness, yet still fruity and light.

I personally smelled it for the first time at Douglas and I can still remember it well: I was really surprised because it somehow smells different from the conventional perfume that everyone has in mind.

For me, it's a really good, affordable perfume! The only thing that bothers me is the somewhat weak sillage and longevity. Of course, it's not extremely bad, but you do compare it with the scents from the top league ;)

First, let me clarify: the quality differences between Explorer and Aventus are huge, and therefore a comparison is actually quite difficult for me. You wouldn't compare a 911 with a Twingo just because they both can do the same thing, which is drive. Nevertheless, I kept comparing the two in my head and was a bit annoyed, I must be honest, because the scent at the spray...

Initially a bit citrusy, with wooden/leathery notes in the background. I like it for everyday use, you can wear it anytime. I expected it to be stronger, but I was surprised when I put it on that it comes across rather softly, hence many sprays are needed. Unlike the well-known and similar CDNIM, it is not as strong/overbearing as the latter. It is also known to be a double of Aventus; to that, I can say: Yes, it is definitely inspired by it, but I would consider Explorer more of a designer Aventus than a 1 to 1 copy. Which is not a bad thing. Explorer does what it’s supposed to do, an affordable designer for any occasion and any season. It doesn’t blow you away, but it doesn’t disappoint either.

Now that I am at a certain age, but of course still peppy and interesting and by no means boring and stale ;) I am currently reorienting myself and trying out new fragrances.

When I held my wrist under my wife's nose again today, she initially said, "Do you have something new on again?!" Then after a quick sniff: "Oh, that's good!"

That was also my spontaneous thought. At first, I smelled leather and spices - good for an older and experienced man - but then some slightly citrus notes came in, which lightened things up and made it more vibrant.

After 7 hours, I can still perceive the fragrance very well on my wrist. Perfect for today's autumn day, but surely also wearable in the warm season, perhaps for a barbecue evening with friends or while enjoying red wine and a cigar on the terrace.

review_title: Super all-rounder even without the big A
review_content:
When I first smelled the fragrance, I was immediately taken by its freshness. It is the perfect blend of sporty, elegant, and business. In direct comparison to Aventus, it is much less smoky, which makes it, in my opinion, significantly more pleasant and likable. I also find the longevity to be very good, as with Aventus, only the smoke remains at the end of the day. Clone, dupe, or reinterpretation, however you want to call it, the Explorer is (almost) perfect, which is also reflected in its high-quality bottle.

You can get 100ml online for under €50, which makes it a real no-brainer for me.

What a scent! The most beautiful bergamot I have ever smelled in a top note and in general... What a top note! In my opinion, this is also the absolute strength of this fragrance. I could spray it on myself constantly!
And unfortunately, you have to. The longevity and sillage of Explorer are unfortunately below average. I understand this with a citrus scent and am sure that the perfumers have done a lot to improve the longevity (Ambroxan). But unfortunately, the scent on me is just a skin scent after half an hour and hardly perceptible after 3-4 hours. Such a shame for such a scent experience.
In the heart note, woods and an aquatic note come into play, with the woodiness further intensifying in the base note.

My dream would be: Montblanc Explorer with the longevity of an oud fragrance. Then I would be in heaven!

review_title: Not a Clone but an Alternative
review_content:
Montblanc Explorer, a highly hyped fragrance. It has been marketed by many influencers as an Aventus clone. And yes, the scent does have similarities to Aventus. However, if you are looking for a 1:1 clone, you should go for Club de Nuit Intense.

I see the Explorer more as an alternative rather than a clone. The bergamot is particularly prominent in the opening, and in the drydown, we have a lovely citrus-woody combination. A fresh scent that, for me, is simply a top all-rounder.

Sillage and longevity are good, comparable to that of Aventus, although it even surpasses the newer Aventus batches in terms of sillage and longevity. With a price of 40 to 50 euros for 100ml, it comes highly recommended.

First of all, it's clear that the scent is a definite Aventus clone, but I find it a bit more bitter and woody. Aventus, on the other hand, is noticeably creamier and fruitier, which doesn't mean that I think Aventus is significantly better. I like both scents very much, but since Explorer is significantly cheaper, I would always prefer this one; however, Aventus lasted a bit longer on me. H + S are definitely solid and are absolutely sufficient for a day in the office, which is mostly how I use it. You can't go wrong with this scent regardless of the season and situation.

Absolutely recommended!

I recently got this fragrance, I would say it resembles my Aventus by 85%. An absolutely great alternative. But people who want more power/oomph, for example, from the pineapple and general fruity fresh magic, can unfortunately only get that from the OG Aventus. The Explorer is rather a calmer, quieter version of Aventus. Maybe this is preferred by some, as the Aventus...

....Or how a fragrance concept becomes a rider. One might think that a novelty that started in 2010 with "Aventus" has triggered a great wave of similar scents, just as was the case with Coty's "Chypre," Guerlain's "Shalimar," or Chanel's "N° 5."
Only today, there are many more "competitors" in the fragrance industry, and the market share of an individual scent from a company in the "segment" is becoming ever smaller.
Now there are very affordable "alternatives" to the original that can certainly hold their own. Mid-priced ones, like this one, which still lacks some elements to come close. Finally, the high-priced ones, which vary greatly.
The "original" is a benchmark that is (almost) reached or not. Many fall short, some establish themselves, remain for a while, but eventually disappear again. Only a few "winners" remain who can assert themselves permanently.
Whether the "Explorer" can achieve this remains to be seen. It follows the motto: "A good horse doesn't jump higher than it has to."
But whether the rider stays in the saddle is yet to be determined.
As a fresh-fruity-citrusy and slightly herbaceous-smoky-woody scent, the "Explorer" can indeed be a good representative. Those who know the "original" will likely be inclined to compare.
I try not to do that, but rather focus on the "Montblanc" as a "neutral" representative of its kind.
What strikes me here is the immediate presence of the "fruity-fresh" scents, which can be recognized long beyond the "top note." The scent itself acts like a subtle, fine mist hovering above everything else. Fresh, moist, and cool.
Bright, fine smoky notes accompany it, laying like dew over grass (vetiver) and bitter woods. Embedded in a slightly earthy aroma that provides the entire fragrance structure with a solid foundation that goes deep but does not drill in, bite down, or get stuck. A kind of "airy lightness" gives the composition enough room to avoid drifting into heaviness. The initially slightly "synthetic" appearance of the fragrance quickly dissipates, so it does not "bother" further, as it shifts more and more towards a natural character over time.
It does not lack in endurance, as the longevity is about 7 hours, placing it in the upper middle range. As for the projection (sillage), I would describe it as "strongly subtle," the "right" measure of being well perceivable without being overwhelming. Enough time to locate the "scent source" and track it well. A pleasant "Aha effect" that does not disappear immediately....
Here, "the rider stays on the horse" until the course ends and he can safely dismount :-))

review_title: The Affordable Aventus for Everyday Use I Top DNA and Price-Performance Ratio!
review_content: Explorer is often my "holiday scent" and there are several reasons for that. It’s affordable, has a great scent DNA, and if you happen to leave a bottle behind on vacation, the world won’t end. At the same time, you simply smell good and can easily overspray without bothering those around you. Now, let's talk about the scent, Explorer: - The...

So as a perfume newbie, I had often heard about Creed's Aventus. However, the price was always way too high for a fragrance for me, so I never really looked into it.

My uncle works at Chanel and managed to get me some samples. YSL Y, Tom Ford Black Orchid, Prada Ocean, etc. were included. And then I saw a bottle with the name "Montblanc - Explorer"... Never heard of it, seen it, or smelled it. So I tried it - and was thrilled!

I didn't know that Explorer is considered an Aventus dupe, as I hadn't smelled Aventus at that time. So my mindset was completely vanilla, and I made no comparisons. The opening blew me away; I couldn't stop smelling my hand. Fresh, fruity, and positive. The dry-down remained similar but became more subtle. Well, then I informed myself about the fragrance and inevitably came across Aventus. Countless comparisons about what is better, worse, cheaper, more expensive, blah blah blah.

Then, out of the blue, I received an offer for Aventus (even with an inscription, wowow!), and since I read that it shares a very similar top note with Explorer, I did something that some might stone me for: I blind-bought Aventus.

In this price range as a newbie, it really wasn't smart and could have backfired; it didn't. I find the top note even better, and the smoke in the dry-down is successful for me. But enough about Aventus.

I own a 60ml bottle of Explorer, as it works for me as the "Daily Aventus" - mostly for university. Through Explorer, I actually got into the niche game, and it plays a significant role in my fascination for niche fragrances now. So I am really grateful to Explorer to some extent.

Thanks for reading, and thanks to my uncle for the sample :)

(Oh, and Absolu Aventus has already made it to my display case - I freak)

When applying "Explorer | Montblanc," I immediately thought of one of my absolute favorite fragrances: "Aventus | Creed." The Explorer is a bit more synthetic, doesn't come across as quite as luxurious, but in the end, it is still a fabulous scent and very affordable. The longevity on my skin is a solid 6 to 8 hours, but it becomes quite close to the skin after about 4 hours. The sillage is still very impressive at the beginning, and I received several compliments for it.

The top note smells beautifully refreshing with lemon, bergamot, blackcurrants, green apples, and a subtle peppery touch. There is a certain synthetic quality present as well. In the heart note, I detect pineapple, leather, and a fine smokiness. In the base, I catch whiffs of birch water, ambroxan, and an indefinable woodiness.

I find the original or the clones from Armaf to be overall more elegant and beautiful, but Explorer is still a wonderful summer fragrance. I thank Manuel for the sample.

Montblanc Explorer... The fragrance was recommended to me a while ago, but I never really had any interest in it. One day, while helping a woman at a Douglas store to arrange a few bottles, she gave me 2 perfume testers as a thank you. Jpg le Male le Parfum and Montblanc Explorer. I then tested it a few times and realized that it simply fits into every conceivable life situation. Whether in summer at 30° or in winter at -degrees, it fits everywhere. It is also very masculine and serious, which makes it suitable for wearing at work as well.

Conclusion: Wonderful allrounder fragrance for work and life. Full recommendation from me at this point. Feel free to write me a situation where it doesn't fit, I'm waiting...

Montblanc has created a super pleasant and uncomplicated everyday fragrance with this scent, which is well-received everywhere and always easy to wear.
Its fresh citrus opening gives the wearer a nice freshness kick and initially reminds one of (Versace pour Homme), but then quickly shifts into a woody direction and, with a strong Ambroxan note, adds a slight sweetness and depth to the whole.
In the drydown, the fragrance slightly leaves the famous Aventus vibe and has solid longevity and sillage; nothing special, but for the price of about 35 per 100ml, it's quite acceptable.

Fun fact:
I was recently asked by a stranger if I was wearing Aventus, even though it was Explorer.
Apparently, the scents in the air do smell somewhat similar; otherwise, I can't explain the situation.

Conclusion:
Great fragrance at an affordable price that promises compliments and is wearable for any occasion.
Longevity: 7 hrs.
Sillage: 2 hrs. well noticeable, then subtle.

Recently, I had the pleasure of experiencing the essence of summer adventures in bottled form: Mont Blanc - Explorer. It was like wandering through a vibrant landscape, where each breath revealed a new, exciting chapter.

The opening is like the first morning ray hitting an untouched landscape. Fresh and invigorating, it brings a hint of optimism and boundless freedom. It feels like the beginning of an adventurous day under the dazzling sun.

Then comes the gentle warmth of the midday sun, reminiscent of a soft sea breeze with a deep yet uplifting melody. It is in these moments that the fragrance truly shines and fulfills its promise of an unforgettable journey.

But like the most beautiful summer evening, this scent also carries a melancholy that cannot be ignored. As quickly as it arrives, it also fades away. Its transient presence is like a sunset that briefly bathes the sky in vibrant colors before yielding to darkness. It is a sweet yet heart-wrenching tragedy that leaves one with a longing for more.

Mont Blanc - Explorer is a perfume that captures the joy and adventure of summer, while simultaneously reminding us of the transience of all beautiful things. It is a true delight for the senses, a scent that takes you on a journey, only to bring you back to the ground of reality too quickly. It is this bittersweet dichotomy that makes it so unique and unforgettable.

When I first applied the fragrance in the perfumery, I didn't notice any difference from the significantly more expensive "brother." However, when I had a sample at home, I had a different opinion. The opening surprised me with a nearly piercing citrus note. Later in the drydown, the similarity to Aventus becomes quite apparent. For me, though, it is not an alternative, as the citrus note remains too prominent and even reminds me a bit of toilet cleaner. Aside from that, the pineapple note is missing. Taken on its own, however, it is a quite wearable and pleasant fragrance for the warm days of the year and, given the noticeable similarity to Aventus, very affordable. Moreover, the bottle is quite good for the price.

Due to the predicted similarity to Aventus, I got Mont Blanc Explorer some time ago to expand my collection. At first, I was a bit ambivalent about the scent. Upon the first spray, it hit me rather hard and had an indefinable composition of heavy fragrance notes. However, I was all the more surprised after a few moments of dry-down...wow! An elegant yet masculine scent that neither seeks unnecessary attention nor wants to fade into the background. A gentleman and a loyal companion for any occasion! I love wearing it in the office and appreciate the different layers of the fragrance. It consistently has a certain freshness and purity, but also knows how to emphasize masculinity and remain grounded. It has become one of my favorites, and I don't want to be without it!

At least at the beginning. Explorer starts off a bit less harsh, more citrusy, and overall has a rounder scent. But it also has a bit less edge. So it’s a matter of taste whether you prefer it smoother or sharper. For me, Aventus is too scratchy. However, over time Explorer also becomes harsher, and after about half an hour, it is...

review_title: Good and affordable all-rounder and the better Aventus for me
review_content: The scent is masculine and definitely has a somewhat adventurous note as advertised. How to define "adventurous" exactly, I can't say, it’s probably the woody base notes that give me that impression. When you spray it for the first time, the bergamot is clearly noticeable and feels very refreshing. However, it quickly develops into a more earthy and spicy scent. The leather...

After several aquatic-citrus fragrances, I craved some variety. By chance, I stumbled upon Montblanc's Explorer - a perfume that some dismiss as an Aventus dupe, while others celebrate it as an exceedingly successful insider tip. Ultimately, the consistently positive reviews convinced me enough to order the perfume blindly from Flaconi.

Both the packaging and the bottle are adorned with a black, leather-like relief, which gives the scent a very masculine design right from the start. The cap is held on the sprayer by a magnet, which is also of very high quality, and the spray bursts are strong.

To test it, I treated myself to a few sprays on my neck. At first, the projection is very strong, and the scent notes unfold intensely. Right after application, a spicy-citrus cloud of pine needles and bergamot fills the air. It immediately reminded me of a walk through a pine forest during our family vacation in Crete. A Mediterranean needle forest - that’s how one could summarize the scent overall.

As it develops, the scent "calms down" and moves in a slightly leatherier/woodier direction. Nevertheless, a hint of the initial spiciness remains until the end, forming the popular signature characteristic of this perfume. The sillage and longevity are okay for a fragrance in this price range; after about 2 hours, I can only perceive it close to the skin and have to overspray significantly for it to project properly.

Conclusion: Blind purchases are always risky, but in my case, the plunge into cold water was more than generously rewarded: Montblanc Explorer is a truly noble scent, whose spicy freshness makes a good impression both in a board meeting and on a Sunday walk through the woods. It is not as outrageously overpriced as its distant relative Aventus, but offers a similar scent profile and an equally diverse, spicy freshness. I can recommend it almost without reservation!

The scent notes smell excellent.

The bergamot, pink pepper, and sage sound exciting and thrilling at the same time. Paired with the following leather and vetiver, it should actually be a fragrance just to my taste.

But far from it. Something, perhaps the ambroxan, truly bothers me about this scent.

To me, it smells fresh, citrusy. I love citrus scents. What I don’t like here is the distinctly synthetic aspect of this fragrance in my eyes.

In my opinion, a fresh summer scent should ideally not smell synthetic.

Then it unfortunately comes across as relatively "cheap" very quickly for me.

The scent is okay... no question. But absolutely overhyped, in my assessment/perception.

review_title: More than just a good Aventus clone - affordable, balanced, but weak in longevity/sillage
review_content:
It’s no longer a secret that Montblanc's Explorer is one of the best Aventus clones out there. It comes off spicier than its supposed predecessor and -clearly- has no fruity component, but it has that certain "roundness" that Aventus lacks in its fresh-citrusy (initial) phase. For this reason, it is more than just another Aventus knock-off for me; it’s an affordable daily fragrance with a dominant citrus-pepper DNA that is absolutely suitable for everyday wear and the office, and is truly likable.

Upon spraying, the dominant pepper and citrus fruit (here: bergamot, but it could have also been lemon due to its strength) greet you, paired with a hint of mint. The Ambroxan really kicks in, giving the sage and citrus even more "foreground."
Shortly after spraying, Explorer cools the skin nicely; even now, you know it will shine in the (high) summer like no other season.

After about 45-60 minutes, the mint fades away, and its main DNA crystallizes: a peppery citrus paired with (synthetic) patchouli.
What’s also noticeable: After just 1 hour, the longevity begins to decline. The drydown is very pleasant up to this point, but it brings forth few other notes.

After 1.5 hours, the pepper becomes more dominant. The ratio between the pepper and bergamot is now about 60:40. The vetiver grass finally has a chance to show itself. Already after 1.5 hours, I feel like we’ve reached the peak. Longevity and sillage have significantly decreased.

Half an hour later, after 2 hours, it’s time: we have reached the zenith. It won’t get any better from here. The citrus comes back a bit, and there’s a tie.

After 4 hours: It’s only barely detectable on the skin. There’s a bit of sillage left, but you really have to stand right next to me.
I think I can still smell a bit of wood... possibly cedarwood or something mossy?

Now, after 8 hours, the scent has nearly vanished. It has lasted through its workday and is ready to rest, or for the evening, it’s time for something else ;-)

----

Conclusion:
• Is it "Aventus-inspired"? - Yes.

• Should it be reduced to that? - Clearly: No!

• Does it smell exactly the same? - No. For the first 15-30 minutes, it has some resemblance, but after that, it completely lacks the fruitiness.

• Can you still buy it? Absolutely (!) You don’t have to hide or hesitate to go out with it. It’s simply too good, and the best part: you can wear it (primarily in summer) at any time of day or night and you can’t go wrong.

Points are deducted for the -at least on my skin- weak longevity and sillage, as well as the unspectacular (but by no means bad) drydown.
I smell 0 cocoa and the leather is a very light, inconspicuous note, introduced only in homeopathic amounts.

The 100ml bottle of Explorer is already available for around €50 (as of 05.02.2025) -- it’s worth every penny.

Ciao ;-)

I bought this fragrance long before the Creed Aventus alternatives hype.

I immediately liked this citrusy, woody combination with a sharp and leathery touch and then ordered a bottle.

At the beginning, you get a very strong fresh lemon that, in my opinion, does not come across as harsh or chemical but rather very balanced.

Later on, the fragrance becomes more spicy/green for my taste.

I wore this perfume as my daily scent for a while, and I received constant positive feedback from colleagues and clients.

A well-rounded fragrance that simply always fits!

Sillage and longevity are good. It lasts me 6-7 hours of good performance, after which I need to refresh.

Mont Blanc Explorer is noticeable for its fresh, warm, and spicy notes, which, after drying, take on a distinctly woody, heavy direction. This makes the fragrance truly pleasant and accessible. Explorer as an Aventus clone? In my opinion, the familiar notes of Aventus are felt in the first 30-45 minutes; however, these are underscored by woody and earthy notes, which allows...

I have a 2022 batch of Aventus by Creed and was quite disappointed. A crazy price is being asked for such poor performance, at least in the current batch. So I looked for alternatives since I actually liked the scent or the DNA of the scent. A colleague recommended Montblanc Explorer as an alternative, which I ordered shortly after. What can I say, the scent is very...

review_title: The Most Popular Scent in My Collection
review_content:
The most popular scent (among my peers) in my collection!
Clone or not - there are compliments!
Masculine, fresh, and yet distinctive!
For everyday wear, aside from the outstanding price-performance ratio, it's more than just a hit..!

review_title: Fresh Allrounder 24 Hours 365 Days a Year :)
review_content:
Hello everyone,
today I would like to say a few words about the MBE.

I always find it interesting how a perfume lover discovers a scent. In 2020-2021 (I can't remember the exact year ;) ) I attended a training session one evening. A colleague entered the room and sat down. Behind him, someone created a super pleasant, well-scented cloud. Immediately, I became curious, and during a break, I asked the colleague what fragrance he was wearing. It was Montblanc Explorer.
Here, I find it very exciting to have smelled a fragrance without knowing exactly what it was. In 2020, I wasn't as deep into the perfume bubble as I am now.

Well, now that you know where I know this scent from, let's talk about the fragrance itself. It is very fresh, citrusy, woody, and also spicy. I was immediately taken with it. I don't find the perfume synthetic as some here claim. The Montblanc can be worn regardless of the season or occasion. However, I think the wearer should be wearing a shirt or at least a polo, as I find the MBE more suitable for high-quality outfits. In my opinion, this scent is not for teenagers. The person should be over 25. The longevity is okay for such a universal and affordable fragrance. It lasts about 6 hours, and in the first 3 hours, it is also quite noticeable. However, I myself don't perceive the scent as strongly after a while. Since this is very important to me and I don't want to keep reapplying the fragrance, this is the only downside I found.

Regarding compliments, I can say that my girlfriend and actually everyone likes this scent. You can't go wrong with it. However, many have already rocked this perfume. A colleague told me, "Wow, not that one, my buddy has worn it every day for the last few months." So you are not particularly unique with it. In my opinion, you don't have to be, as this Montblanc really smells great.

Conclusion:
A price-performance hit (40 € max. 50 € per 100 ml) for a great all-rounder that you can't go wrong with and that really fits all occasions. Unfortunately, the longevity is too weak for me, which is why I have sold this fragrance again. Niche fragrances can spoil you ^^ hehe.

Thank you for your attention and for reading.

The Mont Blanc Explorer is a very fresh perfume, in which, in my opinion, the bergamot stands out the most.

It is known for its Creed Aventus-like DNA. This classic, highly popular DNA can definitely be found in the fragrance.

Additionally, the Mont Blanc Explorer is comparatively very affordable.

Only its sillage and longevity leave something to be desired. However, this problem can at least be partially countered with a few more sprays. Otherwise, the scent unfortunately lasts no more than 1-2 hours on my skin.

In summary, the Mont Blanc Explorer is a very nice, fresh scent that comes very close to the Aventus DNA. Only the sillage and longevity can be criticized. However, considering the price, this is completely acceptable.

A citrusy sharp opening followed by sage in the base and then smoky wood.
Longevity is okay. Sillage is strong at first, then becomes more intimate!
The fragrance has little development and quickly becomes boring. However, it can be worn for any occasion.
For me, it's just a modern office scent, nothing more.

Yes, this fragrance has a bit of Aventus vibes in my opinion, even though it starts quite citrusy; however, it lacks the smokiness, which makes it perfect for the office in my view… this scent is well-received, and I often get compliments when I wear it. The longevity is quite okay for me, even if I can no longer smell it, it is still often perceived well.
For the price, I find it worth buying if you are not willing to spend money on the more expensive alternatives.

When I first wore the fragrance, I wasn't so sure,
I really had to warm up to it.
But the more often I wore it, the more it became one of my favorites.

The citrus notes with the bitter/sweet undertone are simply amazing.
Especially, I can imagine this scent in the height of summer but just as well in autumn :-)
It definitely brings compliments :-)
The sillage and longevity are also not to be underestimated; I've already convinced two people to buy it within the first few weeks.

If I had to associate the fragrance with a situation, I imagine myself sitting on a quad with my partner, exploring an island like Mallorca with all its beautiful facets, here a lemon tree, there a small mountain range, or just standing on a cliff and gazing at the vast sea. The senses are definitely filled with impressions, and the blend is simply perfect.

One should note that this type of fragrance is quite mainstream, but I can completely overlook that, and it has definitely become a love at first sight for me.

review_title: Teen Spirit with Depth or Life-Wise Freshness
review_content:
From gift to staple:
I didn’t discover the Explorer myself; instead, my father gifted it to me a few years ago for my 18th birthday. After I had already developed a small passion for fragrances and diligently tested new designer perfumes in drugstores, the Explorer opened a door to an unknown fragrance category for me. I only knew aquatic-fresh or spicy-warm-sweet.

The Mont-Blanc Explorer surprised me right from the first spray with a new combination, a kind of fresh spiciness that is nonetheless carried by a sweet lightness. What was this light tingling in my nose, this certain fiery quality that the scent brought with it? After several years of further fragrance experience, I can clearly attribute this feeling to the pink pepper. I am still fascinated by how distinctly I can identify pink pepper notes in fragrances through this tingling sensation, and I love it! It conveys purity and cleanliness, especially in the top note.

For me, the Explorer has been my go-to scent for YEARS and several bottles. In my opinion, it is the ultimate all-rounder for the lukewarm to hot days of the year; there is nothing better than applying the Explorer after a fresh shower and stepping out of the house, knowing that you are surrounded by this wonderful tingling aura (one cannot escape a compliment or two during this phase).

As it develops, the scent becomes a bit softer and more delicate when the leather and vetiver notes come into play. Overall, it is quite subtle. For me, the fresh, sweet spiciness only becomes more beautiful and rounded over time. It’s almost as if the scent merges with the skin, and one feels absolutely untouchable.

But not only in everyday use is the scent a staple; in my opinion, it can also be worn by almost any age group. For me, the scent represented the beginning of adulthood back then. I think everyone remembers well the phase when one began to take oneself a bit more seriously than one actually was. Suddenly, one started to think about whether one actually appeared more mature on the outside.
The Explorer embodies this developmental phase for me; it conveys a youthful lightness, a fresh creativity, all perfectly wrapped in a certain order and structure as well as maturity. I can’t quite say whether the Explorer gives the necessary maturity to the teen spirit or rather adds a bit of freshness to established wisdom.

One thing is clear: the Explorer flatters its wearer with a touch of elegance and strength - one feels at home in oneself and radiates self-confidence that arises from within. For me, it is the constant companion I no longer want to miss.

A very pleasant hint of fresh sage and semi-sweet, sharp citrus fruits upon the first spray, and it’s done very well. The Ambrox is clearly present, but not as overpowering as in Sauvage and other ambrox-heavy fragrances. It simply plays its role like a steady bass that holds everything together. Vetiver and leather are listed as notes, but they do not stand out individually...

At first, I mainly perceive a woody note, but I also notice a woody note in the background. This woody note becomes more prominent over time. In my opinion, the perfume can be worn well for any occasion and any season, but for me, it is most definitely a fragrance for everyday use, especially in spring. The longevity on my skin is very good; however, I feel that the scent quickly becomes detectable only in close proximity to the skin.

During my first test as a beginner with Aventus, I was really impressed. I didn't know many fragrances yet, but I understood the hype early on. The more I delved into Creed, the more I noticed that this scent is worn quite often. Nevertheless, I liked it, and the search for dupes began. This led me to Explorer, which smells very similar but costs only a fraction of the...

... no, it is not. Yes, this scent leans towards Aventus. However, it is not a true dupe of that fragrance. It has an independent character.

Upon application, the citrusy bergamot with pepper and sage first hits the nose. It gains a dry quality from the vetiver and a daring aspect from the leather note. Later, a woody element from Akigalawood follows, and the patchouli makes this scent even drier and darkens it a bit. The cocoa makes this perfume a little daring. It is very masculine here.

The longevity and sillage on my skin are very good, about 10 hours.

It is a nice alternative to Aventus but not a real dupe; this perfume is too independent for that. This scent can be worn by any man, regardless of age. It is also suitable for any occasion.

Those who enjoy a fresh citrusy scent with a certain woody accord will not go wrong here.

Montblanc Explorer starts off very citrusy with a pineapple note.
The citrus notes gradually fade away, and the scent gets closer to Aventus.
It develops into a woody fresh fragrance.
However, there is a major problem: the longevity.
It's a great scent, but you can't perceive it after 3 hours.
To answer the question in the title: No, due to the lack of longevity, for me, Club de Nuit Intense is a bit better.
Still, it's a great fragrance for little money.

I find the citrus opening a bit piercing, but I'm not a fan of citrus in many fragrances. Unfortunately, I don't pick up on the leather at all, and the heart note could actually be omitted. It is skipped over directly. The scent starts citrusy and somewhat reminds me of pineapple, but then it quickly jumps to a typically masculine smell. It reminds me of a 40-year-old family man who is an office worker or teacher. I strongly smell the Ambroxan, and like with the leather, patchouli and cocoa in the base note somehow seem to be missing, making the fragrance smell purely synthetic.

I understand the comparison to "Aventus | Creed." However, for me, it is so dull and yawningly boring that the fragrance can only be suitable for the office or as an everyday scent, and there are many better fragrances for such occasions. For me, the fragrance would be completely irrelevant without the cheap price, unless I want to smell like everyone else running into Douglas and buying the first scent suggested by the staff.

review_title: Smoky, Citrusy - as a Creed Aventus Alternative
review_content:
Right from the first spray, the scent reminds one of another fragrance that gives you a stomach ache when you look at the price. The reference here is, of course, Creed Aventus. Those who have been searching for an alternative might have found it now.

The top note starts with Italian bergamot, pepper, and sage. Fresh with a slight spiciness and softness. In the top note, we then encounter vetiver and leather.

In the base, warmth is created through cocoa and Indonesian patchouli, which also defines the fragrance.

I must say that the scent performs better compared to the more expensive one. If you like this fragrance or Creed Aventus, you should definitely try Club de Nuit.

I think it even comes closer to Aventus. However, every nose has to sniff it out for themselves, as all three smell quite similar.

Here is my assessment of this fragrance.

First of all, I find Explorer by Montblanc to be a very good and affordable alternative to Creed Aventus.

Bottle:

The bottle is very simple and beautifully designed. There's not much more to say about it.

Scent:

The scent is a clone of Creed Aventus, even though the pineapple is missing from the notes. You can really smell the bergamot and pepper in the opening. The sage nicely rounds off the top notes. In the heart notes, the vetiver and leather come through well. In the base during the dry down, the ambroxan comes out very strongly along with the patchouli. (The ambroxan is very pleasant and also good because it lasts longer, see also Dior Sauvage.)

Longevity:

The fragrance is in the medium range; it lasts a good 8 hours. It is well perceivable even if you become olfactorily blind at some point, but for others, it still smells good for a long time. On the skin, it comes across well, and on clothes, it lasts almost an entire day.

Price:

The price is really good here. The price/performance ratio fits as a cheaper Creed Aventus alternative. The Aventus is way too expensive and not really good anymore in terms of longevity and performance. (Since the sale of the brand, it has unfortunately become rapidly worse in my opinion.)

You can't go wrong here; it's a good fresh citrus alternative.

Best regards and have a nice day, everyone.

Patrick

review_title: Average at First, Convincing in the Dry-Down
review_content:
Explorer by Mont Blanc was my entry into the world of perfumes. A scent that I still enjoy using today. At the first spray, it seems a bit too fruity and synthetic to me, but as soon as it transitions into the dry-down, it unfolds its full potential: warm, distinctive, and inviting. Especially when you sniff the clothing the next day. (In the dry-down, one of my top fragrances). That’s when the blend of citrus freshness, spicy pepper, and a warm woody base comes into play.
This very blend gives the fragrance a distinctive, masculine aura without being overwhelming. The sillage is noticeable but pleasant, making it a true compliment magnet.
All in all, a modern, versatile scent that I enjoy wearing again and again despite the slightly synthetic opening. Without this note, Explorer would be nearly perfect for me.

Incredibly beautiful scent that made me want to engage more with perfumes. I bought it because I heard it was a candidate for a blind buy, and it certainly was. I get the most compliments with this one, alongside Jazz Club, because it radiates so well and even lasts after 2 hours of sports. Super fresh and woody at the beginning but also pleasant and warm in the dry-down, where the cocoa comes through nicely. I can't compare it to Aventus, which it's supposed to be similar to, but I would also like to try that one if it goes in the same (more expensive) direction.

A perfect scent for the general public.
Wearable for any occasion and a good everyday fragrance.
Anyone who likes Aventus Creed will definitely like this one too!
Unfortunately, the longevity and sillage are not outstanding.
I find the 30 ml bottle beautiful and I’m happy to have it in my collection.

At first, it’s nicely citrusy, and over time the lovely woody notes come through.
Aside from the longevity and sillage, the price-performance ratio is good.
The fragrance is recommended for everyday use, and you can’t go wrong with it!

Montblanc Explorer starts off citrusy fresh, underlined by green notes. I find the scent extremely well-balanced between citrus, green, and spicy notes. Not too much or too little of anything. You get exactly what it says on the label, although one must say that the composition is nothing extraordinary. Nevertheless, one should enjoy the interplay of citrus and spicy notes.

review_title: A summer scent for every day?
review_content: To begin with, I will not draw comparisons to "Aventus | Creed," but will judge Explorer as a perfume on its own. Italian bergamot, sage, Indonesian patchouli... how good this combination sounds. But after the first spray, the initial impression is only: synthetic. Not that this has to be something bad, but in this case, it bothers me quite a bit at the...

For me, a very successful fragrance, especially in this price category. I have already gifted it to friends a few times, as it is personally a scent that you can't go wrong with. And then this price... Really 1A!! The scent is very fresh, mixed with a hint of something "herber." For me, it actually performs above average on H/S. After 2 hours of intense sports, I could still perceive it well. This is not the case for many stronger fragrances I have. Despite all the praise, I do have two small points of criticism: On one hand, the bottle, which unfortunately does not appeal to me personally. Sure, the fragrance is really not expensive, but still, the bottle is very boring, and I’m not particularly fond of the black "coat." Secondly, the scent is very linear. This is not particularly bad (I think no one expects such a fragrance to develop significantly).
Overall, a really successful fragrance. Chapeau Montblanc!!

If you like Creed Aventus/ CDNIM, you might also enjoy Montblanc Explorer.

Upon spraying, you are greeted with beautiful fresh citrus notes, and it retains this quality until the end. A fragrance that is perfect for work or for summer. Longevity and sillage are average, but nothing more is expected from it.

I wouldn't consider it a clone of Aventus, as it lacks the smoky notes. However, it is a very good alternative for someone looking for a fresh-citrus scent without wanting to spend much.

review_title: Top Allrounder and Alternative to Creed Aventus
review_content:
What can I say: Simply a top all-rounder scent, works always and everywhere and receives many compliments.

Price-performance ratio is excellent. Longevity is solid. Sillage is good.

It just smells clean and super fresh, fruity, slightly woody, and slightly aquatic, especially citrusy. In my opinion, overall very masculine.

Moreover, especially considering the price, it is a great alternative to Creed Aventus, which I believe is much more worthwhile.

If you're looking for a fragrance that has a woody scent but still brings a freshness, Montblanc Explorer is just right. Personally, I love this scent for everyday wear. It simply smells fresh, elegant, and clean. It gives you a good sense of confidence. In my opinion, you can't really overspray this fragrance depending on the occasion. In school, I would recommend 3-5 sprays since the scent isn't too strong but is still noticeable. I've always received good feedback because it's a fragrance that simply smells classic, nothing extravagant, which means you won't annoy anyone. There will always be people who don't like the scent, but I think you'll get 90% positive feedback; strangely enough, this is the fragrance that has received the most compliments for me. So if you're looking for an affordable everyday scent that delivers, you're in the right place!

This fragrance combines summery pineapple with fresh citrus and a pleasant woody note. It bears some resemblance to Club de Nuit Intense Man or Creed Aventus.
Explorer is a price-performance killer.
Unfortunately, the longevity is not outstanding, about 5 hours on me, after which it is only perceptible up close. The sillage is good.

An unobtrusive and fresh scent, perfectly suitable for everyday wear or sports.
This fragrance offers incredibly much for the price, which can only be said of very few. I would buy it again and again; unfortunately, in my opinion, it receives far too little attention.

My first short review here:

I don't know Aventus, but the scent that a very professional fragrance seller at Galeria Kaufhof offered me as a last resort was impressive: Mont Blanc Explorer.

I was looking for something leathery that could compete with Tom Ford Ombre Leather, but was less overpowering and much more jovial. Something for the office as well as for the couch at home.

The fascination with this fragrance lies in the top note, fantastic, and the heart note is also noteworthy, but the base is rather mediocre. The longevity is, in my opinion, not to be overestimated; it fades away. I don’t mind, though, because I treated myself to the 200ml for €70. I find it incomprehensible why this fragrance, especially if it is supposed to be a clone of Aventus Creed, is so inexpensive.

Maybe it’s because Mont Blanc is seen as stuffy and reminds one of ballpoint pens and very expensive paper; Mont Blanc thus represents more of a notary vibe than sexiness, fair enough.

In many YouTube reviews, the fragrance is often rejected by women, perhaps too musty and lacking sweetness and not aquatic at all. So so...

Anyone trying to impress women with this scent is digging their own grave. However, since I want the fragrance for myself and it is well-received by men, and I am heterosexual, it is not a no-go for me.

Lastly, I want to emphasize that the name does justice to the fragrance. It feels like a universal scent that is accepted in all corners of the world.

Montblanc Explorer is a super fresh citrusy yet slightly fruity fragrance. A great allrounder for any occasion and every season. Very masculine scent that often gets compliments. Sillage and longevity are also absolutely satisfactory. Personally, I prefer to wear it in spring and summer. For the price, an absolute 10/10.

review_title: A Remarkable Interpretation of an Icon
review_content:
At first sniff, one might think they have sprayed on Aventus. However, upon closer inspection, one notices subtle differences that reveal the clone.

The Explorer comes across as somewhat more aromatic and a bit less zesty. One could say it feels a bit smoother and more refined than its predecessor. This can be seen as a positive or a negative, depending on the occasion one is pursuing.

Additionally, it also resembles a typical cologne a bit more: Very Ambroxan-heavy and a good hint of Iso E Super (even though it's not listed) is noticeable. While this makes it quite fresh and aquatic, it also comes across as distinctly synthetic at the same time.

What stands out as well is the bergamot, which has a slightly higher dominance compared to Aventus. In that fragrance, the pineapple is more in focus.

All in all, it feels like a designer-appropriate version of Aventus, with an emphasis on light aromatics, paired with a fine-synthetic freshness. Certainly a good and affordable alternative, where one doesn't need to feel guilty about spraying it for a lesser occasion.

H/S is definitely good for its category and price range. One should just be clear that they are not getting a 1:1 copy of Aventus, but rather an Aventus-like cologne.

My purchase was more or less based on a "blind buy" or a purchase based on trust. And I must say, I am very satisfied with this purchase. It is citrusy and well-suited for the office. In my eyes, anyone can wear it. Whether old or young. The price-performance ratio is really good, although the longevity/sillage could be better for me. All in all, a good scent that can be...

review_title: Affordable Aventus in a Beautiful Outfit
review_content:
Of course, there was a well-known model as inspiration here, that cannot be denied. However, I will still try to evaluate it on its own merits.

It starts with a lot of lemon and then becomes increasingly woody, unfortunately a bit too much wood for my taste, so it slightly veers into bitterness. Otherwise, it's quite one-dimensional, well composed and balanced, but nothing special or outstanding, just a good fragrance and nothing more.
Explorer honestly sounds like more to me; it could also be a good shower gel.

The price/performance ratio is of course excellent, and one is nitpicking at a high level here.

Wearable in almost any situation and a people pleaser, if you're looking for a balanced, affordable scent that smells more expensive than it is, then it's definitely a good choice.

The bottle is also very heavy and feels high-quality, with one of the best designs in recent times, perfectly fitting the brand and looking nice on the shelf.

Anyone looking for an affordable Aventus should definitely give this a sniff; in my opinion, it doesn't fall short of its famous brother in any way, except for the price. But Aventus isn't for everyone; you have to like this mix of sweet and woody.

Still well done!

I was looking for a no-brainer scent that I could also wear at the gym. I found it: Explorer.
First, let's talk about longevity and sillage. If you're looking for a long-lasting, strongly projecting fragrance, this is not the one for you. For me, it serves its purpose perfectly, lasting about 3-4 hours and being noticeable, but then it fades away.
Another advantage: it doesn't create a scent cloud around you, but is very close to the skin. Perfect for the gym, you don't annoy others with a strong perfume smell, but you can still smell it on yourself enough.
