And this is meant positively: after 13 hours, I can still smell the fragrance well! Parfumo has long since automatically logged Femme Individuelle out in the column "Gaukeleya is wearing today ....", yet it is still there; my nose won't be led around by it.

Well. The surprise purchase (I ordered blindly once again) turned out to be a successful surprise. The calm, the warmth, the elegant sensuality, the astonishing depth, and the long-lasting nature make this scent a true unexpected win for me.

Michelangela has described this fragrance very aptly, and I agree.

This scent is beautifully delicate, lightly powdery, fresh, slightly woody, elegant, floral, lightly spicy (pepper), and slightly fruity (currant)... and it reminds me of my favorite from Chopard: Brilliant Wish (a bit stronger).
With Femme Individuelle, you are well-equipped for any situation, and it contains everything I like. The delicate color in the fragrance also gives Femme Individuelle femininity and tenderness!
On cold days (ice, frost, and snow...), this beautiful scent would be too light for me!
It smells lovely and soapy on my skin: well-groomed!

L’Homme Exceptionnel by Montblanc is nothing exceptional, but it’s really nice in the less exciting meaning ever. It is basically a pedantic but perfectly enjoyable cedar-amber scent infused with a sweet-zesty orange head note, and some synthetic patchouli to give a hint of “dark class”. Nothing more and nothing less than you can imagine; it’s woody, aromatic, slightly sweet, warm and inoffensive, but crisp and discreet. Simple, inexpensive and effective like an Ikea table.

6/10

Smells wonderful from the opening to dry down.

Very masculine and classic chocolate/cofee smell, but aint sugary or extremely sweet.

However it's a skin scent, more suitable to a intimate occasion.

My only complaint is about the longevity thats weak in my skin, about 4 hours.

Updated January 2014

Am I an exceptional man? Should I even buy this fragrance? Does it suit me? Well, since I never really ask myself such questions, I just went for it. Homme Exceptionnel > Add to cart > Click …

Homme Exceptionnel was a blind purchase. This truly promising fragrance pyramid with many of my favorite accords and a rating of 82% at the time of purchase looked very promising and raised my expectations high. A beautifully designed bottle and a pleasant color scheme that radiated a touch of elegance and luxury did the final convincing work.

When the fragrance finally arrived, I of course had to test it right away. Well, at first I was speechless, but not out of joy, rather out of disappointment. The scent was bland and ordinary.

However, I must admit that the fragrance also poses challenges for me, as it confuses me. The fragrance pyramid had little informational value for me after the test, and upon further inspection, my forehead furrowed deeply. Not much fit together here.

Therefore, I looked up the notes on Montblanc's website, where Sichuan pepper, lavender, coffee, and patchouli are listed as the main ingredients. These largely align with my perception and thus make sense.

The opening lasts only a few seconds and is led by mandarin. In the top note, I smell artificial, floral fruitiness, which reminds me of one or another Avon fragrance. What is the olfactory equivalent of Déjà-vu? Déjà-senti? :))

Does this artificial, floral fruitiness come from the lavender? I've never smelled it like this before. It seems very distorted to me here and thus strange, almost unfamiliar. Shortly after, the pepper kicks in, leading and dominating the fragrance for a brief moment, but only for a very short time.

In my eyes, the fragrance is poorly composed and not harmoniously coordinated, as the lavender persists, but the other notes gradually fade away. I can hardly perceive the heart note at all; it seems to be simply skipped, as amber and patchouli already become noticeable. The dry down brings no further changes, and the fragrance gradually fades away. By the way, I cannot perceive coffee at all throughout the entire progression.

It is a rapid, short, and in my eyes very unspectacular progression. The longevity and sillage are also to be rated as very low or weak. Where would this come from if there is no heart note?

It leaves the impression of an Ordinary Man in a fine suit. The fraud isn't always recognizable at first glance, but his cheap scent gives him away nonetheless.

I am somewhat surprised by what my predecessor has written about this fragrance. Fortunately, everyone perceives scents differently, and that's a good thing so that everyone can form their own opinion.

In one aspect, I agree with Oloroso, albeit only partially; the coffee present in the top note is indeed there, but in my opinion, it is less intense and fades away after about 20 minutes. Here, the coffee could have been a bit more intense, but this does not negatively affect the fragrance progression.

As is often the case, citrus notes are found in the top note, here more like an unripe orange peel combined with a hint of coffee, as the amber takes the lead role, thus overshadowing the waning coffee. The interplay of amber and ginger, which comes across as less sharp here, accompanies the wearer for several hours (7-8) without being negative.

As I mentioned before, everyone has a different opinion, but I can report nothing bad. Sillage, longevity, and the fragrance itself are successful, even if the sillage is rather in the middle range; the other points score higher.

Recommendation: Those looking for something spicy and woody with intense amber should add this fragrance to their collection. Its strength lies in amber and ginger, and that’s when this MontBlanc becomes very sniffable.

I would have thought MontBlanc would have more men's perfumes by now and maybe Homme Exceptionnel would be a flanker of a regular Homme. But not at all, there is no simple MontBlanc Homme and aside from Presence Cool and Starwalker, I have now tested everything. From grand (Individuel) to underestimated (Presence) to a lame copy (Legend), everything is included. So today I offered the extraordinary Homme to my wrist - and unfortunately, it was quite disappointing. Almost no wonder, because a truly extraordinary man shouldn't have to show this in the title/name.

The scent is definitely woody and spicy, reminding me of a mix between Abyan PH and New Harleem. But despite the similarity to NH, there is only minimal coffee detectable in Exceptionnel. Rather, the lavender is similarly rough and twisted. This is perhaps the only good and special thing about this orange liquid. Then there is dry wood, also rough, and a fruity-cool sweetness. Maybe a mandarin-mint combo. But for me, it’s a woody scent, more for followers than for thinkers.

Bottle: here MontBlanc is actually clearly structured, smooth, matte, metallic, and clear. But the bottle also comes off as quite cheap and yawning.
Sillage: somewhere between skin and office scent.
Longevity: okay 7-8 hours.

Everything but extraordinary, despite the heavily woody and distorted lavender. One would rather look at the other MontBlanc men's perfumes, especially Individuel.

Another fantastic fragrance from Montblanc. I have owned the original Starwalker for quite some time, in fact it’s probably one of my best ever blind buys. I can say the Extreme is nothing like the original but I cant blame Montblanc for wanting to use such a stellar name like “Starwalker” for another one of their fragrances. Starwalker Extreme to me smells a lot like the original Coach for men with a tiny bit of Chanel’s Allure Homme Sport Eau Extreme in the background. I am not mad at it one bit, this is an extremely good fragrance in my opinion and the notes all blend together extremely well creating a slightly sweet fruity creamy fragrance. The performance is also fairly decent. I have a feeling the bottles that are left of this are slowly dwindling down and this one will be quite hard to find eventually. I am very happy to own it as well as a back up bottle.

Starwalker extreme is not like the original, but…..this could be a colder version for the cooler months of the year. It will also work fine for the summer too. For me I like this flanker much better than to OG. It also has decent sillage and last 6+ hours on my skin. Try b4 you buy but I have a love for this one and as you can see there is not much out there so you will be unique!

Tested today at the Montblanc boutique, I discovered through the Parfumo website that they recently opened a private collection.

Having seen few reviews of this collection on the site, I decided to be the community's guinea pig.

My first test is Star Oud, so nothing new; it's a warm, powdery, sweet, and incensed fragrance.

To put it simply, it's a similar result with less performance than Black Afgano, so it's classic and disappointing with the opening, which lasts a good three hours.

After that, the fragrance fades and has some facets of the discontinued Dior Mitzah.

Really interesting. The leather in the collection caught my olfactory attention the most.

I have seen this fragrance multiple times online; the bottle and brand caught my attention, but I never found it in the wild. I am generally a big fan of Montblanc and think the brand has potential.

After a trip, I finally found the fragrance in Duty Free. I immediately sprayed it on a test strip and was initially disappointed in the Duty Free cloud, as not much came through. However, to give the fragrance a second chance, I applied two sprays on my wrist, what a relief! On the skin, suddenly there was a mega sillage; I could only smell this fragrance. Yes, it is not overly complex, the oud is very pleasant, but overall it is an ultra-rounded scent and extremely well-suited even for less experienced noses.
After a 16-hour return trip, 2 showers, and countless hand washes, the fragrance, although faint, was still there! Even well over 18 hours+, the scent was still present. That was also the decisive point for me to place my order.

The fragrance itself is relatively generic, ambery, vanillic, oudy. Very pleasant, soft. A good choice for beginners or a high-quality, rather unexciting scent that should appeal to almost everyone. For me, however, it ranks very high in evaluation because it is simply a very, very rounded product.

product_name: Femme Individuelle Special Edition Soul & Senses
review_content: Fresh, fruity, a bit floral, creamy-powdery, pleasantly friendly without being too sweet, light sillage, suitable for any occasion, at the office or in leisure time, in summer or winter. I would classify it as more feminine, but I believe it can also be worn by men. It truly is a go-to fragrance, and I mean that as a compliment. I cannot understand the negative reviews here. It is good. And for those looking for something friendly and clean without smelling like laundry detergent, this is the right scent to find.

Amazing scent, but not so great performance.
Expected more from a Montblanc.

Still, great for quick dates or anything that won't take too long!
I'm loving it anyway : )

After being so overwhelmed yesterday by a women's fragrance from Montblanc, I had to try a men's perfume as well. Montblanc. I've heard of it, but never tried it. I do not regret it. The women's perfume was one of the best I've experienced, and I would also place this men's fragrance in the upper class, even though the scent is not too expensive.

I was briefly in the office today and brought both the men's and women's perfumes. The women's perfume I will gift, but I don't know to whom. It should definitely make me happy, and it's something special when a scent captivates me like that. So it has to be worn by someone who means a lot to me.

As for the men's scent, I can say one thing: it is neither arrogant nor too strong. It elegantly underscores masculinity without scratching with a three-day beard. It is not shrill, hard-hitting, or dominant - it is fluid, elegant, and truly good-natured in its character. The opening begins fresh. Mint - a good white wine with fresh mint, bubbling as if a volcano is about to erupt. It rushes through my thoughts, and the mint sways with ginger towards the climax. They harmonize perfectly with each other without overshadowing one another. The ginger scent is very unique. Slightly herbaceous, but very, very interesting and quirky. After the top note recedes a bit, a pleasant scent of young jasmine and unripe roses emerges. The floral scent is by no means sweet, but rather restrained and blends with the freshness of the mint. After the mint completely fades, the scent becomes heavier and more muted. The jasmine unfolds. The jasmine blossom is truly magnificent and intense. The scent feels mystical to me. As if one could see the unfolding of the blossom right in front of them when smelling at the wrist. Once the jasmine has unfolded, it is surrounded by woody scents that make everything appear a bit heavier, and the amber is a fantastic combination with the entire opening. It becomes muted and cool as the scent enters its final phase. A hint of mustiness can be detected, overshadowed by damp rose petals that are stirred by a smoky wind.

A skillfully crafted floral scent for men? Yes, it is! Not a sweet floral factory, but an opening of quality, from a dark but also a bright side. The jasmine is divine and presents itself justly. The fragrance pyramid is very successful. It is well coordinated.

The price is great, and the bottle has a beautiful color. Dark blue - exuberance, satisfaction, and inner peace. This dark blue brings to mind the ocean, the cool water - that makes my skin vibrate when I dive in. It takes my breath away because it is so cold. But inside I am warm, and I show determination.

I am deeply immersed in myself, surrounded by the scent - yes, it harmonizes with my inner self. It will have a very special place with me.

The scent is stylish and quirky. It has its own character and a unique floral personality. This time, it's also something for men.

The longevity is not particularly enormous, but I do not hesitate to reapply. You can really douse yourself with it. Sometimes more is truly good and not too much of a good thing. I like it :)

Gentlemen, dare to wear flowers; it doesn't always have to result in a floral bouquet when wearing a floral scent!

I suppose there is something wrong. Either it is my nose that has stopped working - or my Femme De Mont Blanc has stopped working. Before I met it.
I bought it second hand on the internet. First time I sprayed I had to check closely to my wrist. I sniffed several times but only a weak whiff of something sweet got to my nostrils. Second time I sprayed I succeded in getting the cinnamon note combined with a citric note that could be pineapple. The fragrance disappeared very quickly. This morning I decided to try again.
I sense the spices. Cinnamon and cardamom after the sour first impression has gone. I admit that I am not fan of pineapple but usually I love bergamot. With this scent I am relieved when the citric notes fade. The two spices work well together. Then comes the flowers, sweetening the scent, mixing with the spices. And the scent warms up and becomes the true FdMB. Suddenly I understand the intentions and I start to appreciate smelling it. Quite long lasting it takes a while to get to the base. Unfortunately for me, I do not get the chocolate note but I do get sweet raspberry, musk and patchouli. Amazing. And it comes in a lovely bottle, too.
Go meet FdMB - When I finally met her it was a good experience. I would like to meet her sister, Femme de Mont Blanc EdP.
Year 2, 37/365

Fate brought us together. In search of a new winter fragrance, I stumbled upon you. The first thing that caught my eye was your beautiful bottle, but the scent that emerged from it is unmatched. I've never smelled anything like it before. You are fresh and at the same time sweet. I can't quite place your fragrance pyramid, but I recognize vanilla and something resinous and woody.
Montblanc has created something unique with you, a warm, sensual, enveloping cuddle blanket, so sexy and seductive yet at the same time clean and elegant. These contrasts make you incredible; I can't get enough of you in my nose.

You will shine the most in the cool season, but unfortunately, your longevity is a bit weak for me; I don't smell you on me for very long. Still, I am already captivated by you.

You know how sometimes a fragrance has this incredible power to evoke vivid memories and transport you back to specific moments in your life? In a way it's like a time machine for the senses! Whenever I catch a whiff of Starwalker, it instantly brings back thoughts, feelings, and memories associated with my uncle & for this fragrance, I'm forever grateful.

review_title: Surprising everyday discovery - here's to an Individual Tonic!
review_content:
The first impression is distinctly alcoholic, but after a few moments,
a spicy, aromatic, herbal scent unfolds with a slight freshness that tingles mintily in the nose - well, if that isn't a tonic!

Both floral notes - perhaps most like a spicy geranium - and slightly fruity components occasionally peek through.
Initially subtle, something creamy like sandalwood, amber, and musk soon becomes noticeable. This creaminess gradually becomes more pronounced, without becoming sweet or heavy. As a result, the scent becomes a bit warmer, while the spicy-aromatic freshness remains, albeit diminishing over hours.
A hint of coconut lends the fragrance a slightly summery quality. However, it could also be suitable for other seasons, which still needs to be tested.

Even after 10 hours, the scent - apply sufficiently, as it is not overwhelming - is still distinctly perceptible close to the skin - a still fresh, almost clean scent in the direction of 'Your skin but better'.
A surprising, lasting, beautiful everyday discovery that seems to be discontinued, as the fragrance is unfortunately no longer found on Montblanc's website.

The wide yet thin bottle appears modern and elegant with a beautiful dark green glass.
The rather heavy cap features - as usual - the star-shaped Montblanc emblem, which is stylized to represent the summit of Mont Blanc with its six valleys.

I have to say that I really like the original Montblanc Individuel, but I find this one really good! At some point, I came across this one…. from the ingredient list, it’s not far from the original, and for about €22, it’s worth a blind buy. To get straight to the point, the blind buy was worth it, but it doesn’t resemble the original! I don’t pick up the raspberry note here. Without focusing on the ingredients, I smell a fresh, slightly green grapefruit/musk scent, with a hint of amber, maybe in the background a touch of coconut! For me, it’s definitely worth the purchase, and for the upcoming spring, it’s a light companion!

My first ever review. Here it goes!

This is quite a pleasant scent. Nothing ground-breaking or Earth-shattering, but still nice. There is this open, airy, aromatic quality to it, but still has a little bit of a backbone to it, thanks to the woods and cardamom. This opens up nicely with lime/green-citrus and mint. Not too sharp or bitter off my skin at all. I'm positive the note list on Fragrantica is incomplete, because there must be lavender in this, and it makes itself known pretty quickly when the green-citrus dies down a little (after ~10 minutes). The ingredients seem well blended for the price point (can be found for $40-$50 AUD if you look for it), and you'll have a hard time offending people with this scent.

Longevity and projection seems to be a little fleeting. I can smell this for about 3, maybe 4 hours at best, however I have received compliments after the 5 hour mark, using two sprays on the neck, and one on each wrist.

The compliment factor for me is surprisingly good with this fragrance. I usually don't get a lot of unsolicited compliments from either strangers, or people I know in general. However, this fragrance has gotten me compliments from women whom I don't know around my workplace, ranging in age from 20's to 40's (I'm 23 myself).

I don't think this fragrance shares a lot of the typical "Legend" DNA at all. Having said this, I'm yet to get my nose on the original Legend, but own Legend Intense and Legend Spirit, and whilst those two fragrances share some similarities to an extent, Special Edition 2014, seems to be a black sheep, so to speak.

Perhaps best suited for Spring, hot Summer nights or warmer Autumn weather, this is my favourite fragrance from the Legend series.
